loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma del Carmen C. de 48 años de edad reside en Tacuba en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive con su esposo, junto al cual trabajan arduamente día con día para poder seguir adelante y poder vivir una vida digna. Vilma comercializa ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual la vende en las calles de Tacuba. A pesar del peligro de vender su ropa en las calles, ella se esfuerza por vender lo más posible cada día, es por esta razón por la cual ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda tener la capacidad de poder comprar más ropa y poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
48-year old Vilma del Carmen C. and her husband live in Tacuba in Ahuachapán department. They both work hard every day in order to get ahead and live a decent life. Vilma sells men’s and women’s clothing in the streets of Tacuba. Despite the danger of selling in the street, she puts in a lot of effort to sell as much as possible every day. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy more clothing so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Philomena is a trader. She trades in salt. She buys bags of salt from cargo cars that come round to distribute. She treks to sell in nearby towns and also supplies it to food vendors. Philomena has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt to trade

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Martha Julia R. F. de 47 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ilopango, junto a su compañero de vida, el cual trabaja como motorista del transporte público y sus dos hijos. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Es por lo cual Martha invirtió sus ahorros en una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual nació con la iniciativa de tener una estabilidad económica. Martha solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando productos como embutidos, detergentes, pan y otros productos más, esto lo espera lograr a por medio de dicho préstamo, ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseer la tienda no ha contado con el dinero necesario para invertir más en ella debido a que la mayoría de las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Martha Julia R. F. is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Llopango along with her life partner, who works as a public transportation driver, and their 2 children. Since the salary of her husband is very low, she decided 8 years ago to start her own business, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. For this reason Martha invested her savings in a store that sells perishables, which came into being as a result of her drive to have more economic stability. Martha requests a loan to invest in her store, buying products like sausage, detergent, bread and other items. She hopes to achieve this through the means of this loan, since in spite of having the store for a number of years she has not had money to invest in it, since the majority of the earnings have been used to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sausage, detergent and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et de 3 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 9 ans et a eu 18 expérience en matière de crédit. elle fait de la broderie et parallèlement elle vend de l'encens. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a 45-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. Three other children are under her care. She has been a member of a ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for nine years and has 18 years experience with credit matters. She does embroidery, in addition to which she sells incense. Her income allows her to participate in the improvement of family living conditions and bolster her savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activities

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz  N. is a 30 year old man who sells building materials in Agsu city. He is married and has 2 children. He started his business in 1998 with a starting capital of $100. Now, his monthly turnover is about $300. Gunduz would like to take a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to sell.

loans.name: Eung

texts.en:
Eung Y., 60, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  They have three children.  She sells food, earning approximately $4 per day.  She is able to cover her family expenses, especially their children’s education. She has been in business since 1979. 

Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day.  Y. wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to transport grass for sale.  This is her second loan from CREDIT.  (Y. is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: Buy a motorbike with a trailer

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Soutoura sont des  femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kapaga, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents. 
Elles font  la transformation des noix de karité en beurre qu’elles vendent.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter chacune 200kg de noix de karité (pour les transformer en beurre de karité). 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes è Zégoua et à Kadiolo ville, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of Soutoura Group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kapaga in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. This is their third solidarity loan. They repaid their previous two loans on schedule. They produce and sell butter from shea nuts. They will use their new loan to buy each 200 kilograms of shea nuts and transform them into shea butter. They get their supplies in the nearby villages and sell their final product in the cities of Zégoua and Kadiolo for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 CFA francs each, of which part will go into savings and meeting family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea nuts

loans.name: Lout

texts.en: Mrs. Lout P. owns a store in front of her home where she sells breakfast foods to people who are her nearby neighbors. She earns around $7 per day. She lives with her one child and her husband in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the city of Cambodia. In order to help support the family’s expenses, Mrs. Lout P.’s husband is a local farmer and also works as a temporary employee. Lout P. will be using her first loan to decorate the outside of her food shop to attract her customers. With any money remaining from the loan, she will buy ingredients and other attractive furniture for her shop.

loans.use: To decorate the outside of her food shop.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is 33 years old, divorced and the mother of three children. She lives in the village of Nianing, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years. She has paid back her previous loans on time. 

Madame S.'s main activity consists of running a small restaurant. With this loan, she wants to further equip her restaurant. The revenue from this business allows her to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To further equip her restaurant

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 46 años, vive en la ciudad Urubamba y tiene cuatro hijos (Fredy, Jhordy, Naysha y Margarita). Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender pollos y pescado en el mercado central de Urubamba, Celsa vende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la noche de lunes a viernes. Ya son doce años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar pollo y pescado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a sus hijos.  

Emperatriz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Emperatriz belongs to the “Sayhua” Communal Bank in the Arariwa Association. She is 46 years old, lives in Urubamba city, and has four children (Fredy, Jhody, Naysha and Margarita). She has participated in the communal bank for a year and a half. Her business is selling chickens and fish in Urubamba’s main market, Celsa. She sells from six in the morning until seven in the evening, Monday through Friday. She has been in this business for 12 years and her business is going very well. She needs a loan to buy chicken and fish. Her goal is be enable her children to become professionals. Emperatriz is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and she promises to make her payments according to the time line.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken and fish

loans.name: María Tenais

texts.es:
María Tenais es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por tener a su población concentrada en pequeñas áreas rurales que distan una de la otra, sus actividades económicas principales son la agricultura y la crianza y venta de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio tiene muy buena acogida ya que la zona donde vive se encuentra alejada de la ciudad y los vecinos siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de consumo diario; María es consciente de esta situación, por ello se esfuerza por conseguir productos de calidad y por brindar siempre un buen trato, de modo que pueda seguir trabajando con la misma clientela y por consiguiente, sus ganancias no disminuyan.

Las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia, María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas abarrotes, de modo que pueda captar mas clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Tenais es una madre entregada a su familia y que desea seguir creciendo como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive ella es muy estimada y conocida por sus vecinos los cuales la consideran una mujer alegre y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Tenais lives with her children and husband in the Insculas section of the Olmos district, an area whose population is concentrated in small rural zones separated one from another. Her major economic activities are farming and raising and selling animals. She is in the Lambayeque province, located more than two hours form Chiclayo. For five years now she has been engaged in selling basic provisions and groceries in a shop located in her home. Her business is well received, since the area where she lives is far from the city, and her neighbors come to her to pick up items they consume daily. Maria is aware of this circumstance, and thus tries to get quality products and offer good customer service, so as to continue working with the same customers and not diminish her earnings. She uses what she earns from this business to support her husband by supporting the family. Maria wishes to grow her business by purchasing more provisions, so as to attract more customers. For this reason she is making this first request to Edpyme Alternative, for a loan of 1,000 new soles. Maria Tenais is totally devoted to her family and would like to grow as a businesswoman, to offer her family a better living standard. People in her area think highly of her and she is known by her neighbors as a happy, reliable woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun U. is 33 years old and a villager from Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns three hectares of land to cultivate rice. Her husband (pictured with her) earns a small income to support his family by making and selling big pots. To support the farming and big pot businesses, Mrs. Savoeun U. has decided to ask for a loan to bU. rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and cement for her husband's business. The couple has two children – one attends a local school while the youngest is one year old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and cement for her husband's big pot business

loans.name: Maria Segunda

texts.es:
Maria Segunda M. O. tiene 60 años de edad. Es casada y vive con su esposo en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos: Rebeca (31), Néstor (26), Clemencia (25), Bélgica (22) y Cecilia (20), 
Maria es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura. Cultiva maíz y un poco de arbejas para el consumo de la familia. Hace las compras en San Pablo y las ventas en el terreno a los comerciantes. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y semillas.  Dice que el crédito le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de la semilla. Su sueño es comprar un lote de terreno para construir su casa. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son la sequía y las enfermedades y plagas que atacan a los cultivos.  

Le gusta pasar tiempo en las fiestas espirituales con los amigos y la familia, y en sus ratos libres ir de visita donde sus hijos, que no viven en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Segunda M. O. is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the canton of San Miguel, Bolívar Province. She has 5 children: Rebeca (31), Néstor (26), Clemencia (25), Bélgica (22) and Cecilia (20). Maria is a member of the Santiagopamba rural bank in San Pablo, which is half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The majority of the bank's members work in agriculture as a source of income for their families. Maria works in agriculture. She grows corn and some peas for her own family. She purchases her produce in San Pablo and sells it to merchants. Droughts, plant disease and insect plagues are a challenge. She has requested the loan to buy fertilisers and seeds. The loan will help her to improve the quality of the seeds. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to build a house. She enjoys spending her time at spiritual festivals with her friends and family. She likes to spend her free time visiting her children, who do not live locally.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds

loans.name: Hada Francis

texts.es: Hada Francis tiene 46 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que tiene la oportunidad de financiamientos. Y al encontrarse en la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos es que sigue con este negocio. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de pinturas de unas, pinturas de labios, bolsos, sabanas, toallas. Desea llegar a tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Hada Francis is 46 years old. She is a tenacious and responsible woman, and the activity she dedicates herself to is running a general store. She has been working in this field for more than 5 years, and this is not the first time she has had the chance to ask for a loan. Willing to increase her earnings, she keeps on running this activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy nail polish, lipsticks, handbags, bed sheets, towels. She wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa P. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as breads, eggs, soap for laundry, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $135 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lerio, Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling religious articles, vegetable vending and running a general store.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her religious articles business. Her goal is to continue to save up for their future, provide a good education for her children and to sustain their daily needs.

Cecilia E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Don Salomón es un pequeño comerciante desde hace once años, con una pulpería el cual comenzó con poco, y dinero propio.
He venido aumentando el capital con préstamos que Afodenic ha dado el cual ha logrado la oportunidad del crédito.
Invirtiendo en productos de librería ya que son productos accesibles y de rotación a si como de  gran utilidad durante el año escolar.
Con este financiamiento lograra un anexo a su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones personales. En donde comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, entre otros logrando así la obra.
texts.en:
Don Salomón is a small businessman who opened his store eleven years ago using his own money. He started with very little, but he has been able to increase his capital with the help of credit opportunities with AFODENIC in which he was able to secure loans. Salomón has invested in office supplies since these products are widely used and always in demand, especially during the school year.

With this loan, he hopes to build an extension to his home that will improve his personal living conditions. He plans to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, crossbeams, and other items needed to perform the work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
La   Sra. Elba Rosa Dávila, trabaja de lunes a domingo de las 8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en su negocio venta de ropa, ella vende ambulante y la fritanga los fines de semana de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche.
Es madre de familia de tres hijos y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El préstamo otorgado es para la compra de mercadería para invertir en su negocio.
Ha trabajado con ceprodel seis préstamos y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería a hora cuenta con un negocio más solido y podrá competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Elba Rosa Dávila works from Monday through Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening, in her business selling clothes. She sells them on a mobile basis, and she also sells fried foods on weekends, from 5 in the evening until 9 at night. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are of school age. The loan granted to her is for buying merchandise to invest in her business. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy merchandise. Now, she has a more solid business and can hold her own with the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing as well as supplies for preparing fried foods

loans.name: Shuru's Group

texts.en:
Shuru S., the leader of the group, is 56, married, and has raised two sons and four daughters, most of whom are married and living separately with their families. Their youngest son lives with them and helps with housework. Shuru and her husband are pensioners engaged in cattle breeding. Selling the cattle after fattening them, they make money to cover their family expenses. With money received from the loan, Shuru wants to purchase a calf for breeding.

Surma S., the treasurer of the group, is a 48-year-old married mother of two sons and a daughter, all employed. Surma works as a teacher of chemistry at school and her husband is a farmer engaged in cattle breeding. Surma applied for the loan because she wants to purchase a cow in order to increase their number of cattle. In the future she wants to see her sons get married.

Anarhan A., 42 and married, has a nine-year-old daughter attending school. Anarhan and her husband work in a factory, and with the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a washing machine in order to improve their living conditions. In the future they are planning to purchase a vehicle.

Aliza U. is 22. Five years ago, after an initial investment of 15000 soms, her parents built a store. Aliza now sells convenience goods in that store, earning 25000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to save money and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela T. is from the village of East Poblacion, Rizal. She is 60 years old, a widow, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she grows corn to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $65 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Rosela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for corn production. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra A. is from Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old. Petra is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Petra owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Petra has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Petra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. Petra is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Petra from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar V. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and infant baby in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia.  He and his family live together in their own ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his parents' yard. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their two month old son.

Enhbaatar operates a flour, rice and hay selling business out of a shipping container at the local market. He worked for a construction company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, after graduating from his university in 2009. In February 2010, Enhbaatar started his grocery selling business by renting the container.  In addition he also conducts a class on model planes, based on his previous experience from attending the Robocon technical competition, to supplement his earnings.

Enhbaatar is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase hay for cattle to sell.

loans.use: To purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. K. is thirty-five years old, married, and has five children aged between fourteen and two years old. Her business is located at Mariakani estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

She provides tailoring services to the local people. She also makes clothes and displays them for sale to her customers. She has been in this business for fifteen years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is tied-up capital since some customers order clothes to be made and then refuse to pick up the clothes, and so she has to put them on display for other people to buy them later. This, she says, slows her business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy materials to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and even start selling materials to other tailors. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Yolanda Q. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo de clima frió, tiene como atractivos turísticos la laguna de Cochapamba la que se encuentra llena de Totora, la colina de Tasqui la que tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la parroquia. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 16, 12 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija  estudia en la universidad y sus dos hijos en el colegio. Su esposo es de profesión arquitecto. Gracias al sacrificio y esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han llegado a construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Yolanda labora en la tienda que tiene hace 15 años, trabaja en ella de lunes a sábados desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche, debido a que en la mañana se dedica al arreglo de su hogar, también se dedica a la cría de animales que son para su consumo.

Se encuentra como socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y le gusta ya que comparte con sus amigas momentos de alegría, el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda. Su meta es acabar su casa ya que aun le falta realizar algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda Q. is a member of the Corazón de María Community Bank. She lives in the parish of Valle which is located south-east of Cusco. The climate there is cool. Local tourist attractions include Cochapamba Lake with its plentiful bullrushes and the Tasqui hill with its beautiful view of Cuenca and the parish. The local people are farmers and raise livestock.

Yolanda is 43 years old, married, and has four children aged 22, 16, 12, and 1. Her eldest daughter is a university student, and her two sons attend high school. Her husband is an architect. Through hard work and a lot of effort the couple has managed to build their own home.
 
Doña Yolanda has run a store for the last fifteen years where she works Mondays through Saturdays from 2 pm to 8 pm. In the mornings she looks after household chores. She also raises animals for the family to eat.

Yolanda has been a member of the community bank for three years and enjoys having fun with her friends there. This new loan will be used to buy stock for her store. Her goal is to finish the house which still needs a few more repairs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mirtha Janett

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a sus familiares en el sector San Martín, una zona marginal que se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable, localizada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en el exterior de su domicilio. Ella cuenta con un carrito sanguchero en donde realiza sus ventas de lunes a sábado durante la noche. Debido al buen trato que suele brindar a sus clientes actualmente cuenta con bastante demanda. El negocio le permite tener los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante a sus hijos y colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Mirtha desea adquirir insumos para ampliar su negocio. Ella planea comprar carne de pollo, aceite, papas, etc. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a mother, she is 28 years old and she lives together with her family in the region of San Martin, a suburban region neighboring the city of Lambayeque. It is a commercial region located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells hamburgers from her home. She has a sandwich cart from where she makes her sales from Mondays to Saturdays in the evenings. Given the excellent client service she provinces she always enjoys a great demand. This business gives her the income she needs to support her children and to contribute to the household finances. 

Mirtha wishes to purchase more ingredients for her business. She plans to purchase chicken meat, cooking oil, potatoes etc. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her burger stand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two little school-aged children. He works as a sugar, dairy and food products distributor in the east and north of Lebanon. He works as a traveling salesman, selling products to local markets wholesale. He has also worked as a local school driver since 2003. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expense. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and he is thankful for the results.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory, his business sales and therefore his profits. He believes that his business will improve over the long term.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Oralia Floridalba

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cady de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Oralia, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca omnilife, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, entre los productos que más vende están el Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star bien y Biocron, la mayoría de estos son muy solicitados por sus clientes, lleva en esta clase de negocio ya por dos años y nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star bien y Biocron y otros productos más. Esta en el Banco Comunal por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus metas son tener algún dia un local.
texts.en:
In the area known as Cady in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the Tamarind royalty, the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Grow) Community Bank meets every 15 days. This place is very lovely and the people very friendly.

In this place we meet Oralia. She is 43 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has four children who are 22, 18, 16, and 12 years old. All of them go to the university, high school, or elementary school, and all of them still live with her. Her husband is a professional chauffer.

She sells natural products from the Omnilife brand. Her sales method is to go door to door for orders. She works five days a week. She delivers her products on credit and collects every 15 days. Among the products that she sells most are Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star Bien, and Biocron. The majority of these are highly requested by her customers. She has been in this business for two years already and she tells us it is going very well.

This loan will go to purchase Aloe, Pawer Maker, Star Bien, and Biocron, and other products. She has been with the community bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the resources for going after loans. Her goal is to have her own store someday.

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en casa de unos familiares. Hace más de 4 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, negocio del cual su esposo lo ayuda. Este trabajo lo realiza en el exterior de su casa, lugar que acondiciono para llevar a cabo un taller mecánico y en donde también ofrece el servicio de pintura de vehículos. De esta manera ella y su esposo se reparte el trabajo, donde él se encarga del mantenimiento de los vehículos y Eliana se encarga de buscar clientes. Considera que este trabajo es rentable, y eso le ayuda mucho a mantener a su familia. Para el futuro desea tener más carros y tener un taller de mecánica bien equipada. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su carro y mejorar el servicio de transporte
texts.en:
Eliana is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a relative's home.  She has been running a transportation service for over four years, with the help of her husband.  She also has set up an auto repair garage outside the home where she offers paint jobs.  She and her husband share the work.  He is in charge of vehicle maintenance and she looks for customers.

She claims the business provides a good income and helps her support her family.  She hopes to be able to have a larger fleet of cars in the future and have a better equipped garage.  

This is her first loan through MFP.  She is very grateful for the financial support and enjoys being part of the communal bank since all of its members are people she knows who are responsible and supportive.  She also thanks the lenders for helping her expand her business.  She plans to use the loan to buy auto repair parts and improve her transportation service.

loans.use: To buy auto repair parts in order to provide better transportation service

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been operating a greengrocer shop for two years.  She also does dairy farming to supplement her income.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access loans easily.  She has requested 20,000 Kes from Faulu Kenya which she will use to buy vegetables, mangoes, and bananas.  She hopes to expand her business and sell wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, mangoes and bananas

loans.name: Los Dávila Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Dávila está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Meyling Francisca Dávila Rojas quien se dedica al comercio de frutas al inicio hace ocho años aproximadamente empezó comprando los productos por libras en la actualidad compra las cosechas de tamarindo, mango, jocote y mamón.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 10 y 5 años y una bebe de cuatro meses por los cuales labora arduamente junto a su esposo y suegro. Dávila con el crédito comprara cosecha de jocote y mamón.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Modesta  Francisca J. de 19 años quien vende tamarindo, jocote y mamón y Milagro de Jesús Dávila quien comercializa frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The los Dávila group has three hardworking and entrepreneurial members. One of them is Meyling Francisca Dávila Rojas who sells fruit. Eight years ago, she started buy products by the pound. Now she is buying tamarind, mango, jocote and papaya.
She has three children-a ten year old, a five year old and four month old baby. They are reason she works hard along with her husband and father-in-law. Dávila will buy jocote and papaya with the loan. 
The other members of the group are 19 year old Modesta Francisca J. who sells tamarind, jocote and papaya and Milagro de Jesús Dávila who sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy jocote and papaya

loans.name: Viviana Del Carmen

texts.es: Viviana E.  tiene un negocio en el centro de Barranquilla, zona comercial de esta ciudad; allí confecciona ropa femenina, masculina e infantil, actividad  de la que deriva su experiencia, desde que trabajó en un taller de confecciones y aprendió el proceso y la forma de comercializar. Así fue como inició su taller, en un principio asociada,  pero su empeño y motivación de crecer y generar mayores ingresos para lograr el bienestar y la educación de su hija de 12 años, la impulsaron a independizarse y desde este mismo momento, emprendió su gran desafío poyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha recibido 7 créditos y ha logrado crecer en su infraestructura, pues adquirió maquinarias que le ayudaron a reducir los tempos de producción y la calidad de sus prendas, así como también consiguió comprar materias primas en mayor volumen, que le ayudaron a tener una mejor oferta  de sus productos. Aunque no con todo lo que Viviana ha hecho ha obtenido éxitos, siempre ha salido adelante, como cuando gastó mucho dinero en disolver la sociedad o cuando quiso montar un almacén que no le dio resultados. Viviana siempre vive  motivada a progresar,  porque tiene una hija por quien velar ella sola,  y más aún,  porque sus principios empresariales de superación personal así se lo indican, por eso su máxima es llegar a convertir su pequeño taller en una gran fábrica de confecciones, donde mucha gente tenga su fuente de ingresos y beneficie a las familias colombianas; ella en este propósito irá poco a poco escalando, por eso con su credikia comprará telas e insumos para fabricar bolsos, con el propósito de iniciar en firme, la diversificación de sus productos.
texts.en:
Viviana E. has a business in the center of Barranquilla, in the commercial area of the city.  There she makes women's, men's and children's clothes.  She has gained experience in her business.  She used to work in a dressmaking workshop and learned the manufacturing process and also how to sell.  She then set up her own workshop.  At first she worked with a partner but her commitment and motivation to grow and make more income in order to provide for her 12 year-old daughter's well-being and education, drove her to start working independently.  She undertook her great challenge, supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization from which she has received 7 loans and managed to increase her infrastructure.  She acquired machines that helped her to reduce her production time and increase the quality of her garments.  She was also able to buy raw materials in larger volumes which helped her to have a better range of products to offer.

Although everything Viviana has done hasn't been successful, she has always managed to get ahead.  For example, she spent a lot of money in dissolving her partnership and she wanted to set up a store but it was not successful.  Viviana is always motivated to make progress because she has a daughter for whom she is solely responsible and because her business principles for personal improvement demand it.  For this reason, her highest priority is to manage to turn her small workshop into a large garment factory which provides lots of people with a source of income and benefits Colombian families.  Viviana will gradually work towards achieving this goal.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy fabrics and supplies for making bags with the aim of starting to diversify her product line.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies for making bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase textiles and cloth.

loans.name: Francisco Pacheco (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco. Esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad del Valle por estar rodeada de majestuosas y hermosas  montañas.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace un tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para lograr conseguir mejores beneficios a través de su grupo, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades como: comercio en general, servicios, venta de comida entre otras cosas.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Vilma M. L., tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace varios años de la cual tiene dos hijos de 21 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas). También vende ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Dice que le encanta vender y que lo mas  salida tiene son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos, lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 7 años y va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa de todo tipo como: camisetas, pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta el Banco por la ayuda que recibe para poder salir adelante.

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
In the Francisco Pacheco neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the Manabí capital, the "Francisco Pacheco" communal bank meets every two weeks.  This city has been known for many years as Valley City because it is surrounded by majestic, beautiful mountains.

Some time ago the members decided to join together in an effort to obtain more profits through their group.  They are all involved in different businesses such as general sales, services and food sales, among others. 

Here we meet Mrs. Vilma M. L. who is 42 years old, has a common-law husband and two children, ages 21 and 15, who are in college and school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has an informal business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and ladies' accessories); and also sells clothing by catalogue.  Her working hours are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every day, which she does door-to-door on an order basis.  She delivers the products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She loves to sell and claims her most popular-selling products are perfumes because of their quality.  She's been involved in the business for seven years now and it is going very well.

The loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all types of clothing such as t-shirts, trousers, blouse, children's clothing, etc.  She's been in the communal bank since its inception and likes the support she receives in order to get ahead.

Her dream is to one day have a large business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, trousers, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila de 39 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Cirilo de 47 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Cirila trabaja todos los días en sus tierras, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas. Siembra de todo un poco, entre ellos el cacao, café, y maní  pues sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad y son vendidos en el mercado de San Francisco. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y menciona que la parte que más gusta es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar en el desarrollo de sus plantas, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus cultivos le resulta muy difícil. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará trampas para insectos e insecticidas para combatir la plaga que perjudica sus frutos.
texts.en:
Cirila is 39 years of age and a local of Quimbiri. She is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Cirilo, 47, and her four beloved children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

Together with her husband, Cirila works every day on the land and through her efforts she has created very productive crops. She plants a bit of everything, including cocoa, coffee and nuts, as she knows that every vegetable that she grows will be of good quality which she can later sell in the market of San Francisco. Cirila and her husband have spent twenty years in this line of work and what she likes the most is protecting her plantations from insect plagues that can be detrimental to the plants' development. Nevertheless, having to transport the crops is very difficult for her. Cirila hopes to be able to get the necessary funds together to purchase new plots of land for the future of her business. 

This is Cirila's twelfth loan with MFP and their support helps her to develop her business. She is very proud to be a responsible member of her community bank. With the loan that she is applying for she will purchase insect traps and insecticide to combat the insect plague that damages her fruit.

loans.use: to purchase traps and insecticide

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old and married. Nancy owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling blankets, pillowcases, bed sheets and bath towels in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products such as pillowcases and blankets. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as pillowcases and blankets.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan sells beans and sugar. She is 28 years old, married with 2 children, and both of them go to school. Susan took out a loan to stock more beans and sugar to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.es:
Verónika  tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa de sus  padres desde hace  10 años, debido a su separación. La casa donde Verónika vive se encuentra en el distrito de Eten- Chiclayo. Esta es una comunidad en vías de desarrollo, integrada por gente emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación.

Verónika  posee una bodega de comestibles en su propio domicilio, su bodega cuenta con gran afluencia de clientes debido a la buena calidad de servicio que ella viene ofreciendo desde hace 3 años, además existe variedad en cuanto a los productos que su tienda posee. Verónika cuenta con clientela establecida a la que vende sus productos al crédito y al contado.

Ella desea invertir en su negocio pues este le trae grandes satisfacciones. Es por ello que Verónika aspira a ampliar su bodega y convertirla en la más surtida de su comunidad. Para cumplir sus objetivos Verónika ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de abarrotes,  golosinas y bebidas que le permitirán surtir su negocio. Además comprará una refrigeradora para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónika is 30 years old and has lived with her parents for 10 years due to her separation from her husband.  The house where Verónika lives is in the Eten-Chiclayo district. This is a developing community, made up of enterprising people who have a great desire to succeed.

Verónika has a grocery store in her own home.  The grocery store has a large influx of customers due to the high quality of service she has offered for the last 3 years, and also the variety of products that her store stocks.  Verónika has an established clientele to whom she sells her products for credit and cash.

She wants to invest in her business as it brings her great satisfaction.  This is why Verónika aims to expand her grocery store, and make it the best stocked in her community.  To achieve her objectives, Verónika has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa which will go towards buying groceries, snacks and drinks to help her stock her business.  She will also buy a refrigerator to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married and is 48 years old. She has a retail shop business. She sells groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, instant cups of noodles, soft drinks, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, detergents and other goods needed. According to her, the grocery store she manages is improving. She would like to expand it more to sustain further the needs of her family. Alicia has had this business for five years.

Alicia is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. Each month, Alicia earns about PHP 50,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her grocery store so that it will become more comfortable for her customers. Alicia prays that her request for a loan will be granted to make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Landouard

texts.fr: Landouard  est un commerçant, il est âgée de 47 ans, il est marié, est il est né au Burundi.  Il a 4 enfants  entre 4 et 14 ans, 3 vont à l’école,il vit avec son petit frère et sa petite soeur.Son niveau d’éducation est  primaire. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va acheter  50sacs de riz, 20 cartons du jus ,10 jerricans  d’huile d’arachides et autre marchandises pour  son commerce et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  l’amélioration de l’accueille pour attire la clientèle et faire le marketing de son boutique pour conquérir le marché. Dans l’avenir il veut devenir le grand commerçant, et le grand  distributeur dans  la région de grand lac, pour sa famille il veut éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université.
texts.en:
Landouard is a merchant, 47 years old and married. He was born in Burundi. He is the father of four children aged between 4 and 14, with three of them attending school. He lives with his younger brother and his younger sister. He finished elementary education.

This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will buy 50 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of juice, 10 jerrycans of groundnut oil and some other goods for his store, as well as pay for labor. His growth strategy for his business consists in giving a warmer welcome to customers and doing some marketing for his store to increase his market share. In future he wants to become an important merchant and wholesaler in the area of the great lake for the benefit of his family. He wants to provide his children with education until university level.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of juice, 10 jerrycans of groundnut oil and some other goods for his store, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 38-year-old married man with 5 children. His eldest is 13 years old while the youngest is only 2 years old.

Sergio is a farmer who owns and tills land in Trinidad, Bohol. He grows rice crops and then sells his harvest to rice traders. He earns about 4,000 PHP (~$100) a month from farming. He works hard to increase his harvest and earnings. 

He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Sergio is hopeful that this loan will help his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Biishe

texts.en:
Biishe is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting materials to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a dressmaking school in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase cloth materials, embroidery and lace. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, embroidery and lace.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking 40-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom two are in school. For over ten years now, he has been farming to provide for his family. He makes an extra shilling through his motorcycle transport business. Previously he used to sell milk. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have a vehicle for commercial purposes. His dream is to own a piece of land and develop it. He is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy a chaff cutter. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and single. He supports his parents. He has been a farmer for the past four years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by a KADET staff member; he paid his previous loan well and in good time. He has applied for his third loan, which he will use to buy farm inputs. 

With the profits generated, he plans to expand his farm and venture into the livestock-keeping business. He dreams to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 56 años, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos mayores, quienes laboran y son independientes. Ella vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, en su propia casa. Luego que perdiera su esposo, se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante sola, es así que no descuido sus plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas. De ello depende continuar con el trabajo que por tiempo su esposo lo estuvo ejerciendo. Asimismo dichas plantas están cultivadas bajo un sistema técnico agrario debido a las capacitaciones y talleres de manejo de poda y control de insectos que recibe constantemente y ello garantiza una mejor calidad en su producción. Sus hijos son quienes la apoyan en el trabajo, pero hay momentos en que necesariamente debe contratar jornaleros para que lo ayuden en la cosecha, de esa manera será más rápida la extracción y selección de sus frutos. Este será su catorceavo crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas, por ello espera contar nuevamemte con su ayuda. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará sacos de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 56, a widow, and has four adult sons who all work and are independent. She lives in the town of Santa Rosa in her own house. After losing her husband, she saw that it was necessary to get ahead on her own. Thus, she did not neglect her cacao and coffee plants and her citrus trees, but rather continued with the work her husband had been doing for a long time. 

Guillermina’s plants are cultivated under an agricultural technical system based on training workshops in pruning and insect control that she constantly takes, and that ensures better quality production. Her sons help her with the work, but there are times when she must necessarily contract day laborer to help with the harvest and secure a more rapid selection and harvesting of the crops.

This will be her fourteenth loan with MFP and to date she has been very punctual with her payments. Therefore she hopes she can rely on you again. She will buy sacks of fertilizer with the 3,000 soles she is requesting and use it to improve the quality of her fields

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Cleofa

texts.en: Cleofa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.  Cleofa has operated a retail shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cleofa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cleofa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ali has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new products like shoes, and will help Ali to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to open new branches. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new products like shoes for resale

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is married to Beth and together they have two children who are both in school. He has a food stall and has been in the business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 12,500 from the business.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to buy items for the food stall and cereals for sale. He will enlarge the food stall with the anticipated profits. His dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food items like maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Jason Angel

texts.es:
Jason de 22 años, aprendió la fabricación de waipes (telas utiles para construccion y pintura) gracias a la ayuda de su madrina quien trabaja en su casa sin ninguna incomodidad.

Trabaja solo de todos los días de 2pm a 6pm. No está casado trabaja solamente para el bienestar de su futuro.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar telas, herramientas para la elaboracion de los waypes. Su meta es seguir trabajando en este negocio para poder seguir adelante y poder abrir un sucursal en otro lado.
texts.en:
Jason, age 22, learned to make waipes (useful fabric used in painting and construction) with the help of his godmother, who works very comfortably from home.

Jason works alone every day from 2:00 pm to 6:00 pm. He is not married, so he works only for his own benefit.

With this loan, he wants to buy fabric and tools for making the waipes. His goal is to keep working in this business in order to keep getting ahead. He wants to be able to open another store in another area.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tools.

loans.name: Sinoko A Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Sinoko A group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to receive One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Patrick is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Toudonou Henri

texts.fr: Toudonou Henri est âgé de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Toudonou Henri est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Félicienne. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Toudonou Henri exerce depuis douze ans le métier d’ajusteur. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Toudonou Henri contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Toudonou Henri sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Toudonou Henri a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Toudonou Henri is 31 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a market trader called Félicienne. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. The children live with their parents. The couple works together to see to the family's needs. In order to meet these needs Toudonou Henri has worked as a building fitter for twelve years. Thanks to the revenue that he generates from this he is able to contribute to his family's needs. To meet growing customer demand he is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. His first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase building fitting matiers (iron  bars and tiles)

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie, a 34-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells coconuts, bananas and rice by the kilogram for the last five years. Having joined HSPFI this year, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more rice, coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with four children. He has been rearing poultry for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 25,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy poultry feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Felicita Gloria

texts.es:
La profesora Felicita se desempeña como docente desde hace 10 años, impartiendo en este año escolar a niños de preescolar, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, ambos son trabajadores, responsables con alto espiritud de superaciòn personal, son una familia bien unida, es una mujer reconocida en el Municipio por su humildad y sencillez.   

Solicita su  Crèdito para construir una habitaciòn en su casa, ella se siente muy contenta con la instituciòn por que se le ha apoyado con los creditos y de esta forma a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su nucleo familiar.                                       

Sueña con gozar de salud, estabilidad laboral y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Felicita has been a teacher for 10 years, and this year she is teaching kindergarden. She can count on her husband’s support, as both are responsible, hardworking people with a great desire to improve in life. Theirs is a very close-knit family, and Felicita is well-known in her community for her being a simple and humble person.

She is requesting a loan to build a room in her house. She is very satisfied with the Institution because it has supported her through the loans, thus allowing her to improve her family’s standard of living.

She drams of staying healthy, of enjoying working stability and that her family will reaming as close-knit as it is now.

loans.use: To build a room in her house.

loans.name: Nail Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Nani, 50 years old, still has two children in school: 12-year-old Anggi and 15-year-old Raka. Her business is selling exercise books, notebooks, clothes and watches, if any orders come from her friends. She has already run this business for five years. She does not make a lot of profit from the sale of her books and sometimes she gives four or five books free to pupils who cannot afford them.

Nani will use this loan to buy notebooks and exercise books. She has a plan to have a bookstore and open a noodle shop. She is excited about her business, because she can help out poor pupils and run this business as her hobby.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and exercise books to sell to pupils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy more bananas, pineapples, mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be used to buy products for his store and to increase sales, and therefore his income.

loans.name: Judith Nabalayo

texts.en: Judith is a widow with two children in primary school. With training in pharmacy, Judy was able to open up the only drug shop in her home area. With the first loan from PEMCI, she was able to stock her shop, and she repaid her loan successfully. She now looks forward to getting another loan so she can improve her service, which is vital to her customers in the area.

loans.use: Boost her business

loans.name: Caterina

texts.en:
Catarina C. P., 45, buys woven clothing to sell to others. Catarina lost her house to Hurricane Stan in October, 2005, so she no longer has her own house. The land swallowed up her house and everything she owned. The recovery has been slow.

Before the hurricane, she used to weave huipiles, colorful Mayan women’s blouses, in her home with a reliable loom. Now she lives in a rented two room house made with concrete block; the old metal window-frames no longer have glass, so she piles up rocks in the window for a bit of privacy. She has a table, an ancient school chair, a mat to sleep on, and a tiny loom she uses to weave cloth bracelets. On the table she displays her complete inventory of eight scarves that she has managed to buy from a friend.

With this loan, Catarina plans to buy 24 chicks and feed them. She will sell them when they are full grown. Until that time, she’ll continue to buy yarn and weave the bracelets that are supporting her and her husband. Her ultimate goal is to build a new home near her son’s home up on the hill in one of the many villages near Lake Atitlan.

Although she can make 100 bracelets a day, she cannot afford medical care. Currently, she has a rotten tooth that gives her great pain and there is not enough extra money to go to the dentist.

loans.use: Purchase chicks to raise

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis, as he's affectionately called in the neighborhood, continues to work in the woodworking shop he founded many years ago despite falling demand for his carefully handcrafted furniture. He is very hard-working and eager to do his best for his loyal customers but in order to continue making furniture he needs to replace his old tools and purchase wood. This woodworking shop is the only source of income for the family. Don Luis hopes to borrow $325 and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you and eagerly await this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis como cariñosamente lo llaman en el barrio desempeña su labor en una carpintería que construyó hace ya muchos años, a pesar de que la demanda por los artículos hechos a base del material que él moldea con sus ingeniosas manos, ha disminuido. Su ímpetu y clientes más antiguos siempre requieren de él.Las herramientas que adquirió años atrás; necesitan ser renovadas y también requiere mayor inversión en materia prima para seguir fabricando hermosos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El único ingreso familiar con el que cuenta día a día, se lo otorga su pequeña carpintería.Debido a ello Don Luis solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses, con este dinero él podrá adquirir herramientas nuevas para seguir fabricando los magníficos muebles a los que están acostumbrados sus asiduos clientes. Él y su familia apelan a tu generoso corazón para recibir noticias pronto.

loans.use: To buy new woodworking tools and wood.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro #3 - Working For The Future #3 Group

texts.en:
Teresa is asking for this loan so she can buy large sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. She says that by being able to buy sugar and rice (two common staples) at wholesale prices, she will be able to both save and earn more money.

She works hard because she wants nothing more than to be able to send her three children to the local university so that they can one day become professionals in whatever field they choose. She plans to use half of her income to continue improving her store, and half for tuition expenses for her children.

She says that she knows her life will be able to advance more with this loan, and she will be able to save a larger amount towards sending her children to the university here in Samaná. Teresa also wants to say thank you to everyone who is helping her make her dream come true and giving her children a brighter future.

NOTE: This $1500 loan will fund Teresa's business as well as five other businesses in her solidarity group. She and five other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through the Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil was born in 1961. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been repairing houses for 10 years. 
He goes to the houses of his clients and repairs their houses. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy necessary materials for repairing the houses to increase his income.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for repairing the houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: he needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati R. is a distributor. She buys beans, maize, ground nuts, and other such foods in bulk and distributes them in smaller quantities to her customers. She is married and has 3 children. She is working very hard to support her husband and to meet her family’s financial needs. Demand for her goods has increased, so she wants to increase her sales.

Fati is seeking $525 of additional capital to enable her buy more beans, maize, and ground nuts to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional beans, maize, and ground nuts in bulk to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
