Sarmila M. lives with her husband and two sons in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Her sons are in first and third grade.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Saroj M., make different types of traditional brass religious figures to the customer's requests. Due to the lack of money, they cannot meet the increasing demand of their customers. So Mrs. M. is requesting a loan to buy raw materials like wax and metal for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngugen Thi V. is 48 years old and joined the TYM Fund in 2002. She lives with her husband and 2 of their 4 children. One of her children studies in Russia, one is married and the other 2 children are still in school. The family's main business is running a milling machine, which generates a monthly income of about $250. The family also raises pigs, and sells them every three months. They sell a lot of rice, too.

Mrs. Ngugen Thi V. now wants to borrow $375 to invest in more livestock.

loans.use: Invest in livestock

loans.name: Tungulilege

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Tungulilege S.. She is married and has 4 children aged between 14 and 24. In 1994 Tungulilege established her fruit and vegetables business. Tungulilege requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit and vegetables in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you walk down the streets of Dar, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas, or sugarcane. For customers, these luscious fruits provide welcome refreshment from the searing heat, and for the sellers a regular, if limited, income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina inició el negocio debido a la enfermedad de su suegro, ya que se enfermó de la próstata y necesitaban dinero para su tratamiento, fue así como se convertieron en distribuidores de estos productos naturistas.al constatar que su suegro comenzó a tomar dichos productos y tuvo mejoría en su salud. Comenzó febrero de 2001, como distribuidora colocando posters donde anunciaba que además de ser distribuidores eran testigos de los beneficios de dichos productos. En la actualidad ya tiene un centro de apoyo en su casa donde capacita y preparo a la gente que se a iniciar y en donde organiza juntas con sus promotores y les muestra videos de testimonios de la gente que ha mejorado su salud; también recorre comunidades rurales en donde promociona los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para adquirir mas productos y venderlos en municipios cercanos, ya que le han funcionado mejor las ventas en esos lugares. Con tu ayuddda Josefina seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Adquirir mercancia

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Yu S., 54, typically makes US$ 10 each day as she sells pork, beef, rice, and Chinese noodles for breakfast, along with soft drinks and coffee. She lives in Prey Veng with her husband, Kung Chandara, and four of their children. Her husband helps with his wife’s business and together they have been looking for ways to diversify their income and improve their standard of living.

Yu S. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a car for one of her sons. With this new vehicle her son could operate his own taxi service, providing a new source of income for the family. She believes this investment will allow the family to increase its income in the long-term and looks forward to seeing how this money can be used.

loans.use: Purchase a car to run a taxi service

loans.name: Lusekelo

texts.en: Lusekelo M. is a businesswoman who sells a variety of soft drinks at Mwalimu Nyerere International Airport in Dar-es-Salaam Tanzania. The profit derived helps her to pay schools fees and feed her four children.  In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Amina's Kisonge Daima Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years. She is married with 2 children, 13 and 10 years old. She has been a clothes and shoe seller since 2004. Everyday she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Amina now requests a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Semeni, who also has a business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Biliki

texts.en: Biliki A. sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop.  She learned how to cook from her mother. Biliki is 27 years old and married with a child.  Biliki has a restaurant where she cooks foods like beans, rice, plantain, etc. She also sells drinks. Biliki is a LAPO client.  Biliki needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks to sell and also to buy a generator. She needs a generator because of the lack of electricity supply. She appreciates the generosity of Kiva lenders in helping to alleviate poverty. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a generator and drinks to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman with two children. She sells candies and waffles at the market. She purchases her goods from vendors in other villages and sells them in her town.

She has her constant clients who buy goods from her all the time. Now she wants a loan to buy more goods and offer  different types of candies and waffles to her clients.

loans.use: Purchasing more food products for resale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Doris has been in this business since 1998. She is a LAPO client. Doris needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cheri Main

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheri Main M. lives in a nuclear family in Thecho with her husband, son, and daughter. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Cheri's husband, Mr. Hari Gopal M., is a farmer. He works his own land. Both her son and daughter are in grade 12 in school.

Mrs. M. opened her own tailoring shop 2 year ago. She prefers to make custom-fitted lady's clothes like "kurta-salwar", blouses and other varieties of lady's dresses in her shop. She took tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her second loan from Kiva of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as cloth, thread, etc. for her tailoring work. She repaid her first Kiva loan in November 08.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
This is 38 year old Evelyne D. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 5 and 13. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants who are are orphans. Evelyne D. has been running a grocery business since 2006 and her business is selling different drinks such as soda and beer. She works at her business 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by two employees. Evelyne D. currently earns about 343USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase more drinks. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Evelyne thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells groceries and food supplies like maize, beans, and rice at BRM junction. Agnes has received junior high education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a merchant. Agnes has been selling groceries, food supplies such as maize, beans, and rice for about 8 years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy food supplies in larger quantities for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the family building she started with her husband.

loans.use: increase her capital to buy food supplies in larger quantities for re-sale

loans.name: Najma Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a 44-year-old married woman. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 44 years. Her husband's name is M. A.. He is a driver by profession and drives a 32-seat local bus. Najma baji is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are getting an education. Najma baji pays their school fees from her business sewing clothes. She sews clothes by taking orders from her relatives and from her neighbors. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle so that he is able to continue his work. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Naseem akhtar baji would like a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shaheen baji would like a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Sakina baji would like a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Muafia baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair the 32-seat bus

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng P., age 43, is a local palm climber. By climbing palm, he can tap palm juice from palm trees and then boil it to make palm sugar or turn it into palm wine to sell. He currently earns an average of US $3.00 each day to help feed his family. 

He is married to Eng, age 30, who helps him in the business, boiling palm juice into sugar to sell. The couple has four children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. 

Heng P. is asking for a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle that he can use to transport sugar to the market to sell. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta P. is 49 years old, a single mother who has 2 children and resides at Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She has a "carenderia" (cafe) business at the Public Market. Violeta is a micro-finance member and at present she's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000, her second small loan.  She wants to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, and seasonings so she can add menus for her "carenderia" or eatery.  She started her business with her own little capital and manages it by herself. Her future plan for her business is to be progressive; she hopes that all her children will finish their education and become successful, having good job someday.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as meat, spices, and seasonings

loans.name: Maura Gissela

texts.es: La  Sra. Maura tiene su negocio de venta de Variedades, como ser Ropa Usada, shampoo, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, sandalias, ella sale a vender a los vecinos de su colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, desde hace cuatro años y dos veces al mes ella va a su pueblo Leptarique, en el Departamento de la Paz, donde vive su familia y lleva mercaderia para entregar ya que es por encargo y aprovecha el viaje para ofrecer sus productos a otras personas, ella empezo su negocio solo con la venta de ropa usada, pero debido a que su esposo esta muy enfermo y ya no trabaja, ella se encarga de sostener sus tres hijos, ha tenido que ofrecer mayor variedad de productos como ser cremas, shampoo, perfumes, rinse, glass y otros para poder aumentar sus ingresos, se siente muy contenta porque le ha dado muy buenos resultados, ella es muy carismatica, trabajadora y muy responsable, necesita el credito ya que quiere comprar mas productos. Su sueño es poder aprender a leer y ver a sus hijos graduados de la secundaria, por eso trabaja muy duro todos los dias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura has a business in the sale of various items such as used clothing, shampoo, lotions, deodorant, perfume, and sandals, and she sells them in the area of her neighborhood, Jose Angel Ulloa. For 4 years, two times a month she has gone to her village, Lepatarique in the Department of la Paz, where she lives with her family, and brings merchandise to deliver which has been ordered and she takes the trip so as to offer her merchandise to other people. She started her business alone with the sale of used clothing, but, because her husband is very sick and cannot work and thus Maura is in charge of sustaining their three children, she has had to offer a greater variety of products such as lotions, shampoos, perfumes, glass, and other things to augment her earnings. She is very pleased because she has had much success. She is very charismatic, hardworking, and responsible. She needs this loan so she can buy more merchandise. Her dream it to learn how to read and to see her children graduate from secondary school. For this she works very hard every day.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy good for resale

loans.name: Elvira Alexandre

texts.pt:
Elvira Alexandre C. é natural de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 26; 23 e 15 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos, sustenta um irmão que vive com ele.

Elvira estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, a mais de 10 anos que Elvira vive de negocio qual aprendeu através da sua mãe que é comerciante, o negocio consiste na compra e venda produtos da primeira necessidade com destaque a farinha de milho que compra uma embalagem de 10kg por 130,00mt e vende por 210,00mt. Deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal liquido 3000,00mt.

Elvira solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente Elvira pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para compra de congelador afim de ver mariscos.
texts.en:
Elvira Alexandre C. is from Maputo, she is 42 years old and is married y has 3 children who are between 26, 23 and 15 years old. Besides two sons, she also supports a brother who lives with them. Elvira didn't finished school because of the lack of financial support, for the last 10 years Elvira lives from her business which she learned from her mother who is a salesperson, she buys and sells first need products, her main product is corn flour for which she buys 10kg for 130,00mt and sells for 210,00mt. This business has a net profit of 3000,00mt. Elvira is requesting the loan for the first time with Hluvuku and Kiva in order to increase her stock. In the future Elvira wants to request another loan in order to buy a freezer to sell seafood.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise, buy and sell of diverse products

loans.name: Ouyètiè  5 (On Se Connais) Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles soeurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants. 
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 55 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 5 is a group of married women of the village of Nitabogoro in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They average 35 years of age and at least 5 children each. They work mainly in growing peanuts and millet. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After having correctly repaid the first loan, they are now on their second farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting peanuts and millet; some minor supplies and equipment; and some fertilizers and the like, for farming. These items are gotten at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. After wintering, the crops are stored for a time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions with customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their agricultural products, an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilzers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. started her smoked fish sales nine years ago at Suhum, in the eastern region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty, good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand in the market center. She has a cunning spirit to convince her suppliers to win them for more fish when there is high demand of fish and supply is low. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and has them smoked at a nearby stand. She has a high customer base who will travel from surrounding villages to buy from her stand. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children. All of her children are currently in school. It is Mary’s desire to save more to provide her children with education. She is, therefore, requesting for loan support to buy adequate fish to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the village bank, called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’, which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita A., a 53-year old mother, is a rice grower. All of her children got married early, and it's she and her husband, Angelberto A. who live in their home. She wants to increase the normal size of their harvest.

She needs capital to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals needed to grow her farm. She thinks that by doing so, she can still support her children, and her grandchildren as well.

CEVI is helping her to achieve her dreams. She hopes that someday, she will be able to buy another hectare of farmland. With CEVI, she receives a loan, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and other chemicals

loans.name: Carolina Patricia

texts.es:
Carolina Patricia T. R. es una señora de 33 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La Esperanza localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Doña Gloria vive con sus dos pequeños hijos.

 Hace poco tiempo doña Carolina se separó de su esposo y debido a que sus dos hijos están pequeños ella desea incursionar como microempresaria instalando una “soda” (un pequeño restaurante de comida criolla) en su propia casa. Dice que de esta forma podrá  ayudar con los gastos en su casa y que además no tendrá que salir de su casa y dejar a sus hijos. Ella comenta que en el pasado ha trabajado en diferentes restaurantes y “sodas” por lo cual tiene bastante experiencia; también  ha visto que es un muy buen negocio y que en su comunidad habría una muy buena aceptación. 

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones) específicamente comprará mercadería para vender, también una refrigeradora, una freidora, una licuadora entre otros utensilios que necesita para iniciar el negocio, y así podrá brindar un buen servicio a sus vecinos.

Doña Carolina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Carolina is 33 years old and lives with her two small children in La Esperanza, a small rural community located in San Jose de Upala, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica. The region is dedicated to commerce, cattle-raising (for both meat and milk) and agriculture.

Recently, Carolina was separated from her husband and since her two children are small, she wished to start a micro-enterprise, installing a small restaurant serving local dishes in her own home. She says that in this manner she could help with household expenses and she would not have to go out of the house, leaving her children. In the past, she has worked in restaurants large and small, giving her sufficient experience. Also, she has seen that it is a very good business and that it would be well received in her community.

She needs to borrow $1,175 to buy merchandise to sell, plus a refrigerator, a deep fat fryer, and a blender, among other utensils necessary to start her business. This would enable her to provide good service to her neighbors.

Carolina belongs to La Esperanza Womens Community Credit organization, which helps women who are non-professionals or heads of households. It is one of 100 organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan. With it she hopes to continue her personal and economic development and to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF UTENSILS AND MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema Mnzava is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs the Beautiful Salon at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases goods from the wholesales cosmetics shops at Kariakoo city shopping center. Sales are highest over the three days of the weekend, from Friday to Sunday, when people are preparing themselves for the coming work week.

Using income from the business she has managed by herself to buy a plot for house construction in Dar es Salaam. She has been running the business for six years. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 Tanzanian shillings to boost up the business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El joven Pablo Antonio P., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio Buenos Aires, junto sus padres, los planes futuros hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus padres para hacer su casa de habitación, desde hace cinco años se dedica a la agricultura ya que su jefe le alquila un lote de terreno para que la trabaje y pueda realizar sus proyecto, le agradece a Afodenic, por la buena aprobación de su crédito y la confianza que le ha brindado, ya que esta es la única manera para poder comprar los fertilizantes e insumos que necesita su producción ya que la crisis económica del país no se lo permite .

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para  aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria and she has been farming for the past three years.

Helen hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Maria Njeri

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and married with one child. She owns a general store in Kwambira shopping center in Limuru where most of her clients are located. She has been in business for about ten years and has been earning a profit of 15,000 Kenya shillings per month.

She has never borrowed from another MFI before and she wants to use the loan to add to her store inventory with wheat flour, maize flour, and some cereals. Maria hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add inventory

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun T., 29, is single and makes a living as a seamstress. She lives with her mother, who earns money by weaving basket accessories by hand from bamboo. They live in poor conditions because their house is too old and small for them. Hun T. has applied for a loan for $1,000 to build a new house for them to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkan sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 40 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers il y’a un peu longtemps de cela. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de poissons fumés et d’articles divers tels que les habillements et les produits de premières nécessités. Le poisson fumé est acheté en gros à Mopti, les habillements et les autres articles sont achetés au Burkina et à Bamako et le tout est revendu sur place dans le marché de  MARKA COUNKO à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkan group are married women with an average age of 40 years and on average 2 children. With their husband and children they live in large traditional families and reside in the village of MARKA COUNKO, sous-prefecture of FANA, in the region of KOULIKORO, Republic of Mali.

They met each other through neighborhood and kinship links. They have been selling various items for quite some time.

These women work in collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to perpetuate their money-making activity. This is their second group loan and the previous loan was fully reimbursed.

With this loan they wish to buy large quantities of smoked fish and various items such as clothing, and basic need products. The smoked fish is bought wholesale in Mopti, the clothing and other articles in Burkina and in Bamako. They resell everything on the market place in MARKA COUNKO to customers who are women and men.

They are planning to each make an average monthly profit of 35, 000 FCFA. The profits are reinvested in part in their activity and the other part goes to the daily family expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children and she is 28 years old. Her husband sells children's clothes and shoes. She is a hardworking woman and she sells for long hours to support her family. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells frozen foods and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods and groceries to sell during this festive period. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and groceries to sell

loans.name: Mandal

texts.en:
Mandal is 54 years old and lives with his mother and 24-year-old daughter in Arkhangai Province, Mongolia. His daughter attends the university.

Mandal operates a taxi service in which he transports people between the countryside and the center of the province. He started his business in 2008 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD). In addition to his taxi service, he makes wooden furniture to supplement his family's earnings. He makes a variety of furniture to meet his customers's demands. Now, his working capital exceeds 300.000 tugrugs (~$210 USD).

In the future, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~$350 USD) loan to repair and maintain his taxi so that he can continue to support his family.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila F. is from the village of Miputak. She is 21 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Laila owns and operates a business providing transportation services such as motor cab to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Laila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Laila is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC, and her second with Kiva. She plans to provide a better house for the family to live in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Mi Progreso De San Jose Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mi Progreso D. San José, inicia su tercer ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. artesanía, verduras, panes, lana, abarrotes en general, comida, animales menores y transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Juana que es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Juana venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días, Juana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. verduras.

Mientras que Yuly es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yuly venD. mazamorras en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, Yuly necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, gas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,550 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, verduras, gas, lana, tintes, panes.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Mi Progreso D. San Jose" (My St. Joseph's Progress) starts its third cycle with 16 members. The members have different business activities such as the sale of crafts, vegetables, bread, wool, groceries, food, small animals and transportation. Such is the case of Juana, who is married, 50 years old and has five children, Juana sells vegetables in the market Nery Garcia, activity that she does every day; Juana needs a loan of 300 soles to invest in buying vegetables. On the other hand, Yuly has a partner, is 30 years old and has 1 child, Yuly sells "mazamorras" (a Peruvian pudding) from home, activity that she does every day; Yuly needs a loan of 600 soles that will be invested in buying sugar and gas. The members need different amounts of loans such as 300, 450, 600 and 1050 soles making a total of 8,550 soles in loans at the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, vegetables, gas, wool, dye and bread. The members' dreams are that their children become professionals, improve their businesses and have a house of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetables, gas, wool, dye and bread.

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en: Chourb T., age 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She sells chickens and ducks at a local market, earning approximately $4 per day.  She is able to cover her family expenses.  Chourb has been in business since 2001.  Her husband helps his wife and earns the same amount of income.  Chourb wants a loan to expand her business and is requesting $1000 to purchase more ducks and chickens to sell.  This is her first loan from CREDIT. (Chourb's husband is pictured.)

loans.use: Buy more ducks and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Soutoura sont des  femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt précédent  a été remboursé sans difficulté. 
Elles font la vente d’atiécké, du bois de chauffe et de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 100kg d’atiécké, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 4paquets de condiments alimentaires (pour faire la restauration) et 1 chargement et ½ de camionnette en bois de chauffe. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants  de façon fixe et ambulante, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Soutoura group are married, and on average are 34 years old with three children. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. In response to customer needs they are requesting their second group loan from the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, having fully repaid the first one. They sell atiécké (cassava grits), firewood and prepared meals. With their new loan they will buy: one 100-kilo bag of atiecké, one 100-kilo bag of rice, four packages of food condiments (for their catering business), and 1 ½ pickup loads of firewood. They get their supplies from the main market in Sikasso, and from area villages. They resell their products in Sikasso or in the villages, as itinerant vendors or from a fixed location, for cash but often for credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 27,500 FCFA each, of which a part will go to savings and taking care of family needs, and the rest reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Mrs. Bopha M. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokrath Be, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare field where they grow vegetables to earn a living for their family. In order to increase their income to improve her family's living standards, Mrs. Bopha M. wants to buy a cow for breeding, thus she decided to ask for a loan to support this purpose. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa G. is 53 years old and lives in Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of six children. Madame G. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Her main activity consists of running a restaurant and selling food in a small grocery store. She wants to use this loan to improve her restaurant as well as to buy products for her grocery store: peanut butter, millet and flour.

loans.use: To improve her restaurant and buy food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Roem Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in Krang Dai village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan group. They are going to use their loan for different purposes that can improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Roem K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil and she does not have enough rice seed to grow. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Roem K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a widow with a child who is a rice mill laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
A 43-year-old widowed mother of seven children, for the past ten years Mary A. O. has operated her pharmacy, known as Nyombei Pharmacy, out of her home in Manyatta in Kisumu. Selling drugs such as painkillers and antibiotics to the local households, Mary says a major challenge for the business is not being able to reach out to as many people as she would like to. Nonetheless, the business is profitable, enabling her to provide employment to four people.

Mary will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more drugs to grow her business, hoping to eventually open a shop for her enterprise; from the additional income she hopes to acquire a piece of land. She describes herself as hardworking and always willing to help the needy

loans.use: To purchase additional drugs

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria sueña con terminar sus estudios de contabilidad, Victoria es soltera y vive con sus padres, trabaja en una clínica como enfermería técnica, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los procesa y los vende en los mercados. Además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para los alimentos para los cerdos.   
Victoria sueña con construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria dreams of finishing her studies in accounting. Victoria is single and lives with her parents. She works in a clinic as a nursing technician. Victoria travels to the different fairs of the region where she sells groceries and buys grains that she later processes and sells in the markets. She also raises pigs in her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar, and for the purchase of pig food. She dreams of building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchsae of rice, sugar and pig food

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: Maria Amparo tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de camarones. Ella dio inicio como ayudante en el negocio de una amiga pues anteriormente su marido trabajaba en la pesca y fue así que aprendió este negocio, pero ya no siguen juntos por lo que a cómo pueden tratan de proporcionarle a sus 2 hijos los estudios necesarios. Los clientes son lo que más le han ayudado a incrementar nuevos clientes por la fama de obtener muy buenos ingresos. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pescado, chuleta, camarones y punches.
texts.en:
Maria Amparo is 44 years old. She sells shrimps for a living. She started by helping out at a friend's business. Her husband used to work in fishing, which helped her learn about the business. However, they are no longer together and she is now trying to get her 2 children through school. Her customers have helped her the most when it comes to getting new customers thanks to the reputation of her good prices. She wants to use the loan to purchase raw material such as fish, chops, shrimps and crabs.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander A. is from the village of Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 42 years old. Alexander is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alexander owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gasoline and kerosene in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products (gasoline and kerosene) to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alexander from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products (gasoline and kerosene) to sell.

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie R. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 71 years old. Medie is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Medie owns & operates a business selling clay-made burners and herbal medicines in the local community. Medie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Medie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Medie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Medie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Wilson Polibio

texts.en:
Wilson Polibio A. C. is 59 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has 4 children, ages 35, 32, 18, and 16 years old.  

Wilson is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Wilson works in agriculture and raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products weekly in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

He plans to use the loan to improve his efficiency in agricultural production. His dream is to improve his house. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports and he enjoys the festivals of his community.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Amarilis Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar de gente trabajadora y honesta  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal “San Eduardo”.

Nació en Agua fría del cantón 24 de Mayo. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Desde los doce años  vino a Portoviejo a estudiar. Aprendió costura en la Academia Ángela Rosa Cevallos, trabajó en un taller de costura donde aprendió mucho. Después con la ayuda del crédito que recibió por parte de la Fundación Espoir compró una máquina de coser y ahora se dedica es su casa a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa en especial ropa de mujer, aunque le encanta coser ropa deportiva.

Trabaja todos los días de lunes  a viernes hasta las 17h00  en  un taller y en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día en su casa, algunas veces que tiene mucho trabajo una compañera de trabajo le ayuda.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace  8 años y está muy contenta porque le ayudado mucho. Con este nuevo crédito va a comprar una máquina de coser industrial recubridora para aumentar su producción.

Sus sueños son tener un gran taller y terminar su casa que esta aun en construcción.
texts.en:
The members of the San Eduardo communal bank meet on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo, a place of honest, hard working people. She was born in Agua Fria, 24 de Mayo Canton. She’s married and has 4 children. She came to Portoviejo at the age of 12 to study. She learned sewing at the Ángela Rosa Cevallos Academy. She worked in a sewing workshop where she learned much. Later, with help from financing from Fundación Espoir, she bought a sewing machine and now she makes all kinds of clothes for women, although she loves making athletic clothes, at home. She works every day from Monday through Friday until 5pm in a workshop and at night and on weekends all day at home. Sometimes when she has a lot of work a coworker from work helps her. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she is very happy because it’s helped her a lot. She will use the new loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to increase production. Her dreams are to have a great workshop and to finish her house which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. Keo H. is a middle-aged man whose wife appears in the photo here. Keo H., age 38, is a low-income citizen living with other members in the Baray commune in the province of Kompong Tom. 

To generate a daily income, Keo H. owns a small trade of which the main activity is to make furniture to sell. He also saves up many sets of wooden beds and rattan cupboards before selling out. He transports the finished products directly to customers' houses. Recently, the essential raw material has been exhausted and he wants to resupply so he is seeking a loan to purchase materials in order to produce furniture.

loans.use: To purchase materials in order to produce furniture

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
N. Islom is 48 years old. He’s married with seven children. Islom is a farmer. He grows various crops, such as potatoes, carrots and wheat. His sons help him with the business. 

Islom has been working in that business for more than seven years and has gained rich experience. Now Islom requests $3,000 US Dollars to purchase input materials, including seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing his crops. 

After gathering his harvest, he wants to sell to the local inhabitants at lower prices than in the market. Islom promises to repay the loan properly and thanks everyone for support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients can run their businesses successfully. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: 18.05.009 Group

texts.en:
Thiết N. Thị  (99), a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Thiết, is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 009-Quảng Hưng (18.05.009).

Thiết is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Thiết owns & operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Thiết has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thiết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thiết has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Mai (88) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Dung (97) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. Thị Thắm (98) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  L. Thị Hằng (100) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thiết N. Thị  (99) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thiết là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 009-Quảng Hưng (18.05.009).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thiết thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thiết kiếm được khoảng 6800000 VND.  Vào 2008, Thiết đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thiết đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Mai (88) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Dung (97) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Thắm (98) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  L. Thị Hằng (100) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Caxton

texts.en:
Caxton is a single gentleman, age 20 years old. He is a businessman who has been selling secondhand clothes for the past year. He normally earns a monthly income of 4,500 Kenyan shillings. He uses his income to support two of his family members.

Caxton has never borrowed from any microfinance institution (MFI). He was introduced to KADET by one of the credit officers. He is applying for his first loan and plans to add clothes stock and purchase livestock. He anticipates some profit which he intends to save for the future when he gets married and has children to educate. His dreams are to start another business and save money for the betterment of his future family.

loans.use: To add clothes stock and purchase livestock

loans.name: Lady Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lady es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí suele ofrecer a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de los clientes de la zona, los cuales lo prefieren debido a la buena calidad de productos y a la excelente atención que brinda.

Lady desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos ya que durante la temporada navideña la demanda aumenta, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Lady es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria.
texts.en: Lady is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in a rural zone of the Tambogrande locality. It is an agricultural district in the Piura region, located more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the Lambayeque region. Lady has a bodega [small grocery store] set up in her home, where she offers her customers all types of products for daily use, such as staple items and groceries. Her business is very well received by her customers in the area, who prefer her store thanks to the good quality of her products and the excellent service she offers. Lady would like to expand her bodega by purchasing more products, since demand increases during the Christmas season. For this reason, she decided to request a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Lady is quite a responsible woman and very devoted to her family. She will use the income she earns from this endeavor to help her husband, a farmer, to keep up with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy products to expand her business

loans.name: María Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora María I. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de animales como  gallinas, cerdos y ganado, sus animales los vende en su casa o en las ferias de la ciudad, también se dedica a la agricultura pero labora en tierras ajenas.
 
Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 12 hijos, 4 de ellos son varones y 8 mujeres, cuatro hijos son casados y viven independientes, seis hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también vende helados, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Es el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su hija a formar parte de este grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra pollos y ganado. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia para vivir con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María I. is a member of the Yanaturo communal bank.  She lives in Yanaturo, a community in the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is known for its natural beauty, its culture and its gastronomy that delights the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its people keep its culture and traditions.

María raises animals like chickens, pigs and cattle to sell.  She either sells them at home or in the local markets.  She’s also a farmer but on other people’s lands.

María is 50 years old, married and has 12 children: 4 boys and 8 girls.  Four of the children are married and live independently and six are in school, the two youngest in a school in the city.  Her husband is a farmer and also sells ice-cream.  She does not own a house; she rents.

This is the fifth loan she’s negotiated with the communal bank.  Her daughter invited her to become part of this group.  She will use the money from her loan to buy chickens and cattle.  Her dream is to have her own house in order to live with her whole family.

loans.use: To buy chickens and cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old single man with two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon.  Beginning 25 years ago, he has build up good experience working as a plumber. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase special power machinery and additional tools. He needs to be prepared to satisfy his clients and have a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase special power machinery and additional tools

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 63 años D. edad, es separada y resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Pomape del distrito D. Monsefú, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desD. que era joven. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno D. cultivo en donD. suele sembrar diversos vegetales y legumbres. Cuando llega el tiempo D. cosecha las comercializa en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

María siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que siembre se desarrollen D. mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is 63 years old, separated, and lives with her family in the hamlet of Pomape in Monsefu district, an agricultural area some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works as a farmer, which she has done since she was young.  She counts on her small plot where she grows various vegetables and legumes.  At harvest time, she sells them in the wholesale market in Chiclayo.  Her business alows her to help her family with their daily needs.

Maria always works hard in order to keep her business moving forward.  Currently she wants to apply various fertilizers to her land so that the fruits she hopes to plant will grow better.  She has therefore seen fit to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 1,600 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to be able to plant fruits.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro es una padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus 5  hijos en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino y vacuno. Él cría a los animales en su domicilio, los alimenta en base a alimento balanceado y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.  Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra maíz y arroz en tiempo de campaña.

Actualmente ella desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lazaro is a 53-year old father who lives together with his wife and their 5 children in a community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region that is primarily known for its fruit products, especially mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He raises and sells goats and cattle. He raises his livestock on his property, feeding them balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in their development he offers them for sales to merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income, which is why he tries to manage it the best way possible. He is also an agriculturist who cultivates corn and rice during the growing season. 

He requires more balanced feed for his livestock in order to increase his sales and his earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Komi  Delali

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komi est âgé de 32 ans.  Il habite quartier  Adidoadin.  IL vent les Epices en gros. Il compte  3 ans dans cette  activité et revend les épices au grand marché de  Lomé.   Il demande un prêt  pour acheter  50 cartons d’épices pour pouvoir répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Mr. Komi is 32 years old. He lives in the Adidoadin area. He sells spices in bulk.  He has been in this business for 3 years and resells the spices at the main market in Lomé.  He is asking for a loan to buy 50 cartons of spices so that he can respond to never-ending growing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 37 años de edad,  reside en Sociedad, departamento de Morazán, su negocio es una tienda y venta de electrodomésticos, su esposa es Miriam y tienen dos hijos Erick Omar de 12 años y Luis Gustavo de 9 años de edad.
El negocio de Luis lo tiene hace un año, lo administra junto a su esposa, la venta de electrodomésticos la realiza de forma ambulante, mientras que la tienda la tiene ubicada en su casa atendiéndola de 7:00am a 6:00pm. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir la tienda, comprando productos de uso domestico, esto mejorara la atención a los clientes, ofreciéndoles productos muy necesarios en cada hogar y de calidad.
Para Luis su aspiración es que el negocio sea fuerte y estable en las ventas, que los ingresos mejoren y dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years of age and lives in Sociedad in the department of Morazán. He runs a store selling electrical appliances. He is married to Miriam and they have two children: Erick Omar (12) and Luis Gustavo (9).

Luis has had this business for one year and administers it together with his wife. They sell electrical appliances as street vendors, operating the store from their home from 7:00am to 6:00pm. 

They are currently requesting a loan to stock up their store and purchase products for domestic use. This will improve their customer service as they will be able to offer their customers necessary quality products for their home. 

Luis' aspirations are to have a strong and stable business, improve his income and give his family a better future.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia para el negocio.

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: La señora Margarita tiene 31 años, vive en San Marcos, es soltera madre de dos hijos menores de edad que están estudiando en primaria. su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada además que también vende huevos al por mayor. Le ayuda que el precio de los huevos ha estado bajando permitiéndole obtener más ganancias. Lo que la afecta es que no tiene mucho capital de trabajo para invertir más. En su negocio no tiene mucha competencia ya que las ventas se hacen de forma ambulante. Desea continuar creciendo en su negocio y con la ayuda de financiamiento continuara invirtiendo para mantener a sus hijos. Marisol tiene 41 años es casada, su esposo es agricultor y tienen 8 hijos de entre 6 y 25 años de edad, la mayoría de los cuales ya trabajan. Su negocio es la venta de gallinas y huevos, su nivel de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Margarita is 31 years old and lives in San Marcos. She is a single mother of two young children in elementary school. Her business is selling new and used clothing, and she also sells eggs at wholesale. It helps her that the price of eggs has been dropping, allowing her to earn more. What affects her is that she does not have much working capital to invest more. She does not have much competition in her business because she makes her sales on foot. She wants her business to continue growing and the loan will help her to continue to invest in order to support her children.

Marisol is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer and they have eight children between the ages of 6 and 25 years old, the majority of which already work. Her business is selling chickens and eggs. Her standard of living has improved.

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothing, as well as eggs

loans.name: Tari

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Tari M.. She is married and has three children, ages 30, 22 and 15. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Tari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia morada junto a su esposo Benjamín de 37 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor porvenir. Las chacras de Claudia son las mejores y las tiene bien cuidadas, todos los días  es la primera en levantarse de la cama, prepara el alimento de sus hijos y enviarlos luego al colegio, mientras su esposo va preparando las herramientas que utilizará durante el transcurso del día; Claudia cultiva plantas de café, cacao y plantaciones de barbasco, productos que posteriormente lleva a comercializarlos a los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de San Francisco y Kimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos quienes se encargan de dañar  los capullos de las plantas. Por lo cual ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insecticidas para luego realizar la fumigación respectiva y así combatir las plagas que aquejan sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socia, muy alegre y cooperadora. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas para combatir las plagas que dañan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
34-year old Claudia is a simple, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her 37-year old husband Benjamín and their three beloved children for whom she wishes to provide a better future. Her fields are of good quality and well cared for. Every day she is the first person to get up, prepare food for her children, and get them off to school. Her husband, in the meantime, is getting ready the tools needed for the day’s work.

Claudia grows coffee, cocoa, and barbasco (a native Peruvian plant) which she later sells in the warehouses of the towns of San Francisco and Kimbiri. She enjoys the freedom of spending her days in the green countryside around her home and has been farming for fifteen years. The hardest part of her job is keeping insects away from the fresh growth on crops. For this reason Claudia is asking for a loan to buy insecticide to spray on the plants and keep the bugs at bay. In the future she would like to buy more land and increase production of her crops. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows that she has to pay back the money punctually if she wishes to get another loan one day. Claudia is a lively and cooperative member of her community bank. With the 3,000 soles she has requested, she will buy insecticide to kill the bugs that harm her crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticide

loans.name: Juan Celestino

texts.es: Don Juan Celestino T. C., es casado, tiene 49 años de edad, cursó sus estudios primarios, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de chumpas de cuero, lleva 9 años de experincia en este trabajo, inició vendiendo suéteres; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la costura o confección de tejidos. Decide solicitar a ASDIR un préstamo que servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que va a comprar chumpas de cuero para la reventa. Quiere tener un negocio mas grande y en el futuro contar con locales propios.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 49 years old, and completed his primary school studies. He has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Juan is a merchant and sells leather jackets. For 9 years he has been in this business, having begun by selling sweaters. He is aided by his wife who is a seamstress and weaves fabrics.

Juan has decided to solicit a loan through ASDIR so that he can buy leather jackets to resell. He wants to have a bigger business and in the future, to have his own stores.

loans.use: to buy leather jackets for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa Amalia de sesenta años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupusería que lleva por nombre “Rosita”, es una pupusería muy famosa y muy visitada en el lugar pues Rosa les da a las pupusas un sabor inigualable y las vende a un buen precio, además su negocio es muy higiénico y atiende a los clientes como se merecen. Para Rosa el trabajo mas productivo es el que sale de las manos de una persona contenta y trata de transmitirle eso a su clientela; todo su ánimo la impulso a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como  queso, frijoles, chicharrón, loroco, bebidas entre otros para realizar y vender sus ricas pupusas. Rosa tiene la esperanza de que su negocio la posibilitara para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su hogar  y al mismo tiempo este será en un futuro útil para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Amalia is 60 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.
