She owns a pupusería called Rosita which is very famous and popular as the pupusas Rosa makes have an unbeatable taste and she sells them at a good price.  In addition, her business is very hygienic and she treats her customers well.  For Rosa, the most productive work is that which is produced by the hands of a happy person and she tries to pass this on to her customers.  Rosa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy raw materials such as cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, 'loroco' (a native vine with edible flowers), drinks and other products so that she can make and sell her delicious pupusas.  Rosa hopes that her business will enable her to continue covering her household needs and that it will be useful for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, loroco and drinks

loans.name: Irene Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene Emilia; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasto (se usa para alimento de cuyes y ganados),ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del distrito Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasto. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasto al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Irene Emilia is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She makes a living selling animal feed (used to feed guinea pigs and livestock).  She makes her sales as a street vendor on the different streets in the Urubamba district.  She works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm.  This business helps her to provide for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her feed sales.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed wholesale.  

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase wholesale animal feed.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , desde hace 25 años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder darle un mejor bienestar  ya que tiene cuatro hijos y su esposa labora como comerciante para apoyar con los gastos del hogar , don Luis necesita un financiamiento para poder inducir el cultivo y sacar una buena producción tanto en tamaño como color y sabor . A gradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondos Kiva para realizar la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios ya que sin este apoyo no fuese posible la producción.
texts.en:
Luis is a small farmer in Ticuantepe. For 25 years he has been growing pineapples. His greatest challenge are the pests that affect his crops. His plans for the future for his family is to give them a better quality of life. He has four children and his wife works as a storekeeper to help support the household expenses. 

Luis needs this loan to begin begin planting and to have a good harvest in both quantity and quality in terms of color and flavor. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic has given him through Kiva funds to help him buy fertilizer and the supplies he needs. Without this support he wouldn't be able to achieve the output he needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is asking for a loan amount of PHP9,000 to buy piglets to raise and sell after a few months. Angelina uses her business income to provide for most of her family's basic needs. In the future, Angelina hopes that her business will become successful for her family.

Angelina is 50 years old, married and has four adult children. Her husband works as a farmer in their community.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Prudencienne

texts.en:
Prudencienne is 41 years old and is married with 8 children between the ages of 3 and 25 years old. She earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. Her business is well organized and she is in her twenty-fifth successful year.

Prudencienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials for her sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, she hopes to increase her profits so she can save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her sewing.

loans.name: Ma Ana

texts.en:
This is Ma Ana, 35, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a vendor, and mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way to college. Like Ma Ana, most Filipino parents believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Ma Ana is a broom maker. She buys materials to make the brooms and she sells them in the marketplace or to suppliers. She makes the brooms in the convenience of her home. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2200 in sales every day.

To help Ma Ana continue operating of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials, like broomcorn, steel wire, and string. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma Ana dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-selling business in the Philippines.

Anita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 56ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse d’ustensiles en plastiques depuis 1980. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Kossiwa a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 56-year-old woman married to a mechanic.  She has no children.  She has worked as a reseller of plastic utensils since 1980.  She sells to her customers in a local marketplace and buys her products in Lomé.

Kossiwa requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy kitchen utensils and food products.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen utensils and food products.

loans.name: Lycheilyn

texts.en:
Lycheilyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Lycheilyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Lycheilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 32 years old and lives with her two sons and husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her elder son is a high school student. The younger son attends the local kindergarten. She started her business in 2008 by selling clothes and goods at the local market. She has many years of business experience. 

She is planning to buy a new container in which she stores the goods and sells the goods. She has taken out four business loans from XacBank. She uses her loans for the right purposes and business deals. Her sales income and business profits are increasing gradually in the last few years. She is a hard-working and diligent woman who says "I want to expand my business and buy a new container." She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Yesenia Rosario

texts.es:
Yesenia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos,  estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora trabaja junto con su esposo en la compra de animales  como ovinos y venta de carne.  Su préstamo inicial fue por S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de cuatro corderos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  2,300.00 nuevo soles, comprará doce unidades de ovinos.  Nos cuenta que los animales los compra su esposo en las ferias, Juli, Zepita, Huacullani, para luego carnearlo y vender la carne en la ciudad de Puno.
La señora desea tener un carro para trasladar la mercadería y así minimizar gastos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la alegría entre las socias y la facilidad del  préstamo.
texts.en: Yesenia is a member of the communal bank “Central Vaquería”, located in the neighborhood of Vaquería, in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno.  She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children and studied up until high school.  She works together with her husband in the purchase of animals such as sheep and the sale of meat.  Her initial loan was for 500.00 soles, money that she used for the purchase of four lambs.  With this new loan of 2,300.00 soles, she will purchase twelve head of sheep.  She tells us that her husband purchases the animals at the fairs in Juli, Zepita, Huacullani, in order to later slaughter them and sell the meat in the city of Puno.  She would like to have a car in order to transport the merchandise, thus minimizing expenses.  What she likes about the communal bank is the happiness between the members and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase twelve head of sheep.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Leonida has a retail shop that sells vegetables, food seasonings and spices like onions and garlic. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables, food seasonings and spices for resale. Leonida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, food seasonings and spices for resale.

loans.name: Washingtone

texts.en: Washingtone is a 33-year-old married man. He has five children whose ages range from five to nineteen years. He describes himself to be humble, patient, and obedient. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat to the local people. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a shopping center in Kisumu. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the transportation of meat, which causes delays. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to add to his stock of meat and to improve the business premises. His business goal is to become a supplier of meat to institutions within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children in order to better their lives.

loans.use: to add to his stock of meat and to improve the business premises

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Policarpio is 66 years old and is married with seven children. He lives in the Philippines. For the past 20 years, he has run a shop where he sells cultured tilapia by the kilogram. He is a new member of HSPFI.

Policarpio is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fish feed for his cultured tilapia. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish feed for his farmed tilapia

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, este negocio D. María inicio hace 6 años, dedicándose a tiempo completo, durante todos los días D. la semana, la fuente D. ingreso que tiene su familia es este negocio.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, comprando faldas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas y  zapatos, esta inversión será un gran aporte para María, mejorando su condicione D. comerciante y la diversidad que ofrecerá para los clientes.
La aspiración D. María tener su propio local, ya que tiene un puesto en la calle y por eso su sueño es tener un local propio  y adecuado para atender la demanda.
texts.en: María works selling clothing.  She lives with her husband and three children.  María started her business 6 years ago, dedicating herself full-time, every day of the week.  This business is her family's only source of income.  Currently she needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise, including skirts, dresses, pants, blouses and shoes.  This investment will be a great help for María, improving her condition as a merchant and increasing the diversity that she can offer to clients.  María's goal is to have her own shop, since she currently has a street cart and thus her dream is to have her own store and for it to be adequate to meet demand.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, dresses, pants, blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora, que se gana la vida expendiendo refresco y chicha morada. Comenzó con éste negocio hace 3 años, en un inicio no le era tan rentable, hasta que en un momento pensó en dejarlo pero fue más su perseverancia que hasta el día de hoy lo mantiene. Lo que más le gusta de esta labor es de que no es tan trabajoso ni muy pesado, pero si el único inconveniente que tiene es que a veces los productos que ella necesita  para preparar su refresco no fácilmente se puede conseguir. En un futuro desea abrir un local donde pueda expender su refresco porque en la actualidad ella vende en la calle en una pequeña carpa. Este será su segundo créedito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles, lo utilizará en el alquiler del local para que en ello pueda expender sus productos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 36 years old, a single mother with 3 children. They live together in her own house located in the district of Pichari.

Yolanda is an entrepreneur who makes a living selling softdrinks and chicha morada (a non-alcoholic drink made from purple corn, fruit and spices). She began this business three years ago and at the start it was not so profitable. She thought of closing it but she persisted, and to this day she still has it.

What she likes the most about this work is that it is not exhausting nor heavy, and the only inconvenience she has is at times she can not easily find the supplies she needs to prepare her drinks.

In the future she wants to open a place where she can sell her beverages because currently she sells in the street under a little canvas awning. 

This will be her second loan through MFP, and she promises to once again make her payments on time. She will use the 1500 soles to pay the rent of the facility where she sells her beverages.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the facility where she sells her beverages

loans.name: Emerita De Los Santos

texts.es: Emérita De Los Santos tiene 38 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación pues se siente muy agradecida con la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio por medio de ellos. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace mas de 2 años, la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, leche, huevos, fideos y otros. Ella sueña con lograr incrementar el inventario cada día para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Emérita De Los Santos is 38 years old. This is not the first time that she is asking the Fundacion for a loan as she is very grateful for the opportinity of improving her business with them. She has had a grocery store for more than 2 years. Most of her customers know that she sells items such as dry grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents, milk, eggs, noodles and other products. She dreams of expanding her inventory every day to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, milk, eggs, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Girly Jane

texts.en:
Girly Jane is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Girly Jane has a food shop that sells viands like fried chicken parts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Girly Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Girly Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is 43 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she sells health products.  She has been in the business for one year.  She also does farming in her rural home so as to earn additional income.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained on business management.
Mwende needs a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is a married woman with two children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Russel sells food items to her community. She cooks local delicacies to sell. Russel also deals in Avon products.

Russel requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, and spices. Russel hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 50 years old, a single mother of two children.  She has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of Kes 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

 Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to build rental houses on.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Ivlita

texts.en:
Ivlita is from the village Napareuli, Kakheti Region. She is 43 years old and lives with her family, husband Archil, and 22-year-old son. Archil works as a night watchman and their son is unemployed. 

According to Credo’s estimations Ivlita’s family belongs to the group of rural subsistence poor. The monthly income of the family is on average 500 Laris. Ivlita cultivates a family-owned plot of the land, where tomatoes and maize are grown. Harvested products are mainly consumed by the family, though some surplus is sold on the local market. 

Ivlita received the loan in the framework of a start-up program. She will start a new family business with the loan. She plans to purchase calves. After 12 – 14 month the calves will turn into milk cows. Ivlita will start cheese production. She will sell the cheese on the local market. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Ivlita will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family living conditions. Also part of the additional profit will be reinvested in dairy farming, in order to improve it and increase its profitability.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has four children. Adjoa is a fishmonger and also sells cooked rice and vegetable stew. She has done this for 15 years. She assists her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food for sale. Adjoa will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam del Carmen de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su hermana y su madre de edad muy avanzada por quien trabaja muy duro día con día. Desde hace 30 años atrás que Miriam se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido obteniendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Miriam solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, y de esta manera contar con todo lo necesario para realizar más ropa y atender a más clientes. Salir adelante con las ganancias de este negocio es fundamental para ella, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee.

loans.use: Compra de tela, botones e hilos.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Casado e vivendo com sua esposa e residente em Changalane
É activista da saúde e comerciante, possui negócio próprio e com o empréstimo pretende comprar produtos diversos (arroz, açúcar, óleo) para revenda.
Para o futura almeja adquirir uma viatura próprio que lhe facilitará o transporte de mercadoria e ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
Constitui seu maior desafio reembolsar o crédito com maior rapidez de forma aceder outro empréstimo.
texts.en:
Alberto is married and lives with his wife in Changalane.

He's a health activist and a trader, owns his own business and with this loan he plans to buy various products (rice, sugar, oil) for resale.

In future Alberto hopes to buy a vehicle which will facilitate the transport of his goods and to expand his commercial establishment.

His greatest challenge is to pay back this loan as quickly as possible so that he can request another loan.

loans.use: buy various products (rice, sugar, oil) for resale.

loans.name: Chanchala

texts.en:
Chanchala is a 28 year old independent woman from the Jayanagar village in the Koraput district of Odisha. At this age, she works full time as an agricultural laborer, earning a daily wage. She also runs a cattle rearing business. Chanchala earns a monthly income of 5,500 INR to support herself. She spends close to 4500 on household expenses and manages to save the remaining amount.

Because of increasing expenses it becomes necessary that she increases her income. She now wants to expand her business by buying a new buffalo. She seeks a loan of 35,000 INR for this purpose. She plans to repay the loan within 24 months. By lending 35,000 INR to Chanchala, we can provide her an opportunity to work hard and save enough money to support herself in the future.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Selma Argentina

texts.en:
I’ve been making and selling tortillas for the last five years. With my income, I’ve been able to support my kids’ education. I also sell cell phone calling cards, which provides me with an additional income to help me with my family’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, lime, water, and others.

Desde hace 5 años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de torillas, con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas he podido apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios. Tambien vendo tarjetas para telefonos celulares este es un ingreso adicional que nos ayuda con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, cal, agua y otros

loans.name: Soli

texts.en: Soli is from the village of Salelologa Savaii and is married to a business man from Falefa. She is 39 years of age. Her operates a vegetable garden and sells cabbages and cucumbers. Her profits are used for business needs and helping to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more seed stock so she can produce more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of seeds

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria Soledad is married and has four children, ages 28, 29, 32 and 34. Wanting to help support her husband with household expenses and so they could buy their own home, Maria starter selling ceramics 30 years ago. She had a post at the markets and sold them door-to-door. Later, she also started selling plastic goods and embossed paintings her sons made. Love for her family has motivated to work hard all this time and has contributed to the growth of her business.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan of $750, which will be used to purchase supplies so she can sell products in more markets and continue growing her business. She plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and contribute to the well being of Maria and her family. She is sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Soledad es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 28, 29, 32 y 34 años de edad. Con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y para poder adquirir su propia casa, desde hace treinta años Maria inició con la venta de cerámica, instalándose en los mercados y vendiendo casa por casa, después agregó la venta de plásticos y los cuadros de repujado, que uno de sus hijos elabora. El amor hacia su familia la han motivado durante todo este tiempo a trabajar arduamente, lo que ha contribuido al crecimiento de su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria necesita de un préstamo por $ 750 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder instalarse en otros mercados y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, Maria agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase platic goods, ceramics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his spare part business

loans.name: Ana Fati

texts.en: Aleisa is one of the most productive lands on the south west of Upolu Island. This special part of the island where  vegetables  and flower are grown. Ana Fati W. is one of the SPBD members that uses and make use of these lands. Ana’s family contains of seven members altogether. She got only one son who is not working and only one daughter who is mentally retarded. There is no one of the family working, the husband also not working and no other source of income for her and the family. Ana being a sixty seven year old woman stands out if you look at her environment. This is her business, she grows vegetables such as cabbages, spring onions and also a variety of flower plants that surrounded and decorates the appearance of the small unpretty house. Her sale for the week is $170 but if the supplies increase then sales also gets up to $250 a week for both flowers and vegetables. She is one of the very successful business women and her dream is a market overseas for her products.

loans.use: To buy timber and roofing to improve her green house for her flower business and additional gardening equipment.

loans.name: Gun Kumari

texts.en:
Gun Kumari M. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. She lives in Thecho of Lalitpur district. Thecho is also famous for vegetable farming. Her older son makes traditional idols and her younger son is studying in grade 5. Her husband Mr. Santa lal M. is a carpenter. Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making ladies' dresses. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. M. took a 4 month training course in tailoring. 
Now she seeks Rs30000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work like clothes, string and a cutting machine.

loans.use: Gun Kumari would like to buy raw materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Ebo

texts.en: Ebo Dadzi is a taxi driver and owner. He is married and has a child aged 3year 6months. His wife is a seamstress and she is supporting with the family finances. His taxi car has broken down. He is considering buying a new car which is more economical than repairing the old one. He is asking for a loan $1,200 which would be added to his savings to buy a new taxi so that he can get himself back into business.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Haneefan's Group

texts.en:
I am Haneefan B. from Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I live with my family in a five-room brick mud house here in KRK. I am a mother of seven: four boys and three girls. I stitch and embroider clothes on order from women of my locality. My husband is a cobbler. Earlier, we invested loans in this business and managed to increase our income. With the increased income, I bought a television for my house and built a toilet in my house.

Now, we want to buy a stock of items that are used in repairing shoes in bulk and therefore, we need a loan. I, on my behalf, request loans for few other women who are: Nasreen B., who needs a loan for their used items trading; Asiah B., who supples candies and toffees to various shops in the city and needs a loan to improve their business; Salma B., who requires a loan for their cloth business; Rizwana B., who will invest their loan in their restaurant.

loans.use: Expand our current shoe repairing business

loans.name: Comite Renacer Group

texts.es:
The committee is comprised of 17 female workers from the Conavi neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in its 4th cycle of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs) committee. Each member is receiving an average loan of 635.00 Guaraní.

The committee was started thanks to the leadership of Mrs. María S., who found out that Fundación Paraguaya offers a program designed exclusively for working women. She invited her colleagues and neighbors to join the program, and that is how the group called “Renacer” emerged.

The women all own different types of businesses, like general stores, beverage sales, preparation and sales of chipas (Paraguayan bread), kiosks, and plant sales.

The committee is currently planning to carry out beautification projects such as cleaning up sidewalks and empty lots, and improving the plaza and the neighborhood soccer field so that the children can have a safe recreational place.

Mrs. Carolina M. is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because this foundation has allowed her to be a part of this program that has taught her so much. Furthermore, she feels very proud to be a part of a group of such hardworking women who are always united and who engage in investment activities. They also use some income in order to help the members who have any type of health problem.

The loan will be utilized for the purchase of merchandise such as sugar, soft drinks, noodles, charcoal, canned goods, fruits, vegetables, and chipa ingredients like vegetable oil, eggs, milk, starch, among other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 17 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Conavi de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas comerciantes, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 4 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, y las misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de G. 635.000 cada integrante.

El comité se inició gracias a la capacidad de liderazgo de la señora María S., quién se enteró que la Fundación Paraguaya posee un programa destinado exclusivamente para mujeres trabajadoras; realizo la invitación a sus demás colegas y vecinas, y así surgió el grupo llamado Renacer.

Las señoras poseen distintos tipos de negocios, entre ellos: despensas, venta de bebidas, elaboración y venta de chipas, kioscos y ventas de plantas.

El comité actualmente tiene proyectado realizar actividades de limpieza de veredas, terrenos baldíos, así también están llevando a cabo un proyecto de mejoramiento de la plaza y cancha de fútbol del barrio, para que los niños tengan un lugar sano para recrearse.

La señora Carolina, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya porque le permitió ser parte de este programa dónde ella aprendió mucho, además se siente muy orgullosa de ser parte de un grupo de señoras muy trabajadoras que siempre están unidas y cada semana realizan actividades con la finalidad de ir capitalizando su ahorro, como así también los ingresos que son utilizados para ayudar a las integrantes que tengan algún tipo de problemas de salud.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, gaseosas, jugos, fideos, carbón, productos enlatados, verduras, frutas, etc. e ingredientes para la elaboración de las chipas como aceite vegetal, huevos, leche, almidón, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soft drinks, juice, noodles, charcoal, canned goods, fruits, vegetables, vegetable oil, eggs, milk, starch, etc.

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Mrs Lan is 40 years old. She would like to obtain a loan to buy a cow. She works in her rice field and sells basic goods at the market. Her family also works in carpentry. Her family income is 150000-200000 VND a day (9.50 - 12.50 usd) which is just enough to cover the daily expenses and provide education for their 4 children. She likes the loan condition of SEDA, since she sells basic goods at the market, it provides her with cash flow so it will be easy for her to make the weekly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lan, 40 tuổi, vay vốn để thêm tiền mua bò. Ngoài ra chị còn đi chợ, làm ruộng, gia đình chị còn có nghề phụ là làm thợ mộc, vì vậy thu nhập gia đình chị từ 150000-200000đồng/ngày, đủ để trang trải cho cuộc sống 2 vợ chồng và nuôi nấng 4 đứa con. Chị rất thích vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị đi chợ nên có thu nhập hàng ngày luôn và như vậy rất dễ để trả tiền theo tuần.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Salma's Jipe Moyo Group

texts.en:
Salma is 32 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 2 years old. Salma owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales, market sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
It’s been about 4 years approximately that the “15 de Diciembre” association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family. They are a group of 18 women who work toward improving their standards of living. Almost all are married and have an average of seven children of varied ages. The principal activity of this group is agriculture, such as growing potatoes, beans, oca, carrots and others, which they harvest each month. They sell the aforementioned products at the La Ceja market (city of El Alto). Unfortunately, the frosts in winter caused them to lose a few of their crops, which is why they need capital to invest into new harvests to generate income that would allow them to recover their previously lost investment. In addition, the loan would be to generate income to help sustain their families on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace cuatro años aproximadamente la asociación 15 de diciembre pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer, grupo formado por 18 mujeres que trabajan con la ilusión de mejorar su estilo de vida. Casi todas casadas y con un promedio de 7 hijos, de distintas edades. La actividad principal de éste grupo es la agricultura, la papa, haba, oca, zanahorias y otros, son productos que cosechan mensualmente. Los mencionados productos los venden en el mercado de la Ceja (ciudad de El Alto), solo en días de feria. Lamentablemente las heladas del pronto invierno han hecho que pierdan algunas cosechas, por esto necesitan capital para invertir en nuevas cosechas, para generar ingresos que les permita recuperar la inversión perdida, además de generar ingresos para el sustento diario de estas familias

loans.use: To reinforce their capital for future harvests.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy H., 47, and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Navy is a widow with six children, two sons and four daughters, three of whom are married and live outside the family home, while the other daughter lives at home and weaves silk. One of her sons attends school in their village, and the other one is a carpenter.

Mrs. Navy has been weaving for over ten years. She learned her skill from her mother, and hopes to continue to develop her business so she can support her son’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting this, her third loan, in the amount of $800, to buy thread and silk material and to set up her loom and her daughter’s loom.

loans.use: To purchase thread, silk material, and a loom for weaving.

loans.name: Sarah Kitata’S Group

texts.en:
Sarah K. is the leader of a group of four women. Sarah is 39 years old and is divorced with four children, ages 16, 18, 20, and 22. Due to the high cost of school fees, only one of her children is currently in school. Sarah lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Sarah has been selling charcoal for the past four years in Kawempe. The market for the charcoal she sells is fair. She faces the challenge of limited money to expand her business, support her family, and pay rent on her house, despite the fact that she works hard.

Sarah plans on using this loan to increase her stock by purchasing more charcoal. With the profits, Sarah will continue to provide the basic needs for her children and pay school fees. Sarah's dream is to one day be able to afford to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family.

Sarah has successfully paid back five loans to MCDT. It is through these loans that she has been able to keep her business operating.

loans.use: To increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina.

She lives in the community of Ninachiri, in the sector of Laja, in the province of Los Andes (3 hours and a half away from La Paz).

Petrona is married to Leonardo Huanaca, who is a farmer, and they have three children (ages 8, 12, and 18).

This is the second loan Isabel requests to Impro and Kiva; she will use it to buy cattle and produce more milk. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Su domicilio es en la comunidad Ninachiri, sector Laja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. Petrona esta casada con Leonardo H. (agricultor) y tiene 3 hijos de 18,12 y ocho años de edad respectivamente.

El monto del crédito será usado para la compra de ganado vacuno.

Este es su segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo en el programa Kiva, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 51 years old. She is married with 7 children, aged between 25 and 13. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and spice seller since 1995. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $120 from her sales.

Mwajuma now requests a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Zema.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her current stock

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi E. is 39 years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling cooked foods like yams, beans and rice as well as drinks.

Ngozi lives in Afromedia, Lagos State, Nigeria and is a LAPO client. She has applied for a loan of $850 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She wants to express her appreciation to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for the financial support

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to cook and sell

loans.name: Francisco Alonso

texts.es: Tiene 57 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, esta soltero, le tuvieron 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su propia familia. Francisco se dedica a la Venta de Ropa y mantiene una línea de clientes que siempre está abasteciendo, además posee una Moto-Taxi en la cual transporta a pasajeros del Mercado Mayoreo al Bo. Gertrudis Áreas lo que le genera buena ganancia, el solicita su crédito para incrementar su Inventario ya que se acerca la temporada en la cual los pedidos se incrementan y necesita satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Inició su negocio con fondos propios los que ha sabido administrar muy bien, su mayor anhelo es ahorrar para la compra de otra Moto-Taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is 57 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. He is single and has 5 grown up children who all have their own families. Francisco sells clothing and has a broad client-base that he is always supplying with merchandise. Additionally, he owns a motorcycle taxi in which he transports passengers from the wholesale market to Gertrudis Áreas, which generates good profits for him. He is requesting this loan in order to increase his inventory because the season in which sales climb is fast-approaching, and he needs to meet customer demand. He started the business with his own funds, which he has been able to manage well. His biggest aspiration is to save money so that he can purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Americo

texts.es: Américo tiene 19 años, es conviviente con su esposa, tiene una hija pequeñita de 2 añitos. Desde niño es agricultor, ahora está sembrando 3 hectáreas de papa; pero ahora que ya tiene su familia ha visto por conveniente tener una pequeña bodega e incrementar sus ganancias con ella, en horas de la mañana se va muy temprano a su chacra y después regresa a desayunar, atiende su negocio, pero los días cuando tiene que trabajar todo el día en su chacra, su esposa se queda en el negocio. A él le agrada estar en contacto constante con la gente, de ese modo se las ingenia para vender sus productos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero, de manera inmediata, va a comprar productos para su bodega, para que de ese modo pueda incrementar el número de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Américo is 19 years old, lives with his wife and their 2 year-old daughter. He has always been a farmer. At the present he is planting 3 hectares of potato but as he now has a family, he finds it convenient to keep a small grocery store and thus increase his earnings. Very early in the morning he works on his farm, returns for breakfast and then takes care of his business. The days he has to work on the farm all day, his wife looks after the business. He enjoys the constant contact with people and finds ways of selling his products. This is the first time he requests a loan from MFP. With the loan immediately he will buy products for his grocery store in order to increase the number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of products in a grocery store.

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Copo de nieve” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace dos años aproximadamente,  cumpliendo con 5 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 12 miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, costura de variedad de prendas, además de la venta de fruta, también la venta de verduras, casi todas realizan sus ventas de forma ambulante.
La asociación copo de nieve, afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad, de esta manera aumentaran sus ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
The "Copo de Nieve" (snowflake) association has been part ot the "Pro-mujer" family for about 2 years. It has had 5 loans to date. It is located in the Villa Exaltación area of the city of El Alto.

Its 12 active members have proven themselves capable of meeting their repayment schedules promptly. There are a number of different businesses within the association: production and sale of food, sewing garments, and the sale of fruit and vegetables, mainly in the street.

The "Copo de Nieve" association says it needs more capital to buy larger amounts of merchandise so as to increase earnings and thus improve its members' economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise bulk

loans.name: Snovbar

texts.ru: Холова Сановбар проживает в городе Вахдат. Занимается шитьем платьев на заказ. Кроме того уже три года занимается пчеловодством. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы закупить сахар для подкормки пчел в зимний период , а так же дополнительную пчелинную семью. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Сановбар 43 года , она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Они живут очень дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Snovbar H. lives in Vakhdat. She is 43, married, and has 5 children. Snovbar makes custom dresses. In addition, she raises bees. Snovbar H. will use this loan to purchase a family of bees and sugar to feed the bees during the winter. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and a family of bees

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora trabaja en el área rural de La Paz, es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca; trabaja con su esposo, ambos son de la tercera edad por esa misma condición fue discriminada en otras instituciones y su petición de préstamo fue negada.

Viven en la comunidad Chuñu chuñuni de la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Teodora works in a rural area of La Paz. She is a small famer, and produces cow's milk. She works with her husband, and both are senior citizens. For this reason they were discriminated against by other institutions and had their loan request rejected. They live in the Chuñu Chuñuni community of the Los Andes province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan she is now seeking will be used to buy a medium quality dairy cow to increase her milk production and improve her income. This is her second loan with Impro. Thanks to her good repayment history with the institution she is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a medium quality dairy cow

loans.name: Betsaida Rosaly

texts.es: la Sra. C. tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian en la escuela comunal. la Sra. C. tiene de estar en este negocio desde hace 12 años y ha podido obtener una muy buena clientela, debido a su forma de trabajo en el ambito social ella es catalogada como una persona responsable y con buenos principios culturales. uno de sus mayores sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales graduados de la universidad y con esto todo su esfuerzo de toda su vida seria un trofeo para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 29 years old, is married, and has 4 children, all of whom attend a community school. Mrs. C. has been in this business for 12 years and has been able to acquire a good clientele, because she works in a friendly setting. She is characterized as a responsible person with good cultural principles. One of her biggest dreams is for her children to become professional graduates of the university. With all of her effort during her life, this would be like trophy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette  femme  habite le quartier  de forever, elle exerce  comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois qui est très rentable à Lomé parce que le charbon de bois est très utilisé à Lomé pour préparer  la nourriture. Elle a commencé à exercer ce commerce en 1999, elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice parce qu’elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à l’intérieur du pays les sacs de charbon de bois sont moins coûteux. Voulant rehausser son activité, elle demande à WAGES un prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est divorcée de son mari et à 02 enfants, elle travaille dur pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Forever neighborhood. Her business consists in selling charcoal, which is very profitable in Lomé where charcoal is very much used to cook food. She started this business in 1999, and turns a good profit because she gets her supply in the interior of the country where sacks of charcoal are less expensive. Wanting to bolster her business, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES in order to purchase sacks of charcoal. She's divorced from her husband and has two children. She works hard to support them.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 51 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Youssef has owned a grocery store since 2000. He requested a loan of 1,300 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Youssef has requested a loan.

Youssef is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Youssef chose his business because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Seleni

texts.en: Seleni A., 38, is married and has 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Samoan Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Seleni’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, thread, needles and material.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es una dulce mujer, que ama estar en compañía de sus seres queridos, pues vive en su casa rodeada de sus hijos y sus nietos. Siempre le agradó sentirse útil y eficiente, pues no deja de trabajar, se inició como vendedora de dulces, luego de licores y ahora está involucrada en la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años tratando de acercar diversas prendas de vestir a sus vecinas, que no tienen la posibilidad de visitar las tiendas del centro de la ciudad por falta de tiempo y dinero, entonces Antonia les ofrece ropa de buena calidad a precios módicos que tienen que pagar semanalmente. Sin embargo, Antonia no pretende dedicarse sólo a la venta de ropa, sino también tiene el anhelo de invertir sus ahorros en remodelar su casa para instalar una tienda que le de descanso a sus largas horas de caminata de todos estos años. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y todo este tiempo que viene trabajando con su grupo puede manifestar que las cosas han ido mejorando gracias al involucramiento de cada una de las integrantes. Los 3500 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería, pues tiene que estar lista para la venta que se realizara por el día de la madre y el padre.
texts.en:
Antonia is a sweet lady who loves to be in the company of her dear ones. So she lives in her house surrounded by her children and grandchildren. She always like to feel useful and efficient, and she never stops working. She started out selling sweets and later sold liquors. Now she is involved with selling clothing. For the last five years she has been trying to bring various articles of clothing to her neighbors who aren't able to visit the stores in the city center due to lack of time or isolation. Antonia doesn't pretend to only sell clothing, but also yearns to remodel her house to create a store, to give her a break from her long hours spent traveling by foot after all these years. This is her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and during all of the time that she has been working with her group she can say that things have been improving thanks to the involvement of every one of the participants. The 3,500 Sols which she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, so that she will be ready for sales she will make for Mother's Day and Father's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. sells foodstuffs. She is 42 years old and married with two children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.en:
This group in the neighborhood Chaipé was suggested by an established client of the Fundación Paraguaya.  All of the women have their own small businesses, and invest their loans in these activities. 

1.	Lady Mabel L. R.- Food sales 
2.	Hermelinda G.- Small grocery store 
3.	María Estela M. M.- Jewelry sales 
4.	Gabriela C. D. S.- Food sales 
5.	Cornelia G. D.- Meat sales 
6.	Norma Graciela S. D. L.- Food sales 
7.	Rosa Clara R. D. Faria- Small grocery store 
8.	Eufrocina S. G.- Food sales 
9.	Silvia Esther G. Martínez- Clothing sales 
10.	Noemí Candelaria V.- Food sales 
11.	Griselda Marlene S. S.- Food sales 
12.	Laura Haydee F. D. S.- Small grocery store 
13.	Sandra B. G.- Clothing sales 
14.	Juana M. S.- Tablecloth sales 
15.	María C. S.- Food sales 
16.	Crecencia R.- Food sales 
17.	María Maxima V.- Cosmetics sales 
18.	Cristina Mabel V.- Plastic sales 
19.	Antonia C. L.- Handicraft sales

loans.use: purchase of merchandise to sell or of raw materials

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel C. D. R. D. 33 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis La Herradura departamento La Paz. Reina vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos José D. 18 años, Wendy D. 15 años, Gabriel D. 9 años y Brenda D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. Reina la ayuda económicamente con 200$ mensuales. Reina tiene un negocio donD. venD. gas propano y agua purificada, también surte su negocio con otros productos D. plástico como huacales y vasos; Reina solicita un crédito por que desea invertir en comprar mayor cantidad D. gas y agua.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel C. D. R. is 33 years old and lives in San Luis La Herradura in the district of La Paz. Reina lives with her husband and four kids: Jose who is 18 years old, Wendy who is 15, Gabriel who is 9 and Brenda who is 2. Reina's husband helps them out financially with $200 a month. Reina has a business selling propane gas and purified water, as well as stocking other plastic products like crates and cups. Reina would like a loan in order to invest it in buying larger quantites of gas and water.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy propane gas and purified water/Comprar gas propano y agua purificada

loans.name: Bandali

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Муродалиев Бандали родился 1957 году. Женат и имеет 4 детей. Уже около 5 лет как занимается предпринимательством. Он открыл свой цех в Торговом центре «Садбарг», где пекут хлеб. Основными заказчиками являются клиенты, которые торгуют на базаре. На запрашиваемый кредит он хочет купить  30 мешков муки и угля.

loans.use: Покупка 30 мешков муки и угля

loans.name: Julia Catalina

texts.es:
Julia Catalina H. T. es una señora de 37 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Doña Julia tiene un salón de belleza en su casa dice que  así  ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos; pero ahora para ampliar su fuente de ingresos desea incursionar como vendedora de productos naturales, dice que iniciará vendiendo en su salón de belleza y casa por casa en su comunidad.

Por lo cual, doña Julia desea obtener un préstamo por ¢585,000 (quinientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar la mercadería y productos necesarios para iniciar con su nuevo proyecto. Dice estar muy entusiasmada por iniciar y espera que poco a poco su negocio crezca en calidad y cantidad.

Doña Julia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Julia Catalina H. T. is 37. She lives with her husband and their three children in a community called El Saíno e Pital, which is located in the Alajuela province. The principal productive activities there are livestock and agriculture. Growing pineapple stands out because it is primarily sold in the international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has been growing in the last few years. This generates a larger demand for products and services, which helps mitigate the effect of immigration. Julia has a beauty salon in her house. This way she helps her husband with the household expenses and their children’s expenses. Now, in order to increase her source of income she wishes to sell natural products. She will start selling in her beauty salon. She will also sell door to door in her community. To do that, Julia wishes to get a loan for ¢585,000 (five hundred eighty five thousand colones) to buy merchandise and the products necessary to start her new project. She is very enthusiastic about starting. Little by little her business will grow in quality and quantity. Julia is a member of the Women’s Communal Credit Union Luz del Futuro Saino, which is one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan. She hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. Thanks to this type of organization and their methods of facilitating loans, she can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mugobe Central Ngerirwoth Rosely Group

texts.en: Rosely N., a 39-year-old single mother of four children, two of whom are in school and looking after an orphan, has owned a restaurant and sold firewood for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase firewood and restaurant items such as cassava flour, meat, fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to satisfy customer demand. A hardworking businesswoman who is hoping for her business to improve, Rosely's dream is to purchase a plot of land and educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and restaurant items such as cassava flour, meat, fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes, bananas, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy planks to carry out his carpenter work

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn P. is a 31-year-old woman living in the village of Punta Tagda, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married to Edgardo P., who drives a motorcycle to shuttle passengers around their community and also manages the operations of the two motorized fishing boats they own. Aside from being a business women, she also works as a clerk in their barangay (Village Council), and the salary she earns supplements their family income.The couple has two children who are only 4 and 5 years old. They are the reason Analyn strives so hard in her business ventures – so that she can provide her children with financial security and be able to send them to good schools.

The couple’s eagerness to attain their dream is the driving force behind all their endeavors. It was actually Edgardo who encouraged Analyn to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 so that she could start her own business. Her first venture, after she joined NWTF-PD, was selling fish in her community and the nearby barangays. She immediately saw that it could provide her family with a good income because, even with the small capital she started with, she was able to help her husband pay for some of the household expenses.

Analyn continued with her business activities and expanded by selling capiz shells to a handicraft maker. With a more steady income, she was able to pay her loan installments on time and establish a good credit performance with her group, center and NWTF-PD. Accordingly, she has been able to increase her loan amount at each new loan cycle, enabling her to afford a motorized fishing boat. From the profits of her fishing venture, she bought a motorcycle with a sidecar for her husband to enable him to add to their daily income. Her husband operates it when there's bad weather conditions or when there's trouble with the fishing boat. As their business activities improved, she was able to buy a second motorized fishing boat and hire a helper to operate it. Analyn continues to sell the fish catch in the public market and around their community. This earns her a minimum of 7,000 pesos per month. She has been able to save for her children’s future, pay her debts on time and cover household expenses.

For her 11th loan cycle, she borrowed 29,000 pesos to add to her working capital. When she paid that off, within the loan term and without any delays, she applied for a 12th loan of 29,000 pesos so that she could have revolving working capital for her business ventures: fishing, fish vending and selling capiz shell. She intends to save some of her income for her children.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing business and capiz shell selling

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard A. leads a loan group in the town of Bushenyi. He is 46 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He is also raising two orphans. 

Richard is a businessman who makes a living running a bakery that he inherited from his father and has successfully run for more than 10 years. He sells his goods to people in suburbs, secondary schools, a local college and in other shops. His main challenge is securing the ingredients he needs to bake, such as flour and oil. 

Richard has a motorcycle that makes it easy for him to distribute bread, doughnuts, cookies, pancakes, kebabs and chapattis. His dream is to open a store in a suburban town and buy a van so that he can expand his customer base and make enough money to send his children to college. He has applied for this loan to buy more raw materials for baking such as firewood, flour and cooking oil. Without loans like this, his business would not be nearly as successful as it is.  He is determined to earn a larger income and make sure that his family lives well.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for a bakery.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma sells groceries and food items at retail prices to her customers. With the combined businesses, she is able to support her parents. She is excited about the high season and she hopes to make more sales during and after the season. She is 29 years old and single, without children. 

She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and food to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food for resale

loans.name: Peou

texts.en: S., 29, is a low-income worker living in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her mother and child, even though she has recently been divorced from her husband. She has a lovely child who lives in the family home. S. sells fresh fish in the local market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, S. goes to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, which she sells for retail. In the past, S. always paid a lot of money for a taxi to pick up fish to the market. She right now hopes to own a vehicle and is applying for a loan, which she will use to buy an old motorbike.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 30 years old and owns Pamoja Repairs. He has been in the electronics services business for 12 years. With the KES 40,000 loan, Ezekiel wants to purchase materials, such as metals, for a Mnet machine. Ezekiel comes from very humble beginnings. He is married and has five children, who are all in school, between the ages of 2 and 16 years. He hopes to open more service stalls in the city.

loans.use: To buy materials and metals

loans.name: Neil

texts.en: Neil is 39 years old and lives in South Cotabato where he operates a hog raising business, which he started in 1997. He is a family man with three children. He works hard in his piggery to provide for the basic needs of his family. Aside from the piggery, he also manages a two-hectare rice field. His eldest child is twelve years old, and he wants his children to finish their studies. He's now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill the needs of his business. He needs it to buy feed for the pigs and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She is 51 years old, married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a general retail store. Lydia has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately $116 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC.  

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada tiene 54 años y  03 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella y esta estudiando.

Isabel, es una mujer luchadora y eficiente, es Técnica en Farmacia y trabaja en el Hospital D. su Distrito. Con la perseverancia y el anhelo D. tener un ingreso propio y teniendo los conocimientos en farmacia decidió implementar su propio negocio D. venta D. medicinas básicas, también se dedica a aplicar inyecciones. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, y que es mu y reconocida en su cuadra.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles , comprará medicinas como: Ibuprofeno, Nastisol,  Aspirinas, doloflan, otras medicinas básicas.

Isabelita, como le llaman D. cariño  se siente una mujer  contenta y feliz  con lo obtenido. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla, su sueño es surtir más su negocio con medicinas básicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel belongs to the Honesty and Work Community Bank in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is a student and still dependent on Isabel. Isabel, an efficient and hard-working woman, has a technical degree in pharmacology and works at the hospital in her district. With perseverance, the desire to have her own income, and with her knowledge of pharmacology, she decided to start a business selling basic medicine and also giving injections of different medicines. Currently she is continuing this business and she reports that she is doing well and is becoming well-known in her neighborhood. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy medicines such as: Ibuprofen, Aspirin, and other basic medicines. Isabelita, as she is known by those who are close to her, feels satisfied and happy with what she has achieved. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for their help. Her dream is to supply her business with more medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic medicines to supply her pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soya

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a rice farmer from South Cotabato. He is 32, married and has two children. His oldest child is only seven years old. Aside from farming, he also grows hogs. He hopes to be successful in his ventures. He said that all of this is for his family. He wants his children to have a bright future. He joined CEVI and is now applying for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. He told CEVI that he would use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He would also acquire feed for his hogs.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, and pig feed

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Тагоев Хасан проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Хасан более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этом ему помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Hasan T. lives in the Yavan region. He is 53 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife looks after the household. Hasan has been in animal husbandry for more than twenty years. He feeds and sells cattle. His children help him in this business. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle to increase its count.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Fabiola Danelia

texts.es: La señora Fabiola Danelia se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en comarcas. Es madre de 2 hijos y junto a su esposo han logrado salir adelante. Ella tiene  5 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes debido a que por falta de tiempo ellos no pueden venir a la ciudad a realizar sus compras. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiola Danelia travels about the region selling clothing. She has 2 children, and she and her husband have been able to get ahead. She has been in this business for 5 years, offering her goods to people in the rural areas. These are her main customers, because they do not have time to come to the city for shopping. She is requesting a loan for working capital, to be used to purchase stock. Her goal is to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sina Dim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twelve people who all live in Thmey village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sina D. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use their share of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sina D. sells fried bananas, potato, and taro in their local village. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Sina D. decided to ask for a loan to buy groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Phea Yan, is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to support his family. They have five children, one of whom is a cow middleman, while three are attending local school, and the other is just a year old.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda N. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 48 years old. Yolanda is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yolanda N. Group.

Yolanda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells vegetables in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Yolanda's 12th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah, 28, is married and has one child. He has been farming for four years. He is the breadwinner in his family and works hard to support the family.

Noah is an active member of the Kyeni Ngeleu group in Faulu Kenya and attends their weekly meetings regularly. He also pays his weekly dues well. He plans to service his second loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya. With this loan, he plans to buy manure and animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy manure and animal feeds

loans.name: Mrs. La Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province selected Mrs. La M. as village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. La M. is a broom seller who sells door to door. Since her business is going well she wants to expand so she is applying for a loan to buy more brooms to re-sell.

Her husband, Mr. Yi Chen, is a farmer with a half-hectare of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. He is also a construction worker. She is a mother of four children; one helps with the farming and the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more brooms to resell.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Don Adolfo es padre de familia de cuatro hijos, casado, desde hace varios años, se dedicaba al acarreo pues tenia un vehiculo propio, que había comprado con ahorros, 
Debido a la falta de ganancias decide cambiar de negocio vende el vehiculo y compra un carro para trabajarlo como taxi, lo que lleva varios años en este negocio con ayuda de su esposa ya que también vende nacatamales que ella misma prepara para ayudar  a sus hijos ya que los cuatro están estudiando, y a veces la carreras de taxi están malas pero día a día se trabaja y se gana.
Con los financiamiento logra dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo lo que es para el de gran importancia ya que es su medio de trabajo. Con este préstamo reparara el sistema eléctrico del taxi y poder dar un buen servicio
texts.en:
Don Adolfo is married and the head of a family of four children. He used to own a vehicle with which he hauled goods, a vehicle that he bought with savings. That business didn't pay, though, so he decided to sell the vehicle and buy a car so that he could start a taxi business. He's worked at the business for some years and his wife helps because she operates a business making and selling nacatamales (a local dish), food that she prepares with help from their children (who are still in school).
