Working as a taxi driver is often tough but Don Adolfo works at it day in and day out to earn the money he needs. He will use this loan for car maintenance, a requirement of the utmost importance because he needs the vehicle to operate his business. He will repair the taxi's electrical system so that he can continue to provide a good service.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance for taxi business.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha T. D. is 30 years old. She is married with two children who attend school. Ha T. D. grows rice and also sells mang (bamboo shoots) in the market. She has been involved in this business for five years and has a monthly income of about 3,800,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: for her small business

loans.name: Fritzy

texts.en:
Fritzy M. is from the village of Acmac, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Fritzy is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Fritzy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Fritzy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fritzy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fritzy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fritzy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Acmac, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marcia Felicita

texts.es:
Marcia de 32 años, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, , vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años, vendiendo a sus vecinos víveres completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Ahora vende granos, bebidas, lácteos, etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar bebidas y granos, en el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcia, 32, owns a small corner shop in her house. She lives in the Orquideas neighborhood of Guayaquil (an area of the city that was named for the orquids that used to be common in the area before it was developed). She started the business to support her two children, 4- and 2-years old. She started by selling everyday items to her neighbors and eventually pulled enough money together to set up the shop. She sells basic commodities, cold drinks, dairy products, etc. She works every day from 8:00 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening. To keep her business going, Marcia wants to buy products to stock the store. For the future, she wants to have enough money to set up a store for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea C. is a married woman who lives in Palanas, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: hog raising, fish vending and farming. Her husband, Renaldo C., who is 64 years old, works as a fisherman/farmer. They have seven children between 21 and 40 years old. 

Matea joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21000 to buy feed, vitamins for the pigs and as additional capital for fish-vending so that she can continue to save up for the future and to support her family. Matea C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabali sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent  Darsalam, un des quartiers de le ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers  leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes wax et de céréales. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante des clients, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 9ème de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Koumba  O., la présidente du groupe qui s’est spécialisée dans la vente, au marché Médine de Ségou, du niébé est affectueusement  surnommée Chô – Koumba (c’est-à-dire Koumba niébé). 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300kg de niébé. Elle se ravitaille en niébé à Ségou avec les foraines des villages environnants au marché Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Médine Ségou en détail à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Koumba  O. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, épargner et payer les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the group named Sabali are married and most of them live in polygamous families. On average they are 43 years old and have 4 children each. They live in Darsalam, a quarter in the village of Segou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are known through their various businesses in the market of Medine in Segou. The members of this group sell clothing and cereal grains. With the goal of increasing their income and in order to satisfy the ever increase client deamnd, the members of the group integrated with Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Currently they are on their ninth loan cycle. Mrs. Koumba Ongoiba is the leader of the group in the Medine market in Segou where she sells beans, warmly nicknamed Koumba beans. She will use her loan to purchase 300 kg of beans. In Segou she stocks her supply of beans in the surrounding villages in and in the market in Medine. She completes her sales in cash and in credit, selling to private homes but also in the market in Medine. Her clientele is mostly made up of women. With the help of this loan Mrs. Koumba Ongoiba hopes to see a monthly income of 35 FCFA which will be reinvested back and the business, part will be placed in savings, and it will also pay for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans.

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.en:
Kulmira A. is a 43 year-old widow with four children. She finished secondary school at the age of 20 and got married. Kulmira’s husband worked at the local factory as a driver but his wage was too low to meet the needs of his growing family. To find an additional means of income, Kulmira and her husband started to sell vegetables at the market. This brought in a regular profit, which afterwards became the basis for a livestock-breeding business in which, with much effort, Kulmira achieved success. The level of the family's existence began to gradually improve, but in 2005 Kulmira’s husband died suddenly and she became the only bread-winner. She had a hard time, but didn’t give in doing everything she could to stabilize her children’s life. Today Kulmira has two cows and one horse at her farm. Also, with the help of her youngest son, Kulmira has broadened her business by selling meat products at the market. Kulmira wants a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy bull-calves to fatten and resell. With the revenue from this investment, Kulmira plans to buy a house for her son, who is now serving in the army. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the most vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dorjzodov

texts.en:
Dorjzodov T., age 34, operates a dairy trade business with the help of his wife at the local market in their town. He started his business in 2005 by selling a variety of consumer goods in a rented stall at the Tansag department store in the province, and moved his business to the local market in 2009. Dorjzodov purchases his dairy products from farmers in the surrounding countryside and sells them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is able to earn 4,000,000 to 5,000,000 MNT over a day of sales. In addition, his success has enabled him to purchase a new van for his family usage. 

He has recently purchased a large lot of dairy products worth 2,000,000 MNT; therefore, his working capital has decreased and limits future procurement of products for sale. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices. 	

Dorjzodov is a hardworking businessman who lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His son attends a local secondary school. For the future, he says, "My goal is to expand my business."

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices

loans.name: John Thuo

texts.en:
John has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 48 years old, married to Elizabeth Waithera, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goats which he will rear, slaughter, and he will sell the meat later in his butcher shop.

In future, John hopes to operate a large restaurant in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more goats to raise for meat

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S. is 37 years old and sells vegetables in the market of her Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$ 4 every day. Her husband grows rice and watermelon. On average, he earns US$ 2 in profit a day. This couple has three children. Tim S. wants to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cows to plow their farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow their farmland

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
YASAIDA LUPE, ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES", EL CUAL RECIENTEMENTE ACABA DE FORMARCE, Y SE ENCUENTRA INTEGRADO POR 07  SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE VILLA JUANITA EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA SRA. YASAIDA LUPE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA DE CALABAZA EN LAS AFUERAS DE UN COLEGIO. SE INICA EN ESTE NEGOCIO YA QUE EN EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO, A LOS NIÑOS LES GUSTA MUCHO ESTE POSTRE, ASI ES QUE YASALDA DECIDE PONER ESTE NEGOCIO, Y ES ASI COMO INICIA UNA FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SU HOGAR, PERMITIENDOLE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SUS HIJOS Y CRECER CON SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO.
CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO YASADIA LUPE HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO Y LOGRAR LA CAPTACION DE UNA MAYOR CLIENTELA, SU GRAN ANHELO ES PONER UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y EN LA COMPRA DE JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVIDEÑA.
texts.en:
Yasaida Lupe is a 27 years old single mother and has two young children. She is the president of the group “Los Angeles” [The Angels] which was formed recently. It is made up of seven members who live in the zone of Villa Juanita in the District of Carabayllo.

She has been selling pumpkin biscuits outside her son’s school for a year. She started this business because the students like them very much and she wanted a source of income. It has improved her and her children’s quality of life.

Her hard work has contributed to the success of her business and an increase in the number of costumers. Her dream is to have her own stand at the market.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and to buy toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy toys for the Christmas season

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

La señora Josefa es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución como por ejemplo el seguro de vida. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha tenido seis hijos, cuatro  son mayores de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y viven con ella. Ella es de la Provincia de  Chimborazo pero ya hace años se vino a esta ciudad.

Tiene un puesto en el centro de Portoviejo en el cual  se dedica a la  venta de frutas, más que todo frutas de la sierra como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras ricas frutas de esta parte del país. Ya son como 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad en esta ciudad. Las frutas las traen desde una distribuidora mayorista en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas  como: manzanas, uvas, peras, duraznos, entre otras frutas. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Josefa is a founding member of the community bike and she likes it for the additional benefits which the institution provides such as, for example, life insurance.  Josefa is 50 years old.  She is married and has six children.  Four of her children are already grown up and the two youingest are in high school and live with her.  She is from Chimborazo province but she came to this city years ago.

Josefa has a stall in the center of Portoviejo where she sells fruit, above all fruit from the mountains such as: apples, grapes, pears and peaches, as well as other delicious fruit from this part of the country.  She has been in this business for around 20 years.  She gets her fruit from a wholesale supplier in Guayaquil.

This loan will be used to buy fruit such as: apples, grapes, pears, peaches, etc.  Josefa's dream is to remain in good health so that she can continue working.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, peaches, pears, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Isaias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Antonio Isaias; el tiene 72 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos como papa y maíz, el vende en el mercado de Huancaro de forma independiente desde los 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa y maíz. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y maíz al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonio Isaias belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Antonio Isaias is 72 years old, married, and has six children.  He alternates his daily activities with the business of selling products like potatoes and corn.  He sells independently at the Huancaro market from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He wants to expand his business of selling potatoes and corn.

He is requesting the loan to buy potatoes and corn wholesale.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and corn wholesale

loans.name: C6220 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Bernadette is 46 years old and is married with three children between the ages 5 and 12 years old. She is the representative of a group which is called Abizerwa in the local language.

Bernadette owns a small shop which sells green bananas and she has two years experience in the business. She employs three persons in her business as  helpers so that her business will run well. Her business starts at 6am until 7pm, every day except Sunday.

Bernadette and her group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses for the purpose of earning more profits. With the profits, they expect to improve their businesses. Bernadett in particularly, needs a fridge which will allow her to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children between 1 and 13 years old.  She also has one adopted child she cares for.  

Marie Louise has a business selling mobile phones.  She plans to use her loan to expand and purchase more mobile phones. She will use the profit she makes to continue to reinvest in growing and improving her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Luz Emilsen

texts.es: Luz P. P. es la propietaria de la Tienda La Caleña, allí vende productos al detalle,  como ranchos, víveres, refrescos y licores, actividad que forma parte de su vocación y  que inició en el año 2008 cuando se vino a la Costa Norte de Colombia  con su esposo y sus dos hijos, hoy en las edades de 14 a 21 años. Con una liquidación de su esposo cuando trabajaba, emprendieron la mencionada actividad, con poco capital, pero gradualmente fueron comprando sus activos fijos y surtiendo su negocio en muy pequeñas cantidades.  En la actualidad están aún en el punto de equilibrio,  porque no querían endeudarse si no estaban organizados para pagar puntualmente. Como el esposo de Luz empezó a trabajar como vigilante, han decidido iniciar su vida crediticia con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y esta es la razón por la cual recurren a su credikiva, además de querer responder a su  necesidad  de crecer que sin este apoyo está limitada por la falta de capital de trabajo disponible para comprar todos los productos de la canasta familiar que sus clientes exigen cada vez más; Con su credikiva, surtirán la tienda con productos de mayor salida porque en el futuro desean emprender una nueva actividad simultánea a la tienda: vender comidas rápidas y este es justamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Luz P. P. is the owner of “Tienda La Caleña” where she sells retail products such as food, provisions, soft drinks, and liquor.  This activity became part of her vocation in 2008 when she came to the northern coast of Colombia with her husband and two children, who are now 14 and 21 years old.  With the severance pay her husband received from his job, Luz started her business with little capital.  She gradually acquired fixed assets and stocked her business in small quantities.  At the moment, she has reached a point of equilibrium so she does not want to accumulate debt unless she is organized enough to make her payments on time.  Since her husband started a job as a security guard, Luz decided to begin building her credit record with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This is why she has returned for a Kiva loan.  In addition, she wants to respond to her need for growth because without this support, Luz is limited by her lack of capital for buying all of the everyday products that her customers are demanding.  

With her Kiva loan, Luz will stock her store with products that have high turnover.  In the future she wants to start a new business in addition to her store, selling fast food.  This will be her greatest challenge.

loans.use: To restock her store with products such as oil, rice, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda A. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Chanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she provides recycling services, buying and selling junk and other waste materials like plastics and bottles for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.

Chanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Vor

texts.en: Vor H., age 60, is a boat repairer and a cashew seller in and around her community, Kompong Tom province. She and her husband always work together in the same business.  They can generate a combined income of around $12.50 each day to use for their family.  The couple tries their best to earn money in order to feed their four kids until they are old enough to get a proper job. In order to make extra income, Vor H. would like to request a loan to buy cashews to stock her store, while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.use: to stock up on cashews, while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. has three children. She sells bowls, secondhand clothes, frozen meat and fish in Abbina, near Elmina. Her husband is a security man and Araba uses her income to assist him in providing for the household's basic needs. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fish and meat to freeze for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to build a cold store.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and meat to freeze for resale.

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza B. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and is married to a taxi driver. They have raised three sons and a daughter. All the children are married and live separately with their families. The first son is engaged in retail trade in Bishkek and the other children are working in Russia. In 2006, with the initial investment of 30000 soms, Roza started to breed farm animals. She also sells 9-10 liters of milk every day. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase seven more animals for breeding. In the near future, Roza wants to purchase home appliances to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Bety Benedicta

texts.es:
Bety de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que tiene un negocio de venta de comidas en su casa para poder ayudar en los gastos a su esposo ya que él es cerrajero. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano preparando la comida en su casa para vender los almuerzos a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. Vende desayunos, almuerzos.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio de venta de comida por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar pescados, arroz y otros víveres para hacer comidas que satisfagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bety, age 32, is a hardworking woman who has a business selling food from her home. This allows her to help her husband, a locksmith, with the household expenses.

At the moment, she begins preparing food very early at her home so that she can sell lunches to her customers. Bety works every day from 5am to 1pm. She sells breakfast and lunch.

Bety has many aspirations for her food business, so she is requesting a loan to buy fish, rice, and other ingredients used in preparing the meals that will satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Houenoussou Iii Group

texts.fr: HOUENOUSSOU III est un groupement constitué de seize personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Pascaline. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même village au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1970 au Bénin, Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants dans une ville du Bénin. Pascaline est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Dieudonné et a quatre enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Pascaline assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Pascaline n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis environs huit ans, Pascaline produit de l'huile de palme qu'elle vend à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Pascaline vend des tissus. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Pascaline achète ses produits dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Pascaline et aux autres membres du groupement HOUENOUSSOU III de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Houenoussou III is a group composed of sixteen people, whose president (who is raising her hand on the picture) is named Pascaline. The group's members live in the same village in Benin. In order to increase their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time.
Born in Benin in 1970, Pascaline lives together with her husband and children in a town in Benin. She is married to a farmer named Dieudonné and has four children, who all attend school. Pascaline provides for the family's various expenses together with her husband. She never went to school.
For about eight years, Pascaline has been producing palm oil, which she sells out of her home. In parallel to this activity, Pascaline sells fabrics. This business generates revenues and helps her to contribute to family expenses. Pascaline purchases her products at one of Benin's markets.
This first loan will certainly allow Pascaline and the other members of the Houenoussou III group to raise their level of activity, grow their clientele and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy 20 tubs of palm fruit.

loans.name: Chamrouen

texts.en: Chamrouen, 59 years old, is a weaver. Her husband is a village leader.  Their income is $4.50 per day. They have one son who is 10 years old and studying at school. Every month Chamrouen has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy silk to weave and sell to get more income. She wants to extend her business to make more products and sell to other provinces.She  also wants to repair her house because now it is not in good condition. More than that, in the future, Chamrouen wants to send her child to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Karen Mercedes

texts.es: Karen Mercedes tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues es una persona emprendedora que disfruta de ofrecerles a sus hijos el medio de ingreso necesario para que puedan aspirar una mejor vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas, ropa en general entre otros.
texts.en: Karen Mercedes is 32 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise and she has been in this business for more than four years.  Karen is an entrepreneurial woman who enjoys being able to provide for her children, making the income they need to aspire to a better life.  She is requesting this loan to buy bags, footwear, cosmetics, sheets, clothes and other products.

loans.use: to buy bags, footwear, cosmetics, sheets, clothes, and other products

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 39-year-old married woman in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has two healthy school-aged children. 

Arlyn is operating a sari-sari (variety) store in their community as a source of living. She has enjoyed this buying and selling activity for two years already. 

Arlyn makes a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase soft drinks, especially in demand this hot season. 

Arlyn has been a GDMPC member for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business and sell more soft drinks and similar items to elevate the usual income generated.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, especially in demand this hot season.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.

Lilia has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Lilia would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico (como jarras, bañadores, basureros, etc.) en una tienda de su propiedad. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir mayor cantidad de bañadores, baldes y demás artículos para el hogar, pues tiene mucha demanda. Vive en casa en propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Villa Armonía de  la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene seis  hijos. Roberto es cliente de IMPRO desde el año  2009 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto sells plastic goods such as containers, wash basins, garbage cans, and other items. He has his own store. The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire a large quantity of wash basins, buckets, and other household items that are in high demand. Roberto lives in his own home in the District of Villa Armonía in the city of La Paz. He is married and has six children.

Roberto has been a client of IMPRO since 2009 and has a very good payment history.

loans.use: to acquire a large quantity of wash basins, buckets, and other household items.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 21 years old and married with one child who is in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Julia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 50 years old and married with two children, ages 18 and 30.  He runs a used clothing store in Kissy which is a neighborhood in Freetown.  He also takes care of two relatives.

Hassan has owned this business for 30 years.  He also earns income from renting out a house.  He says that the main challenge to his business is that during heavy rain, sales are slow.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase used clothes for sale.  Hassan says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve immensely.  In the future, he would like to begin importing goods oversea.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes items.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony tiene 43 años, es casado con Valentina de 44 años, con quien tiene 04 hijos. Juntos habian en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Cocos, Pichari. Se le consdiera como un hombre negociador, pues se dedica en la venta de combustible, éste negocio empezó cuando trabajaba en el transporte fluvial. Con el tiempo logró comprarse su propio motor y canoa, para dedicarse él mismo con este servicio. Tiempo despues se percato la falta de un grifo, y de la demanda que había, por tal razón es que puso en marcha en este nuevo negocio, que es la venta de combustible. Actualmente tiene muchos clientes, su esposo es quien la ayuda en la atención, mientras que él continua trabajando con su canoa. El único inconveniente es que la venta lo realiza artesanalmente, por ello desea para el futuro instalar un surtidor, de esa manera la atención será más eficaz. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles, podrá comprar más combustible.
texts.en:
Jhony is 43 years old.  He is married to Valentina, aged 44, with whom he has four children.  They live together in their own home, located in the Puerto Cocos community in Pichari.  

He considers himself to be a businessman, as he works selling fuel.  He began this business when he was working in river transport.  Over time, he was able to buy his own motor and canoe, so that he could offer this service himself.  Some time later, he noticed there was a lack of a fuel provider, and this need was the reason he launched this new business selling fuel.

Currently he has many customers.  His wife helps out tending to them, while he continues working with his canoe.  The only inconvenience is that right now they make their sales by hand, so in the future he wants to install a pump, so that they can serve their customers more efficiently.

This will be his third loan with MFP, and he agrees to be punctual with his repayments.  With the 3,000 Soles, he will be able to buy more fuel.

loans.use: to buy more fuel.

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Erdene-Ochir, 40, runs a taxi and freight transport business. He lives with his two daughters and his recently married wife. 
Initially, in 2009, Erdene-Ochir bought a mini truck for freight transportation. Later he bought a light car with his accumulated earnings and set up a business-taxi service in 2010. His businesses have been running well. Previous to this work, Erdene-Ochir used to work as a driver in a public organization. 
Erdene-Ochir has an adult-aged son from his previous marriage. He wants to support his son to purchase his own house and land in a rural area. He thinks that this is his fatherly responsibility and charge. Erdene-Ochir wants to buy the property now before the price rises. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the payment for the house and land for his son. He has taken several loans in the past and repaid them all successfully and on time.

loans.use: to cover the payment of house and land for his son.

loans.name: Mortada

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and a father of one child.

Mortada is a photographer.  In 2006, he decided to open his own store for printing, photocopying and imaging. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to renovate his store.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain has been an owner of a men's clothing shop since 2008. This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and the father of two children. He has more than four years' experience in his field. He has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Hussain decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to make a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to make a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, nuevamente necesita un préstamo, porque comprara más maquinaria para su taller como: un compresor de aire para pintar, pues es de mucha utilidad en su taller. 
Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a comprar otras herramientas y se logró salir con los trabajos y tener más clientes y los  ingresos fueron mejores, este avance le permitió que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Elmer is once again requesting a loan because he wants to purchase more machinery for his workshop, such as an air compressor for painting, since it will be very useful. His previous loans have helped him purchase other tools, and those have helped him do his work and bring in more customers and improve his revenue. This loan will allow him to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y cuajada, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos vecinos y familiares. Conocen muy bien el arduo trabajo que realiza constantemente. Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de maíz, comal, leña, leche, sal entre otros. Irma ha logrado mejorar cada día su actividad ha sido por medio de los financiamientos que obtiene.
texts.en: Irma has been working with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and this is not the first time that she has requested a loan. Her business is selling tortillas and cuajadas (a compact, cheese-like product). Most of her customers are friends, neighbors and family members. They know very well how hard she constantly works. Irma is requesting this loan to buy corn, a tortilla hotplate, firewood, milk, salt and other products. Irma has managed to consistently improve her business through the loans that she takes out.

loans.use: to buy corn, a tortilla hotplate, firewood, milk, salt and other products

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Querer es Poder” está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican principalmente al rubro del comercio, vendiendo ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Paola integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila en cuclillas, ubicada en el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo una polera a rayas horizontales y un pantalón floreado.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 5 años, específicamente vendiendo abarrotes y verduras en un puesto que habilitó en el ante jardín de la casa de sus madre, en la cual vive. 
Comenta que tenía una verdulería, pero debió establecerse en la casa de su madre, ya que estaba embarazada y era muy sacrificado el trabajo. 
Con el crédito comprará verduras, papel higiénico y detergente al por mayor, para su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 
Las metas en su negocio son abastecerlo con más mercadería y obtener la patente (permiso municipal, que le permitirá vender).
Paola vive junto a sus padres, hermanos, esposo y sus dos hijos de 4 años y 2 meses de vida. 
Sus sueños son mejorar los ingresos de su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Además anhela obtener su casa propia, para esto debe postular al subsidio habitacional. 
Paola está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le ha permitido  invertir en su negocio. 
Además comenta que las reuniones le han permitido conocer más al grupo del cual forma parte. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called 'Querer es Poder' ('Where there's a will there's a way') and consists of 15 entrepreneurs who work mainly in the commerce sector, selling merchandise such as clothes, among other things. All members are from the municipality of San Bernardo, located in the city of Santiago. 

Paola is a member of this communal bank. In the photo she is squatting in the front row on the left, wearing a horizontally striped shirt and flowery trousers. She has been working in commerce for five years, selling groceries and vegetables at a stall she established in the front garden of her mother's house, which is where she lives with her parents, siblings, husband, and two children aged four years and two months.

Paola explains that she had a greengrocers shop, but had to relocate her business to her mother's house as she was pregnant and had to sacrifice herself to her work. 

With this loan, Paolo will buy wholesale vegetables, toilet paper and detergent for her store. Her business goals are to stock her store with more goods and obtain the municipal patent for her business which will allow her to sell her products. 

Her dream is to improve the income generated from her business and provide a better quality of life for her family. She also longs to own her own home and for this she needs to apply for a housing subsidy. 

Paola is very pleased with and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza, as the loan allows her to invest in her business. She has also said that the communal bank meetings have helped her learn more about the group which she is a part of.

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km directly south of the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is known as the capital of folklore as in January each year the International Folklore Festival takes place, an event where the country's roots come together and musical groups from all over South America meet. San Bernardo also hosts the Traditional Crafts Fair, which features both Chilean craftsmen and those from other nearby countries. In April, an event called 'Abril Cuecas Mil' takes place which consists of dancing cueca (Chilean folk dance) throughout the entire district.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables, toilet paper and detergent for sale in her grocery store

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is 53 and has two school-aged children. He aims to uplift their status of living to escape poverty. To this end, he is engaged in selling ukay-ukay (used clothes) while his wife manages their small eatery. He has been in this business for almost one year and six months and has used his profits of 10,000 PHP a month to acquire his family's necessities and finance the education of their children.

He aims to strengthen his business and make it a viable source of income. Due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of ukay-ukay (used clothes) for sale in the market. He believes that through his patience and sacrifices, he will improve his business and achieve his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ukay-ukay (used clothes) for sale

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 27 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and a high school graduate.

For eight years now Mama has been operating an electrical shop, where she sells radios, sound systems, etc.  Most interestingly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more radios and sound systems for her business; she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more radios and sound systems for her business.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Philippines. Marialyn has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled materials such as plastic bottles, metals, and cans. She has had this business for five years. 

Marialyn  is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy recycled materials such as plastic bottles and metals.  Marialyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells secondhand shoes at the market at both retail and wholesale prices. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand shoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to build commercial houses and start selling wholesale only. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a student who recently joined college in Nairob,Kenya. Being a youth from a low income family, he needs to raise money for his school fees. He learned about the Fresh Life franchise and figured he could use income from this business to pay for school. 
The area Davis wishes to set up his business also faces a lack of proper sanitation facilities. He hopes that setting up a Fresh Life toilet will improve the status of sanitation as well as raise enough money for school. He  seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets, this will help him achieve his desire to run a franchise and also be able to raise school fees.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is male aged 41 married with eight children, seven attending school living in Kasese Uganda. He owns a boutique, has a motorcycle transport business and also deals in crop farming. He has been in business for six years. 

He needs money to buy clothes for selling. He has hopes of educating his children but faces a challenge of market competition and inflation on imported goods.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Niyazi

texts.en:
Niyazi is a refugee from Shusha city of Nagorno Karabakh. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is homeless and staying in a worker\\\'s hostel in the Tagiyev settlement around Sumgayit city.

Niyazi opened his business in 1998. He started selling a small variety of fruits in Sumgayit\\\'s collective farm market. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family\\\'s food and important consumption needs.

In 2003-2004, Niyazi borrowed $300 and $500 from Normicro and expanded his business considerably reaching $1200 in income.

Now he wants to borrow $800 loan to open a vegetable section of his counter and, though this, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Niyazi will use this loan for opening a vegetable section of his business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been doing this business for the last ten years. She started with capital of $350. She is married and has two children who are going to school. She is educated to level 10 and she has training in business management.

Given the loan, she wants to purchase additional stock to enable her to sell in more than the one market which she currently serves.

She would use her income to educate her children and save for future use.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock for her business

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera runs a kiosk selling perfumes at the local market. She has been in business for four years. Vera’s father has been a huge help to her as she has gotten started as a young entrepreneur. Currently she has about $1,600 in inventory. Her monthly gross income is about $1,000, and her net profit amounts to $600.

Vera’s name means “faith” in Russian. Faith is something that has motivated this young lady to start her business and invest in its growth. Vera is very focused and determined and is a good learner. She believes that she has achieved success in business thanks to her Dad who has been her best teacher in the field.

Vera has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has been characterized by responsibility and reliability as she has promptly repaid each loan she has taken. Today Vera is asking for a loan of $1,200 to re-supply her inventory and purchase a wider assortment of perfumes, cosmetics items, and skincare products. She believes that by increasing her inventory of quality products she will be able to provide a sensible approach for her clients to enhance their natural beauty through various skin, body, and hair care products, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children, of whom two are in secondary school. Upon completion of secondary school, Anna was married to a taxi driver. Income from her husband alone could not meet all the family expenses, let alone school fees for the children.

That situation forced Anna to find a means to help her husband raise the family. She decided to join a training course in batik-making from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO). Since she started this business twelve years ago, she has acquired a lot of customers for her own batik. She now has both regular and new customers.

She needs USD 600 to add a stock of raw materials for batik-making. Anna M.’s cloth business is continuing to grow, in part because of the raw materials she was able to purchase with the money from her first loan with Kiva, which she has repaid in full.

loans.use: Adding to her stock of batik-making materials

loans.name: Thi Cuc

texts.vi:
D. Thi Cuc is 40 years old and has been a participating member of the “Quy Tinh Thuong” since 3/1999. Together with her husband, Le Van Sy, they own a company that manufactures wood products at Bac Phu state, Soc son district, Ha Noi. During the eight years participating in the program, her family always borrowed the maximum amount to invest in the manufacturing of beds, chairs, tables, dressers, things that every family must have. Her family receives a monthly income of about $310 from this business which has been in operation for 11 years. It has 4 employees, each earning $75/month. In addition to working on the orders received the company also cuts woods for other companies in the area.

She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien Lam, Kive volunteer.

Chị Đàm Thị Cúc, 40 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ tháng 3/1999. Chị cùng với chồng là anh Lê Văn Sỹ là chủ một cơ sở sản xuất đồ gỗ tại xã Bắc Phú, huyện Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. Trong 8 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị luôn vay mức vốn cao nhất để đầu tư vào việc đóng giường, tủ, bàn ghế … những vật dụng không thể thiếu được trong mỗi gia đình. Thu nhập từ hoạt động này mang lại cho gia đình chị bình quân mỗi tháng 310 USD. Hiện tại cơ sở sản xuất của anh chị đã hoạt động được 11 năm và có 4 công nhân làm việc với mức lương 75 USD/tháng. Ngoài việc sản xuất theo đơn đặt hàng anh chị còn nhận làm thêm dịch vụ xẻ gỗ thuê cho các cơ sở khác. Gia đình chị đang muốn vay thêm 1200 USD để mở rộng sản xuất.

loans.use: buy wood to make bed, table, wardrobe ...

loans.name: Mirvahid

texts.ru:
Mirvahid K. was born in the city of Agsu 1958. He is married and has three children. He diligently takes care of his business. He is very hardworking and takes good care of his clients. However his car is in need of repairs. Mirvahid came to the Agsu branch of Normico LLC in order to obtain a loan that will allow him to fix his car.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Камилов Мирвахид .Родился 1958 году. Женат.Имеет троих детей. Уроженец города Ахсу. Активно занимается своей работой.Этот милый и трудолюбивый человек бережно обслуживает своих клиентов.Но автомашина частично нуждается в ремонте. Чтобы отремонтировать автомашину Мирвахид обратился Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала для получения кредита.Получив кредит он отремонтировал свою машину.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos lives on Rodolfo Palenque Avenue in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. He lives together with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper. He has two sons; 16 and 14 years old.

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He works as a waiter in a restaurant at the airport of the city. This is his second loan with IMPRO. His evaluation showed that he is eligible to request the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Santos vive en la Avenida Rodolfo Palenque de la zona Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de repuestos de su movilidad. Trabaja como garzón en el restaurante de el aeropuerto de la cuidad. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Mrs. Margaret O. is 55 years old, married and has 6 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions. this was a business she started in 1996. she is in need of  $875 to enable her to buy more provision for sale.
She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sell

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Siang

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Siang and her husband live by themselves. Their children are all grown up and already married and live by themselves. Even though they no longer have someone to support but they can only live with minimum standard. Both of them work together to support their life. They choose to farm piglets. They farm 1 breeding pig and 1 piglets in traditional ways by attaching them in a tree because they don't have money to build a hut. In 6 month they can get a proceed of IDR 1.5 million (approx. USD 157). At the moment she needs additional capital to build a permanent hut.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Diusia yang sudah setengah baya, Ni Nyoman Siang dan suami hanya tinggal berdua. Anak-anak mereka sudah menikah dan sudah mandiri. Walaupun mereka sudah tidak punya tanggungan, tetapi tetap saja hidup mereka pas-pasan. Mereka berdua bekerjasama untuk berusaha lain. Hanya memelihara babi usaha yang tepat untuk mereka jalani. Dengan memelihara 1 induk dan 1 penggemukan,Siang sangat menikmati kesibukan yang dilakukan setiap hari.3 kali dalam 1 hari babi peliharaannya diberi makan. Babi peliharaannya dipelihara secara tradisional diikat dipohon karena Ni Nyoman Siang belum memiliki modal untuk membuat kandang. Dalam 6 bulan mendapat keuntungan Rp.1.500.000,- Biasanya anak-anak babinya dibeli oleh warga setempat. Sehingga bila induk babinya beranak, Ni Nyoman Siang mendapat uang dan keuntungan. Ni Nyoman Siang sangat senang menjalani usaha ini. Saat ini Ni Nyoman Siang membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha yang nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang yang lebih layak dari sekarang supaya babi yang dipeliharanya tidak lagi diikat dibawah pohon.

loans.use: To build a permanent hut (Membuat kandang yang permanen)

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoun Y. and her husband married in 1974. They have eight children; three sons and five daughters. Four of the children have married. Three live in separate housing, one lives with them, and the younger four children are in school.

Mrs. Thoun has been a weaver for over forty years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband grows rice and vegetables near the house. They live along the Mekong River about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thoun Y. is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her son to use to run a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for a motor taxi

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon S. is 28 years old and works as a tailor in the Kampong Cham province. In this job, she earns approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband, Naroth, helps provide for their two children by working construction, earning similar wages.

The couple hopes to invest in a motorbike so that Naroth can work as a taxi driver in addition to his current construction job. They hope that this will increase their total family income and provide a better life for their children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to be used as a taxi.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Pili M.. She is married, and has five children between the ages of 2 and 11. Pili owns a tailoring business. She earns about US $90 every month from this business. Pili requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth and  sewing accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Sinon Pen Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinon P. is the leader of a four-person business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker. Her husband, Mr. San K., is a commune chief in the village. Mrs. Sinon P. and her husband have a child who attends the local school.

Mrs. Sinon P. now wants to expand her business because her business activity has improved, but she does not have enough mats to sell to her customers. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials to make more mats to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to make more mats to sell.

loans.name: Christine Kiwanuka's Group

texts.en:
Christine K. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 48 years old and is married with six children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and her youngest is 8 years old. All of her children are in school. Christine lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Christine has operated her retail shop for the past ten years. Her customers are mainly local people with families. Christine's biggest challenges are having only a few customers (who typically only buy small things) and the high cost of products.

Christine plans on using this loan to increase her stock by purchasing wholesale and to install piped water in her home. Christine will then be able to sell more products, including water, and increase her profits. With the profits, Christine will continue to pay school fees. She hopes to eventually be able to afford to buy a motorcycle to rent out and to purchase a refrigerator to sell cold drinks.

Christine has successfully paid back seven loans to MCDT. It is through these loans that she has been able to keep her children in school and install electricity.

loans.use: Increase stock and install piped water

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer dedicated to the growing of plantains. In spite of the fact that their fields are very far from their home, she and her husband are there early every morning to fertilize and cultivate them. They have been farming since they got married and this way supporting their home. This work takes almost all day, therefore they get up at dawn to prepare food for their children and then go to their fields. They consider their work beautiful since they can spend several hours a day together, the difficult part is the time in route in the sun.

The main driver of their work is the children, who being in school require a large financial investment.

This is the reason for the request of a loan for the purchase of plantings of plantains that will help increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Es agricultora, se dedica al cultivo de plátano, a pesar de que sus terreno se encuentran muy lejos de su hogar, ella y su esposo cada día muy temprano están ahí para abonarlos y cosechar. Desde que se casaron empezaron juntos con esta actividad para el sustento de su hogar.Este trabajo casi les toma gran parte del día, por ello se levantan de madrugada para preparar la alimentaron de sus hijos y luego marchar hacia sus terrenos.Consideran que su trabajo es muy hermoso, puesto que pueden compartir juntos varias horas, lo más difícil es el tiempo de caminata bajo el sol.

El motor de su trabajo son sus hijos, quienes son escolares y requieren de mayor inversión para su educación.

Es así, que solicitan este préstamo para la compra de plantaciones de plátanos que les ayude a incrementar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Purchase of plantings of plantains to increase production.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Cũng giống như bao người phụ nữ nông thôn khác sau khi xây dựng gia đình thu nhập của gia đình chị Nghiên chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Tuy phải lao động rất vất vả nhưng cuộc sống gia đình chị vẫn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Năm 1994 chị Nghiên  tham gia vào quỹ để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi nhưng đến năm 2008 chị mạnh dạn  chuyển đổi ngành nghề từ chăn nuôi chuyển sang  mua 2 máy may và nhận hàng làm thuê cho các cơ sở. Vốn là người phụ nữ khéo tay chị còn mua thêm vải về cắt may bán hàng cho các quầy hàng tại chợ huyện và nhận may quần áo cho bà con địa phương.Hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi, may mặc  4 đến 5 triệu đồng .Sau một thời gian vay vốn làm ăn, kinh tế gia đình chị đến nay rất ổn định, chị đã xây được ngôi nhà 2 tầng  rất khang trang với diện tích 80m2  và mua sắm được một số tiện nghi có giá trị .
Chị  muốn vay 19.000.000 đ để mua thêm máy may và mở xưởng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Just like a lot of young women after having a family, Ms. N. depended on raising livestock and providing child care as a source of income for her family. She worked hard to provide for her family, but she was unable to see the income coming in through her hard work. In 1994, Ms. N. joins this organization in hope to better her family financially. In the beginning, she was able to borrow and use the loan to invest in raising farm animals. But in 2008, she got the courage to switch business from raising livestock to purchasing 2 sewing machines and started accepting workloads from several companies. Ms. N. is a very skilled with her hands. In addition to her work, she buys fabric to make pieces of clothing to sell in the local market. She also offers tailoring services to the people in her village. The family monthly income between raising farm animals and her sewing works average in about 4 to 5.000.000d/month. After a period of borrowing and investing, the family financial status has improved and since been stable. She was able to build a 2 story home, furnishing it with quality items that have values. She is requesting a loan of 19.000.000d to buy more sewing machines and capital for a convenient store business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es: Yoli tiene 46 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es una mujer muy activa, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, y en sus ratos libres brinda el servicio de corte de cabello en su domicilio.Ella es madre soltera, trabaja duro papa brindar a sus hijos la educación necesaria, esperando que los mismos, en el futuro sean unos profesionalesYoli quiere crecer en su negocio, y con el tiempo llegar a ser mayoritaria de abarrotes y desde luego construir un pequeño local para poner su salón de belleza, para esto requiere de un capital que la incentivará a lograr su meta en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Yoli is 46 years old, is the mother of 2 children, and is a very active woman. She sells groceries and in her spare time gives haircuts in her home. She is a single mother and works hard to provide her children with necessary education, hoping that in the future they will become professionals. Yoli wants to build her business, first primarily in grocery sales, and later she would like to build a small place to have a beauty salon. For this she needs capital which would encourage her to reach her goal in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased investment capital for her grocery store and future beauty salon

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu B.. Isatu is a member of a group called Good Sababu. This will be her fourth loan from SMT. Isatu’s business had been completely ruined by the rebel invasion of her town when she approached SMT for her first loan. But thanks to SMT’s loans, she was able to gradually get herself off the ground once again.

Previously, she received Le 600,000.00 from Kiva through SMT. The loan helped her business and improved her livelihood. She thanks God for that loan as it enabled her to solve her numerous problems. She has repaid it successfully and is today requesting a loan of Le 800,000.00 to help further strengthen her business.

Isatu was born in Kabala and is forty years of age. She is married with four children. One of her daughters is already married, two are in school and the last is not yet of school age. Her husband trades in cows and she trades in miscellaneous items. She sells items like palm oil, kola nuts, dishes, clothes, cigarettes, cheese and so on. She buys some of the goods she sells in Freetown (about 570 miles round-trip) because of the cheaper prices in Freetown. She buys the other items in Bo, the country’s second largest city, located in southern Sierra Leone.

With this loan, Isatu is planning to buy more inventory so that the amount of profit she makes will increase. With a lot of profit, she will be able to solve her household problems, assist her children in their schooling and buy herself a piece of land.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Haydee V. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, el nombre de mi pulperia es Xiomara, tengo un año de haber inagurado mi negocio, en estos momentos mi negocio es pequeño pero tengo muchos deseos de superme y hacer crecer mi negocio lo mas que pueda, soy casada pero ya mi hijo esta grande y no tengo obligaciones con el, porque el ya formo su hogar, mi esposo es albañil y los dos salimos adelante con los gastos de nuestro hogar, estoy solicitando este credito para poder hacer que mi negocio sea mas grande y asi tener mejores ganancias, estoy feliz ya que me va bien en mi negocio y mis clientes me prefieren porque la atencion que les doy es especial.
texts.en:
My name is Haydee V. and I sell grocery products in my small store called Xiomara. I started my business a year ago; it is still rather small but I have dreams of growing my business all I can. I am married and my son is an adult so I no longer need to provide for him since he already started his own family. My husband is a construction worker and together we are able to cover the family's expenses. I am requesting a loan in order to expand my business and improve my income. I am happy that my business is going well and that my customers prefer me because I provide them great customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorcyle for motorcycle-taxi service

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махмадиева ахина . 26 лет, не замужем. Занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Шьет уже 3 года. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ей увеличить объем производимой продукции и даст возможность увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahina M. is 26 years old, not married. She sews national Tajik dresses and has been doing it for the past three years. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics. This will help her increase her production volume and increase her profits. She will be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif Q. is 40 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as: sweets, products, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Vasif is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Vasif's additional source of income is as an accountant in the local organization, but works there just to keep his accountant knowledge. 
Vasif applied for a 1200 USD loan to grow and expand his business. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase and diversify more food products

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción M. tiene 43 años, su estado civil es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña María es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que Doña María se dedica a su negocio. Y dio inicio con muy poco capital, y es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña María son de mantener su negocio activo ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa y así no perdería su clientela.  Doña María sueña en convertir su pequeño negocio en una distribuidora que ofrezca lo necesario. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 13.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepcion M. is 43-years old and married with 3-children. All her children are working. La actividad economica de Dona Maria is a store. Maria has dedicated herself to the business for more than 10 years now. It started with very little capital and it’s through funding that she’s been able to improve her business.

The requirements for Maria are to maintain her business actively as it is a unique form of income. The funding is for working capital to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, cheese and beverages so as to not lose clientele. Maria’s dream is to convert her little business into a distributor that offers all the necessities. The loan is for C$13.000 cordobas which will be repaid in 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for store needs.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
A. Julienne est née vers 1963 et mariée à AGBANNON Faustin. A. Julienne est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. A. Julienne vend de condiments, de l’huile rouge, de charbon et aussi de gari(farine de manioc). A. Julienne s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à un lieu fixe de vente qui est devant sa maison. Dans le souci de diversifier son activité et de renforcer son capital A. Julienne a sollicité en 2007 un  premier prêt. ce prêt lui a permis de commencer la vente de charbon. Actuelle A. Julienne sollicite un nouveau prêt pour toujours renforcer ses activités.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Julienne A. was born around 1963 and is maried to Faustin Agbannon. She is the mother of five children, all of of them in school. Julienne A. sells condiments, red oil, charcoal and manioc flour. She obtains materials from the interior of her country and has established a location in front of her home from which she operates. Julienne A. took her first loan in 2007 to diversify her business and begin selling charcoal. She is requesting another loan to expand her business. In Bénin's local language, le Fon, Alidé means "there is always a way for poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a per capita income of $1,500. Alide offers special loans with 0% interest to the very vulnerable. It is also part of a group that will soon launch a micro- health insurance program for those benefiting from micro-credit..

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods: pepper, fresh tomatoes, onions, spices, smoked shrimp, charcoal, manioc flour and red oil.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili has owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $220. Each day she works at her business. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase, she will be able to grow her business, and she will be able to save money for future use.

Pili is 34 years old, married, and has four children aged 18 years, 16 years, 11 years, and 7 months. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more items in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her grocery store six years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods. She opened her grocery store to improve the living standards of her family.

Due to lack of money, she cannot upgrade her shop. So she is requesting a loan for Rs 25000.00 to buy various grocery goods.

Mrs. Kanchi M. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Binod M. is a taxi driver. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7 and daughter is studying in grade 10.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: Bruno tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja con la que tiene una hija de 14 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, a la fabricación de almidón, y además cuenta con una chacra donde siembra yuca. Estas actividades, las viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que lo mantiene ocupado, ya que es un hombre muy activo, y obtiene buenas ganancias porque sus productos (yucas) se venden muy rápido en el mercado, así como la madera. Para el futuro le gustaría ser exportador de almidón. Este es su 3er créditos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus compañeros son coordinados y respetuosos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará madera aprovechando la época de verano en su región, que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Bruno is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and 14-year-old daughter. He buys and sells lumber for a living. He also makes starch and has his own cassava farm. He has had these businesses for 4 years, and he has been prosperous. What he likes about his jobs is that they keep him busy—since he is a very active man—and that they generate good profits for him because his products (the cassava and the wood) sell quickly at the market.
