In the future, he would like to export starch. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance institute because his fellow members are respectful and work in harmony. With the loan that he is requesting, he will purchase wood, thus taking advantage of the summer season in his region, which is when lumber is in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for farming.

loans.name: Sergio José

texts.es: El Señor Sergio José O. tiene la edad de 36 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de barbería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio surge por sugerencias de amigos porque desde la edad de 20 años Sergio sabía perfectamente cortar pelo y al ver que lo hacia muy bien decide establecer su propia barbería, esta ubicada en el sector de la terminal de buses. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cepillo de barba, tijeras, navajas y rasuradoras. El sueño de Sergio es proporcionarle a su establecimiento mejoras de espacio para brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Señor Sergio José O. is 36 years old, married and has two children under his care. His economic activity is providing barber services. He's been engaged in this business for more than six years. His business came into being as a result of his friends' suggestions because ever since he was 20 years old, Sergio knew perfectly how to cut hair. And seeing as how he could do it very well, he decided to establish his own barbershop, which is located in the vicinity of the bus terminal. The loan is intended as working capital for the purchase of a barber's brush, scissors, razors and electric shavers. Sergio's dream is to provide himself with a more spacious establishment in order to provide his customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora es empleada domestica, trabaja en la calle Murillo y su esposo es jubilado. Por los pocos ingresos que tiene la señora recibe la ayuda de su hija que es madre soltera para que pueda solventarse los gastos de alimentación. 
Vive en la Zona de pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia
Requiere el crédito para el tratamiento medico de su esposo.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es un cliente con calificación 1 es decir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas
texts.en:
Isidora works as a housekeeper from her job on Murillo Street. Her husband is retired. Due to her low wages, Isadora receives assistance from her daughter, who is a single mother, in order to pay her food bill. She has her own home in the Pasankeri district of the city of La Paz.

She needs a loan to pay for her husband’s medical treatment. This is her third loan with IMPRO. Based on the responsibility she has demonstrated from previous loan opportunities, this client has been given a high rating – which indicates she will make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her husband's medical treatment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
ERLINDA U. is 55 years old, married with 6 adult children and a resident of Sitio Sutay, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental.

With such a big family, Erlinda and her husband have tried several business ventures over the years. They mostly farmed their small landholding which was very dependent on the whims of nature. It was not until Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 that they were able to really experience more stability in their financial situation. She used her first cycle loan to start a "Sari-sari" store - the local version of a general store where everyone can buy anything and everything that has a demand within the area - from foodstuff like canned and baked goods to charcoal and kerosene gas for fuel and even some hardware and farm implements. She also went into food vending and even raised a few heads of cattle over the years.

She used her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to buy ducklings to raise. It proved to be a good venture to pursue that she invested most of her subsequent loans to this activity, and it now earns her family an additional PHP 2,000.00 per month. Erlinda's last loan of PHP 17,000 was paid off on time, and now she is borrowing PHP 22,000.00 for her 16th cycle loan to purchase more ducklings to raise and sell.

Raising ducks has not only proved to be a profitable activity for Erlinda and her family, the ducks are also very eco-friendly: they provide natural pest control by eating the insects and other pests in the fields, leave organic fertilizer and tamp down the weeds in the rice fields where they feed. 

Erlinda hopes that in the future, the business ventures that she and her husband started will be able to support the families of their children, and make life more comfortable.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ducklings to raise and sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is the 38-year-old mother of four children. She has three children who are schooling while her last-born is still breastfeeding. She is very hardworking and resourceful to her family.

Catherine trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. She obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages in her community. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory.

Catherine has added the sale of phone-credits to her charcoal business. This she believes will bring additional income to support her home. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal and phone credits

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is married with four children. He has this small grocery shop in the center of his village. Hazem has had this shop for around two years, and it is the main source of income for the family. In addition to it, he has some land planted with olive trees where he sells  some olive oil in season.

In his grocery shop he sells vegetables and canned and frozen food, in addition to candy, sweets and other things, Hazem needs the  loan to buy more products for his shop since it is now Ramadan and there is high demand.

Hazem appears in the picture at his shop.

loans.use: To buy some products and vegetables for the shop

loans.name: Julia Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Julia Yolanda C. Y. es socia del Banco Comunal Maluay, vive  en la comunidad  Conchan de Milagro vía a santa Ana  perteneciente al sector el Valle.

Julia tiene 28 años,  de estado civil casada, concibió dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia  en la escuela Tomas Rendón del Valle, su esposo trabaja como estuquero,  se llevan muy bien en su vida conyugal  ayudándose mutuamente en los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por un hermano.

Julia es costurera aprendió el oficio por sí sola,   trabaja sólo por obra  desde hace cinco años elaborando  pantalones, sacos, chalecos, faldas, etc., como trabaja en su casa no tiene horario fijo pero casi todos los días labora desde las 9 a.m. a 12 pm.   y  de 2 p.m.  hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe distribuir su tiempo con los quehaceres del hogar.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación, se  sinte muy agradecida por que gracias a los préstamos que le han entregado ha logrado arreglar sus dos maquinas de coser  y comprar una plancha.

Con el préstamo obtenido va a  comprar una cocina  a gas que le hace falta.

Su meta es estudiar corte y confección para llegar a tener el titulo de sastre.
texts.en:
Julia Yolanda C. Y. is a member of the Communal Bank Maluay; she lives in the Conchan de Milagro community on the way to Santa Ana, which belongs to the El Valle sector.

Julia is 28 years old, married, and has two children ages 7 and 4; her eldest child studies in the Tomas Rendón del Valle school. Her husband works in construction applying stucco; they get along very well as a married couple as they help each other with household expenses. They do not own a house and for that reason they live in a house that they have barrowed from a brother.

Julia is a seamstress; she learned this trade by herself. For the past five years she has worked on order making pants, suits, jackets, skirts, etc. Because she works at home she does not have a fixed work schedule but almost everyday she works from 9am to 12pm, and from 2pm until the late hours in the evening given that she has to share her time with household chores.

This is her third loan cycle working with the foundation; she feels very thankful because thanks to the loans that she has been granted she has been able to repair two sewing machines and to purchase an iron.

With this loan that she has acquired she will obtain a gas stove that she is missing.

Her goal is to study how to cut and fashion clothing to earn a tailor title.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.Patricia, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, lleva 02 años en el negocio y ahora tiene como meta, seguir prosperando e implementándose mas en su actual negocio. Hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien en sus 02 negocios, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y venta de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa.Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal, aun tiene muchas metas por cumplir en su vida...Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  ya es muy conocida en el barrio; y cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario consumen sus bebidas, ya que sus las vende bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes y bebidas gasificadas

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a food vendor.

Lydia runs a chop (food) bar in her community. She buys foodstuffs such as cassava, plantains, etc. from nearby towns. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Lydia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items to prepare and sell

loans.name: Lacen Kome Tek Arach Judith Group

texts.en: Judith A. is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. For the last three years, she has made a living selling charcoal. She wants to expand her business, and has applied for this loan with the other members of her group so that she can buy more charcoal to sell. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers, expand her business and pay for the cost of educating her children.

loans.use: to expand a small charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa L. is a widow, 71 years old, and has five adult children. The family currently lives at Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

In 2004, Narcisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Narcisa is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. Since she has no husband anymore to help her in obtaining income, Narcisa works hard to support her family needs. She is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: K. Oliver is 28 years old; she is married and blessed with four children. Two of them are going to school. She has a retail shop and has been in business for five years so far. She will use this loan to purchase retail items such as drinks and essentials like salt, soap, sugar, match boxes, and so forth. She is adding capital into her business to expand her stock. She is an active hardworking business lady whose plan is to work very hard to purchase land and improve upon her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as drinks and essentials like salt, soap, sugar, match boxes, and so forth

loans.name: Ana Eugenia

texts.es: LA SRA. ANA EUGENIA ES PASANAKERA O VENTA DE PRODUCTOS A PLAZOS CON CUOTAS COMODAS DIARIAS, TIENE 17 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA Y LOS CLIENTES VARIAN POR TEMPORADAS ES FIESTAS DE FIN DE AÑO AUMENTAN SUS CLIENTES YA QUE ELLA OFRECE SUS CANASTONES NAVIDEÑOS. ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA QUE DIA A DIA COBRA PUESTO POR PUESTO A LAS COMERCIANTES A LAS QUE LES VENDE PRODUCTOS DE USO MASIVO, POR EJEMPLO VIVERES, Y TAMBIEN LES OFRECE ARTICULOS COMO ELECTRODOMESTICOS, ROPA, LLANTAS PARA VEHICULOS Y OTROS QUE LE PIDAN, ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS SUEGROS PERO YA TIENEN UN ESPACIO PROPIO DONDE VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS DOS HIJOS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Eugenia is an intermediary in the purchase and sale of products at favorable prices and financing terms. She has 17 years of experience and her customers vary depending on the season. During the end of year holiday season the customers increase, this is when she sells her Christmas baskets. She is a lady that collects from the vendors on a daily basis, the ones that she sells large scale items to, such as store supplies. She also offers appliances, clothing. automobile tires and other requested items. She lives with her in laws, where she has her own space where she resides with her husband and her two children. She is very hard working and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza Yolanda

texts.es: Esperanza Yolanda V. R. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 15 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Esperanza posee una venta de tortillas, jugos, y así mismo elabora y vende comida en las afueras de su casa. Este negocio nació debido a la necesidad que tenían de poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar y así mismo los estudios de su hija, es así como hace tres años Esperanza se decidió por poner un comedor en su hogar. Ella tiene muchos clientes ya que es muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo. Esperanza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras, granos básicos y otros productos más para la elaboración de la comida y de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Esperanza Yolanda V. R. is 44 years old, and lives in the department (administrative region) of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband and her 15 year-old daughter who studies in school. Esperanza has a business selling tortillas and juices, and she also makes and sells meals in the vicinity of her home. She started this business as a means to help cover the household expenses and also the educational expenses of her daughter. Three years ago Esperanza decided to put a place to serve meals in her home. She has a lot of customers since she is very responsible and dedicated to her work. Esperanza requests a loan to buy vegetables, staple grains and other products to use in the production of food and tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and staple grains

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 61, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia. C. has a business weaving traditional Cambodian silk, and earns an income of $5 USD per day. She has been engaged in this business since 2004. C.'s husband is a farmer, earning $3 USD per day. C. and her family members work hard to help each other attain a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as meet their daily expenses. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT. She wants to use her loan to buy more raw silk to produce traditional Cambodian silk for new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes, presenta Estudios Superiores en Enfermería Técnica.

Isabel anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de refrigerios en los interiores  de  un Instituto Tecnológico, siendo sus principales clientes, profesores, alumnos y moradores, ahora se dedica a la venta de golosinas  ubicado en los interiores de un Instituto Tecnológico. Decidió iniciar el negocio por su propia iniciativa y porque le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Hoy en día se siente muy contenta y tranquila, con el trabajo que realiza. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” comunal bank located in the Juanjui district of the Mariscal Cáceres Province in the Departament of San Martín. She is the 47 year old single mother of 2 adult children and is a trained nurse. Isabel used to sell refreshments within the Technical Institute, her primary customers being professors, students and local residents. Now she sells snacks and treats within the Technical Institute. She started this business through her own initiative and enjoys the personal contact and opportunity to grow as a person and woman. Today she is very happy and satisfied with her work. With this loan of 3,000 Soles ($1,050) she will buy snacks such as chocolate candy bars, suckers, caramels, and chewing gum of varying flavors and brands to satisfy her customers’ demands. She feels very satisfied with her work and believes that it’s worth the sacrifice to reach her life’s goals. She is also thankful for the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement) for the support they give to her and other women wanting to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Snacks for resale

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en: Irenia P. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 57 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Irenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Irenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irenia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher O. renders laundry services in his city. He loves this business because he is the only laundry man in his community and the demands for his services are high. He is an Igbo by tribe but he lives and works in Asaba, Delta state. He is single without children. He holds no regret going into this business. He hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase one washing machine to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more washing machine to boost his business

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong S., aged 47, is married and resides with her four children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of USD 0.5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband (pictured) is a middleman involved in selling cows. He travels in his province every day to purchase cows from the villagers and earns an income of USD 1 per day. The family's standard of living has improved since Vong S. has had this business. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more cows for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, the Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana es socia del Banco Comunal Familiar en una localidad situada a las afuera de la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

Nuestra socia desde hace algunos años enviudo y vive con su hijos, está dedicada al trabajo artesanal  en  tagua, todo empezó cuando ella trabaja en una fábrica y aprendió el oficio, tiene 3 años que se independizó para empezar invirtió casi 400 dólares ya que tuvo que comprar una maquina para cortar la tagua. Su trabajo consiste en hacer las fichas para botones para lo cual viaja a la ciudad de Manta  donde adquiere  la matería prima, ella elabora sus artesanías y  las entrega a una persona que se encargada  de enviar a otros países y allá le dan  el  acabado final,  no tiene horario fijo pero si tiene que ser las  8 horas diarias, como ella trabaja sola debe organizarse  para tomar los pedidos y  no quedar mal  con las entregas de su trabajo por lo cual debe dividir bien su tiempo entre el trabajo y los quehaceres del hogar,  todas las semanas adquiere suficiente materia prima para entregar a tiempo sus pedidos.

Mariana integra el  banco comunal hace dos ciclos, el  dinero que recibirá  lo invertirá en comprar  tagua, por el momento es pequeño su taller pero aspira poder comprar una maquina para contratar operadoras y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Familiar," located in the outskirts of the city of Montecristi in Manabí province. She has been a widow for a number of years, and she lives with her children. She makes handicrafts from tagua (a large nut with an interior that looks and feels like ivory and can be carved into handicrafts.) She started in this business when she worked in a factory and learned the trade. Three years ago she became independent and, with an investment of 400 dollars, she bought a machine to cut the tagua. Her work consists in cutting shapes for buttons. To do this she travels to the city of Manta, where she acquires the raw materials. She then makes her products and delivers them to a person who is in charge of sending them to other countries where they are given a final finish. She does not have a set schedule but she works 8 hours a day. As she works alone, she must organize herself to take the orders and avoid mistakes with the delivery of her work, because she must divide her time well between the work and her household tasks. Each week she must have sufficient raw materials on hand in order to fulfill her orders on time. Mariana joined the communal bank 2 loan cycles ago, and the money that she will receive from this loan will be invested in the purchase of tagua, because at this moment her workshop is small but she aspires to be able to buy a machine so that she can have employees and make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tagua to make buttons

loans.name: Srey Pao's Group

texts.en: In Spean Dek village in Kandal province, six people make up a group loan. Mrs. Srey Pao A. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store in the local village to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, in order to improve her business, Mrs. Srey Pao A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Rea Den Dieb, is a policeman and she has three children. One of her children is a government worker, one is an employee of a private company, and one attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is 47 years old. She is married with one child aged 20 years old. She is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale Town. She has been practising mixed farming for the last 30 years. Her main produce is vegetables which she sells at the local market. Lena also earns income from a hotel that she operates in the same area. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.20,000 to start a poultry project. Before venturing into poultry farming, Lena was specializing in maize and dairy farming. The excess income from this loan will enable her and her husband to live happily as their child is now independent. Her main challenge in this business is financial constraints. In future, she hopes to diversify her business by selling chicks at the local market.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos M. is from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 55 years-old and married with six adult children. Carlos owns and operates a  furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members. Carlos has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carlos joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlos has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Carlos is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Carlos from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem Y., 58, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Y. sells groceries for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the agriculture products from the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, tiene 33 años,  es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Angélica participa en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa y su primer crédito fue de 100 dólares que utilizo para incrementar su negocio. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de chanchos y cuyes en la feria de Inquilpata en la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Ella también se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y lleva sus productos a vender a los mercados de las ciudades de Calca y Cusco.  

Angélica requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 cuyes y una vaca y también comprará abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Angélica, age 33, is a responsible and hard-working woman who lives in the rural community of Rayanniyoc, in the Taray district, Caldca province, in the Cusco department. She has three children. Currently, Angelica is a member of the Asociacion Arariwa "Villa Rayanniyoc" community bank. Her first loan was 100 dollars which she used to expand her business. Her main activity is the sale of pigs and guinea pigs in the Inquilpata market, in the Anta province of the Cusco department. She also sells vegetables and brings her products for sale in the markets of the cities of Calca and Cusco. Angelica needs this loan to purchase 20 guinea pigs and a cow, and also to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase 20 guinea pigs and a cow, and also fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene B. is from the town of Talibon. He is 28 years old and is married with two children aged 6 and 4. Rene owns and operates a fishing business, operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years. Rene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be his fourth from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto B. is from the village of Igpit, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old. Jacinto is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Jacinto owns & operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Jacinto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacinto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Jacinto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jacinto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos que ya son profesionales, ahora vive sola, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada y ropa de cama, negocio que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo hace 15 años y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de cobertores y frazadas.
El único sueño de Julia es ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejez.
texts.en:
Julia is a single mother with six children who are now professionals, and lives alone. Julia has a small shop in the 12 de Abril market where she sells clothing, and bedding. She works there every day with products the gets in Lima. Julia has been a member of the Triunfo community bank for the past 15 years. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles to buy bedspreads and blankets. Julia's biggest dream is to save up enough for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads and blankets

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine J. is 38 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and raising livestock. She lives in Palanas, Ginatilan, Cebu. Catherine has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Catherine is now borrowing 16,000 PHP so that she can purchase raw materials for her food vending business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Catherine aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: she wants to buy a desk, chair and a machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and six siblings. In 2008, she opened a mini supermarket in her town. She helps her father, who works as a farmer, and her brothers in the household. Today, she wants to borrow $1000 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to increase her store’s inventory. She expects that her business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

In Lebanon, small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods are found frequently. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: increasing her store's inventory

loans.name: Thuk

texts.en: Thuk H., 69, is a widow with one daughter living in Kandal province. She is a farmer who works for less than one dollar a day, while her daughter sells used clothes in the local market. Thuk H. is asking for a loan of US$ 200 to reinvest in her daughter’s business.

loans.use: Selling used clothing

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul M. is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married. Together with her spouse, who is a driver she is bringing up three children; the two older are school pupils, and the youngest one is of pre-school age. Aigul is a nanny in an orphanage. Besides those jobs, the family is engaged in cattle breeding; 3 years ago they inherited a bull, and since then their herd has increased. The loan purpose is to purchase two cows for breeding. In future Aigul wants to make house repairs.

Aigul’s partners:

Baktygul S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 34, married. her husband works as a driver. The couple is bringing up a daughter. The whole family is engaged in livestock breeding. In order to increase their herd, Baktygul intends to purchase four sheep, but for this purpose the family needs to get a loan. 

Maria J., 56, is a widow. She has three children. Maria is a charwoman in a clinic, and moreover she is engaged in farming. Her loan purpose is to purchase strawberries to plant. 

Zeinep S., 22, married. Together with her husband, she is raising a daughter. Zeinep is an employee of the military registration and enlistment office. She needs to get a loan in order to purchase a plot of land in the capital. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Ihembe Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en: T. Norah, with hand raised, is the leader of Ihembe Tukwatanise loan group. She is 68 years old and a widow with four children. Norah has been involved in the buying and selling of food crops in Ihembe for 28 years and makes KES90,000 profit per week. Her repeat customers are good people.  She started her business using money from her own harvests but now needs a loan to increase her working capital. She is very hard working and dreams about improving her home. In the absence of her late husband, she is grateful for the loans that have made it easier for her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Increase her capital and buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Rabia Muhammad Saeed's Group

texts.en:
Rabia lives in Multan, a historic city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. The city is known for its history and culture. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in an area called Dewan bagh. She moved there six months ago.
Rabia is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her husband and family in times of crisis. In order to support her family financially, she operates a business selling bangles and embroidered clothes. She has a good number of customers who trust her due to the quality of her goods and her cheap prices. She buys bangles from jewelry shops and embroidered clothes from the wholesale market in Multan.
Rabia's husband works in a private firm and earns a meager income. Rabia lives in a combined family unit with her two brother-in-laws. One of them is a rickshaw driver and the other operates a grocery shop. She has no children yet.
She has applied for a loan for her business from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan, she will buy bangles and embroidered clothes in bulk in order to increase her sales by fulfilling her customers' orders. Rabia is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy bangles and embroidered clothes for resale

loans.name: Carmen Elodia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 55 años de edad, mantuvo una relación de la cual tuvo 8 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes,  en su casa viven cuatro de sus nietos que ella los crio desde que nacieron y tienen 12, 11, 10 y 8 años todos están en escuela.
 
Se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas sale de su casa y se acerca a las embarcaciones que llegan de alta mar, luego de bajar el pescado ella les compra el pescado por gavetas a los pescadores para después llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 15h00,  también realiza trabajos de limpieza del pescado por lo que le pagan un sueldo. 

Este crédito es para ir a comprar pescado y llevarlo a vender. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo, there is a place known as Los Arenales where every fifteen days the members of the community bank Nueva Generación [New Generation] meet.  This area is known for their beautiful beaches, cuisine, and the quality of the people.

Carmen is 55 years old and maintains a relationship which gave her eight children, who are grown up and independent.  Four of her grandchildren live with her, and she raised them since they were born.  They are 8, 10, 11, and 12 years old and they are all in school.

She works buying and selling fish.  Every morning she leaves home and goes to the boats that come in from the sea.  After they unload their cargo, she buys fish from the fishermen and brings them to sell all over town.  She works every day from 5:00am until 3:00pm.  She also cleans fish, which pays her a salary.

This loan will be used to purchase fish and bring it to be sold.  She has been a member of the community bank for eight years, and she likes the benefits that she receives as part of the Espoir Foundation.  

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magdalena; ella tiene 62 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta chuño, moraya y maíz entre otros para luego venderlo a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de Cusco, y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco" Community Bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Magdalena; she is 62, married and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business where she buys and sells potato flour, moraya [a freeze-dried potato product], corn, and other items. She sells to her customers in the different markets of Cusco. This is how she gets her family ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products for her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: frozen products and pig fattening businesses. Her husband Marcellus T., who is 46 years old, works as a employee (fishing vessels) to earn his living. They have three children who are 14 to 23 years old. Joyce joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joyce has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to pay for more purchase more stock to sell so that she could continue to save up for future for family needs. Joyce is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
El  Señor Jhony, P. tiene 42 años vive por la zona de Sumumpaya, al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba en una zona periférica de la ciudad, se encuentra casado, tiene 3 hijas, y se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, para la elaboración de quesos, estos productos los comercializa su esposa en las ferias populares, además el Sr. Jhony y su esposa se dedican a la refaccion de sombreros para las señoras nativas del lugar.
EL señor y su esposa son muy dedicados a su familia estuvieron siempre buscando mejores ingresos, y viajaron a la Argentina en busca de oportunidades, pero la suerte no les acompaño y extrañaban mucho a sus pequeñas hijas por lo que regresaron.

Los esposos trabajan de forma coordinada, mientras uno corta pasto el otro lleva a las vacas para ordeñar, y cuando preparan el producto (quesos) para vender uno se queda a cuidar el pastoreo de las vacas y mientras vende los quesos también vende los sobreros.

Siempre están pensando en superarse y generar mas ingresos para que sus hijas tengan una mejor condición de vida, ahora desean provechar y comprar alimento para su ganado antes que empiece a escasear y suba de precio, por ese motivo se apersonaron a solicitar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhony P. is 42 years old and he lives in the region of Sumupaya, to the west of the city of Cochabamba. It is a suburban region to the city.  He is married and he is the father of 3 daughters. He is produces raw milk and it is used in the production of cheeses. His wife sells these products at the large fairs. Jhony and his wife also make hats that are traditionally worn by women in the region. 

He and his wife are very dedicated to their family. They have always been in search of better earnings and they traveled to Argentina for better opportunities. But luck was not on their side and they missed their young daughters too much so they returned back home. 

This married couple travels in an organized way. While one cut down some say, the other milks the cows. And when they prepare cheeses for sale, one always stays behind to shepherd the cows.  And while one is out selling cheeses the other is out selling sombreros. 

They are always looking for a way to improve them and to generate more income to provide their daughters with a better quality of life.  They want to purchase feed for their cattle before it starts selling out and before the prices start to rise. To this end they have requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two grown daughters. He runs a farming business in the small town of Vodyanoye. Oleg owns 8 greenhouses. He grows different vegetables, e.g. tomatoes, radish, cucumbers, for sale in the Kamenka region as well as in other regions of the Ukraine. Oleg has been working in this sphere for 17 years. He has about 180,000 Grivnyas invested in this business.  

Oleg is requesting a loan of 18,000 Grivnyas to install heating systems in his greenhouses. He is hoping to purchase natural gas boilers for each of his 8 greenhouses. One of Oleg’s long-term plans is to reconstruct his greenhouses in the future to make them taller to add extra space for bigger harvests.

loans.use: To install heating units in greenhouses

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a young woman from Hebron. She graduated one year ago and started working. Nida wants to help her father pay back one of their family members who lent them money when her father needed to buy a home appliance.

Nida, who appears in the picture above, took out a loan from FATEN for this reason.

loans.use: To pay back family housing expenses

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte. Es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. El cliente es muy reconocido por el trabajo que realiza, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado obtener su medio de vida. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, repuestos nuevos, tapizar asientos entre otras cosas para su bus.  Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar. Desea obtener otro medio de ingreso como es su bus.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista provides transportation services. He is a responsible person who enjoys his business, so this is not the first time he has applied for loans. Juan is well-known for the work he does, but he has not accumulated sufficient capital over time to secure his way of life.

This loan will be used to buy tires, new parts, upholstered seats, and other items for his bus so that he can generate household income. Juan wants to obtain another source of income similar to his bus.

loans.use: To purchase tires, new parts, upholstered seats, and other items for his bus.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea P. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Mala Chuong, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have four  children – one son and three daughters. 
Mr. Chea P. is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. In addition, they rent out part of their house to garment factory workers because their house is located near the factory. Chea has received a Kiva loan once before, and is now requesting another loan of $500 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas K. is a 43-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with four kids. Three of the children are attending the public high school and the other child is married. Meas K.'s husband, Prak Thorn, is 40 and works in the farming business. Meas K. inherited farmland from her grandmother. She and her husband grow different kinds of crops on this land. Besides a rice-planting business, they also grow mold on the straw behind their house for additional income. Previously they used a plowing machine to support them in the farming business. Unfortunately, the machine broke down often during the plowing process. Because of this problem, Meas K. would like a loan to purchase a new plowing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine in order to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad Reina V. se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, un espacio de su casa dedicado a la confección, oficio que aprendió desde pequeña al lado de su madre y que se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento para ella y su familia. 

Incrementar su capacidad productiva, generar empleo y convertirse en empresaria es el sueño de Reina V. quien trabaja de sol a sol como ella misma lo dice para cumplir con sus metas trazadas. 

Actualmente Reina necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana que le permita agilizar su trabajo y poder caminar en busca de ese sueño.
texts.en:
At the age of 58, Reina V. is proud to have her own business: a space in her home dedicated to Dressmaking, an occupation she learned while still a little girl alongside her mother that has become a source of support for herself and her family.

Reina V.’s dream is to increase her productive capacity, generate employment and become a businesswoman.  She works from sunrise to sunrise, as she herself states, to reach her set goals.

Reina needs a loan to buy a sewing machine that will make it possible for her to streamline her work and continue forward in search of her dream

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy, 55 years old, is married to a farmer. With four children, Remy decided to engage in a hog-raising business to earn income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase feed for her hogs. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly in her businesses. She uses her profits to pay for the tuition fees of their children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Mayira Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Mayira” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Alfred is the leader of this group. He is 38 years old and married with two children who are attending primary school. Alfred sells soft drinks, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. and has been doing this business for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Alfred will invest in his business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.name: Minagueze Group

texts.fr: MINAGUEZE est un groupement constitué de douze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Bibiane. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1971 au Bénin, Bibiane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants dans une ville du Bénin. Bibiane est mariée à un certain Sébastien et a des enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Bibiane assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis environs quinze ans, Bibiane vend du charbon de bois et de façon secondaire, des boissons à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Bibiane achète ses produits dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Bibiane et aux autres membres du groupement MINAGUEZE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
MINAGUEZE is a group of 12 people, whose president (with her hand raised in the photo) is called Bibiane. The group members live in the same quarter of the Benin. In order to boost their working capital the group are seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Bibiane was born in 1971 in Benin, and lives with her husband and children in a town in Benin. She and her husband work together to see to the family's needs. For around 15 years, Bibiane has sold charcoal - and beverages as a side-line - from her home. This business generates money that helps her to contribute to the family's costs. Bibiane buys her goods from one of Benin's markets. 
This first loan will certainly allow Bibiane and other members of the MINAGUEZE group to boost their business and grow their customer base and revenues.

loans.use: to purchase coal and beverages

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is a 30-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. Since 1998, she has been planting rice crops, which are her annual business. Her husband works in construction. The family generates an income of about $7 each day. Mrs. Sen is looking for a loan to help her husband's business by purchasing some essential construction materials. The couple has two single children who still live under their income.

loans.use: to purchase some essential construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Paola Mayela

texts.es: Paola Mayela tiene 31 años de edad. No es la primera vez que obtiene este tipo de experiencia de financiamientos, pues para ellas han sido lo más indispensables en su vida para mejorar su negocio. Tiene2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica es la brindar el servicio de taxi, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, para ella no fue fácil realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía suficiente experiencia pero con el tiempo ha mejorado. Solicita un financiamiento destinado para la compra de llantas, repuesto, focos y vidrios.
texts.en:
Paola Mayela is 31 years old. This isn’t her first experience with loans because they have been indispensable in helping her improve her business. She has two children.

Paola has run a taxi service for the past six years. It hasn’t been an easy job as she didn’t have enough experience at first, but as time passed, things have improved. 

She is seeking a loan to buy tires, spare parts, light bulbs, and windows.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts, light bulbs, and windows

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 43-year-old married woman with six school-aged children. 

She has a sari sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items like coffee, shampoo and diapers. 

Leonila works hard to help provide for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo. 

Leonila hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, detergent, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Just only ages 29 years old, Mrs.Hong have until four children in burden. So it is a big response of her and her husband for supporting the family lives in comfortable as other family in village.everyday, Mrs.Hong works as a catching fish around pound, lake and river also. On her husband part, he is a buyer all of cements in stock in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Both of them could be gain about $7 per day. According to co-operate with each other, it make this family would like to borrow from Kiva loan in amount of $1,200 in the aim to Purchase cements in stock.

loans.use: To purchase cements in stock.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es muy emprendedora, tiene 50 años y en la actualidad vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Ante la necesidad  de afrontar las múltiples necesidades de su hogar, decidió  emprender su negocio en la rama que mas le agrada y también para apoyar a su esposo porque ha tenido que trabajar  a una zona muy lejana de la ciudad donde radica actualmente. Desde hace 20 años estuvo capacitando incluso en programas sociales enseñando  tejer a diversas mujeres, el buen prestigio que posee en el área de los tejidos a mano le ha servido para  tener desde hace un año su tienda de venta de lanas  en las cuales vende las lanas por madejas. María también  enseña a sus clientes  y esta es su estrategia para captar su clientela y mantenerse con ella. por lo general atiende por las mañanas, disfruta de su trabajo porque realizar los tejidos es un pasatiempo  además que realizar este negocio le resulta rentable en sus ingresos  es por es lo que  quiere hacer crecer su negocio.
Es la novena oportunidad que esta solicitando un crédito de manera grupal con MFP, sus cualidades de liderazgo en su grupo  infunden ánimos a las demás integrantes para seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con las cuotas de crédito que afrontan en  cada mes. Con este crédito seguirá comprando mas mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria, age 50, is a very enterprising woman.  She now lives with her three children in her own house.  Facing the need to handle the many household necessities, she decided to undertake a business in the area that pleases her the most.  She also wanted to support her husband because he has had to work in a zone that is very far away from the city where they live.

She has been training for 20 years.  This includes social programs teaching various women to knit.  The good reputation that she has in the field of handmade knitting has served her in getting her store selling wool.  She has had the store for one year, and she sells by the skein.  María also teaches her customers, and that is her strategy for getting her customers and having them stay with her.

She generally sees to her business in the morning.  She enjoys her work because knitting is a pastime.  Also, being in this business is profitable in its earnings.  That is why she wants to grow her business.

This is the ninth loan she has requested in a communal way with MFP.  Her leadership qualities encourage the other members of her group to continue making their monthly loan payments punctually.  She will use this loan to continue buying more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to continue buying more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 40 years old and is married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Clarita has operated a shop where she sells bananas and coconuts. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Clarita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Taboram Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Taboram” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 
The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu. She was born in Magburaka town about 29 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and one of her children attends primary school while the other is not of school-going age yet. Salamatu sells firewood. She is also a hairdresser. She has requested this loan in order to buy piles of firewood for resale. She will also use part of the loan to buy hair extensions for resale.

loans.use: to buy piles of firewood for resale, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and is married with five children. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 15 years. Alicia is able to provide for her family through her work.

Alicia is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to improve her farm and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Gloria has a shop that sells coconuts and green bananas. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.
Gloria has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy four televisions and other electrical goods

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children with six of them currently in school. For the past six years, Jesca has been working hard to manage her grocery store where she sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Jesca is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more food items for resale. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Jesca hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale shop.

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jesca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Flor de María tiene 46 años de edad y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Paruro y desde hace 26 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación. 

Flor de María tiene un local donde atiende compromisos sociales como por ejemplo bautizos, matrimonios, cumpleaños y aniversarios. Flor de María también se dedica a la elaboración de refrescos y helados en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Flor de María requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, sacos de arroz, vinos, gaseosas, agua mineral y otras cosas más. 
 
Flor de María agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Flor de María belongs to the communal bank "Del Futuro del Manu" which holds its meetings every month in the city of Salvación in the Manu Province in the department of Madre de Dios.

Flor de María, 46, is married and has four children.  She was born in the city of Paruro and has lived in Salvación for 26 years.

She has a business for social engagements such as baptisms, weddings, birthday celebrations and anniversaries.  She also makes homemade softdrinks and ice-cream.  She has been in business for several years and it is going well for her thanks to her hard work.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods such as meat, vegetables, sacks of rice, wine, sodas, mineral water and other items.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy goods such as meat, vegetables, sacks of rice, wine, sodas, mineral water and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El señor Abel tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y vive con sus tres hijos y su esposa, Abel se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta de helados en su motocicleta, visita barrios, colonias y lugares aledaños a su comunidad,  sus ventas son de lunes a sábado, Abel es una persona muy positiva y dinámica, le gusta asistir a la iglesia todos los domingos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ice cream, paletas y conos,  el calor es mas intenso en esa zona y muchas personas comprar este tipo de porducto.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Abel is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.  He has been selling iced treats from his motorcycle for 8 years.  He visits neighborhoods, residential developments and places near his community.  He makes his sales from Monday to Saturday.  Abel is a very positive and dynamic person.  He enjoys attending church every Sunday.

Abel will use his loan to buy ice cream, iced lollies and cones.  The heat is more intense in this region and many people buy this type of product.

Abel's dream is to own his own home.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, iced lollies and cones

loans.name: Esperanza Natalia

texts.es:
Esperanza de 49 años, empezó a trabajar como costurera desde muy joven y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien en su negocio.

Trabaja todos los días sin horarios fijos. Su dificultad es la delincuencia del sector. No está casada pero con la ayuda de Dios pudo salir adelante con su hijo que ahora es profesional. Quiere el prestamo para comprar telas, hilos para su negocio. 

Su propósito es poder establecer otro negocio porque el que realiza es muy cansado.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 49 years old.  She started working as a seamstress when she was very young and, thanks to God, she has done very well in her business.

Esperanza works every day but doesn't work fixed hours.  The difficulty she faces is crime in her area.  She is not married but, with the help of God, she was able to get ahead in life together with her son who is now a professional.  She would like this loan to buy fabric and threads for her business.

Esperanza's goal is to set up another business because the one she has now is very tiring.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер – парень 27 лет, женат, живёт вместе с родителями в двухкомнатной квартире. Работает мастером-отделочником по ремонту квартир. Он сам содержит своих родителей, т.к. они у него пенсионеры. На данный кредит Алишер хочет купить цветной плазменный телевизор. Он хочет сделать родителям сюрприз на Новый год. Узнав от друзей, что возможно взяв потребительский кредит и купить телевизор, он решительно захотел купить его.
texts.en: Alisher is 27 year-old young man, who lives with his parents in a two-bedroom apartment.  He works as an interior decorator, specializing in apartment repairs.  He supports his parents himself because they are retirees.  Alisher wants to use this loan to purchase a color plasma television.  He wants to surprise his parents for the New Year's.  Having learned from friends that it was possible to obtain a consumer loan and purchase a television, he was determined to purchase it.

loans.use: to purchase a color plasma television

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Judith works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling starfish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from trisikad (pedicab) transportation. Judith is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more starfish to sell to customers.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more starfish to sell

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
This is Emmie, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Wilfredo, a carpenter, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emmie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells barbeque for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emmie hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Editha has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses, and sweaters. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 31-year-old, married father of three children who lives in Taiz,Yemen. He only completed secondary school then became interested in a hydraulic spare parts shop which has been running for  six years. It is the only main source of income of the family.  He has worked very hard to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve.

He started his business by working as a car mechanic in small workshop but that was not enough to cover his family expenses so he was forced to sell  his house in the village in order to start up this business and improve his living conditions. He has attracted more customers because his business is located in a strategic area and because of the strength of mind which he has enjoyed.

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen,  he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to supply his business with more products and keep his customers coming back.

In the future, he would like expand his business such as by purchasing another shop and making it a car spare parts shop as well as purchasing a truck..

loans.use: to supply his customers' demand and keep them coming back to his business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is involved in the recycling of used clothing into new local fabric designs known as Tye and Dye. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She has trained many apprentices who have acquired skills in batik, tye and dye making. She has been an example for many out-of-school children who have learned this trade and are employing the skills learned to make incomes and also professionals come to learn from her as alternative income generating activity. 
Joyce has been trained by the staff of Kraban Support Foundation in basic records keeping and accounting skills. She has designed her business plan. She needs $925 from KIVA funds to expand her business activities.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Materials

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a single mother raising her 15 year old son on her own. She has extensive experience in retail which led her to start her own business selling children’s clothing. She manages two retail locations, one in the central market and another outside the city. Most of the income Maria has earned has been put back into business development. After three years in operation, the business currently yields around $400 a month with an investment of $1,000 in inventory. The approaching spring season means increased buyer activity. After a long winter, many Ukrainians are ready to get out and shop. Irina recognizes a good opportunity to broaden the selection of goods she offers and increase her sales volume. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a variety of spring children’s clothing that will increase her available inventory. Irina is known as an open and lively woman who cares about her customer’s needs. As she provides for the needs of others, she will be able to generate the necessary funds to adequately provide for herself and her son.

Ірина – самотня мати. Вона самостійно виховує п’ятнадцятирічного сина підлітка. В неї дуже багатий досвід роботи в торгівлі, що й спонукало її зайнятися власним бізнесом. Ірина – власниця двох торгових точок роздрібної торгівлі, одна з них знаходиться на центральному ринку, друга – за межами міста.
