Марія інвестувала більшу частину отриманого прибутку в подальший розвиток її бізнесу. Після трьох років роботи її бізнес зараз приносить 400 доларів щомісяця, в товар у Марії вкладено 1000 доларів. Наближається весняний сезон, а, отже, кількість покупців зросте. Після довгої зими багато українців радо оновлюють свій гардероб. Ірина розуміє, що фінансова підтримка надасть їй можливість розширити асортимент товарів та збільшити обсяги продажів. Вона просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб закупити різноманітний дитячий одяг напередодні весняного сезону та збільшити кількість товарних одиниць. Ірина – дуже щира та жвава жінка, вона вміло знаходить індивідуальний підхід до кожного з покупців. Позика не тільки допоможе Ірині задовольнити зростаючий попит, але й надасть їй можливість отримати необхідні кошти для того, щоб забезпечити потреби власної родини.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
For seven years, Nataliya has operated a little business at the market in Nikopol, Ukraine. She sells women’s undergarments, pajamas, and socks in one section and synthetic flowers in another section. Nataliya originally trained as a musician. She graduated in 1955 from music school as an orchestra conductor. Like many trained Ukrainian professionals, however, Nataliya doesn’t work in her field of training but has made a niche for herself as an entrepreneur.

Nataliya has benefited from the support of Nadiya Ukraine as she has built her business. She has been able to dramatically increase her amount of inventory on hand from around $100 worth a year ago to now around $3000 worth. This allows her to offer a much more attractive product selection to passing customers and she is better able to meet customer demand.

Nataliya has requested a loan for $1000 to use to purchase additional inventory so that she can continue to improve the assortment of goods she has available to sell.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Aloys Odwori

texts.en:
Aloys is forty four years old and a father of three children; two boys and a girl. The boys are in class seven and five respectively and the girl still at home by the virtue of her age. His wife helps him at store. Aloys is a primary school dropout; he hasn’t taken any formal training but learnt the business through apprenticeship.
Aloys operates a general store on a rented premise in Chwele town in Bungoma district. His stock of about Kshs 25,000/- consists of goods ranging from house hold to farm products. He started it early last year and has been going home with a profit of Kshs 300/- to Kshs 400/- at the end of the day. He usually gets his stock twice a week from bungoma. In terms of clientel, Aloys mostly serves residents of Chwele centre and its environs and majorly travelers because Chwele is located on one of the main roads to Kitale.
With a young business, he says that he is only able to sustain his family, provide them with basic needs and plough back the rest of the profits.
With his first loan from PEMCI, Aloy intends to stock up the shop, he says that the shop still lacks many goods that attract customers and that’s where to invest in.

loans.use: To stock-up His store

loans.name: Moli

texts.en: Moli is a grandmother of 52 years of age. Her family has lived on the plantation all of their lives. They use the same land which their father used to cultivate with many crops. Moli's husband decided to concentrate on a taro plantation, as compared to other crops it takes less time to grow. Moli's first loan she used to buy cramoxone chemical, a wheelbarrow and other things needed for the plantation. Her plan is to grow the plantation and hopefully to export to neighboring countries.

loans.use: To assist with the family's plantation

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: Zahid is a 46 year old Internally Displaced Person from the Khojavand region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He and his family were relocated to the Binagadi settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  He is married and has three children.  He works as a taxi driver with his own car.  He works inside the town and sometimes goes long distances to other regions.  He now wants to buy new tires for his car.  As he has little of his own funds to do this, he has applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $500 to buy new tires and to do some repairs as well.

loans.use: To buy tires and to repair the car for his taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add to her product line and have more sales during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Thi Chat

texts.vi:
Ms Chắt is 60 years old. She is a retiree from the army (special task force). She has had sequela from the war: loss of memory, loss of hair, loss of teeth, yellow skin. But today she is reestablished. She is applying for a loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) to buy seeds, fertilizer ...etc to increase her vegetables production thus her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Chắt, 60 tuổi, là chiến sĩ lực lượng vũ trang Nhân dân Việt nam đã nghỉ hưu. Mặc dù bị di chứng do chiến tranh để lại: bị mất trí nhớ, vàng da, rụng tóc, nay sức khoẻ của cô đã bình phục trở lại. Với số vốn vay từ chương trình tài chính vi mô của Binh Minh cdc, cô đầu tư mua hạt giống, phân bón... nhằm tăng sản lượng cũng như chất lượng rau đem bán.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.en: Bahromjon D. is 21 years old and he lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mr D. is a very serious and single-minded young man who is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work. He is an orphan but it does not influence his desire to have a good  family. Mr.D. is ready to work hard to earn money for a future marriage . He is a collective farmer and besides he trades in raw yarn and the warm socks in the bazaar. He works with a direct supplier that is why he trades in prices that are lower than the bazaar prices. He has direct suppliers from the China. Now Mr D. requests a loan of $650 to purchase a lot of new warm socks.

loans.use: the new warm socks lot purchasing

loans.name: Munakukama D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca M.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Jesca is 40 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 2 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a goat for rearing. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 20000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Jackline N., Naume I., Sarah N., and Juliet A.. Jackline N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to increase stock. Naume I. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Sarah N. operates a retail shop business and wants to stock more shop items. Juliet A. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To add to fish business and boost it

loans.name: Sylivia Nakawooya's Group

texts.en:
N. Sylivia, age 22, is the leader of this group.  Sylivia is married with 1 child that is 2 years old.  Sylivia works in Owino Market, where she sells fruit such as passion fruit and oranges. 

Sylivia’s main challenges while carrying out her business include seasonal changes in fruit supply, seasonal needs for more capital and times when farm yields are poor.  

The loan will enable Sylivia to increase her food stock and retain some of her profits.  In the future, she hopes to make enough money to renovate her house, purchase a plot of land, and improve the family's diet.

loans.use: The loan will enable Sylivia to increase her food stock and save some money.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 49 year old man. He has one child. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs.

Jamal owns an artisan store. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy seashells to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy seashells

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir was born in 1970. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Finnish houses, which were built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. Shakir is married and has 3 children.  He started dairy business 5 years ago. Now he requests a loan of  $750 to buy another cow.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Victoria Namakula's Group

texts.en:
Victoria N. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 39 years old and married with five children. Her children are 21, 18, 15, 12 and 9 years old. The three youngest children are in school while the two oldest work. Victoria lives in an urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Victoria has been operating her kiosk and selling motorcycle oil for the past six years. She buys products for the kiosk from a nearby market, but must travel into Kampala via shared taxi to purchase motorcycle oil. Victoria sells samosas, sweets, and breads out of her kiosk, mainly to school children . She sells the motor oil from her home early in the morning and late in the evening.

With this loan Victoria plans on buying raw materials for cooking and additional motor oil. Victoria started the center in Mulago and has been working with MCDT for many years. She decided to start the center because she wanted to be able to pay for her children’s school fees.

Victoria has successfully repaid 12 loans and since she began working with MCDT, she has been able to grow her business, provide for her family, and pay school fees.

Victoria hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house one day .

loans.use: Increase motor oil and food stocks

loans.name: Thi Phuong's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. thi Phuong is 37 years of age, MS 11040017, she is quick-minded and a well-rounded person. After losing her husband, she became a single mother to 3 young children. Every day she looks after her livestock and buys produce to market. Her daily income is 150.000vnd. She was able to repay her last loan successfully. This time she is requesting a loan of 1.534000vnd to increase her produce inventory. Her group consists of the following members:

  • Ms. N. thi Tuong, MS 11040020, is seeking a loan of 2.006000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock - pigs.
  • Ms. N. thi Anh, MS 11040029, is seeking a loan of 3.186000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock – pigs.
  • Ms. N. thi Phuc, MS 11040009, is seeking a loan of 2.912000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock – fishes.
  • Ms. N. thi Lien, MS 11040030, is seeking a loan of 2.006000vnd to buy seeds for farming
  • Ms. N. thi Chuc, MS 11040031, is seeking a loan of 3.186000vnd to increase her investment in livestock and woodshop/construction businesses.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    chị Nghiêm thi Phương năm nay 37 tuổi ,MS 11040017 chị là một phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, đảm đang. Chồng mất,một mình chị nuôi 3 con nhỏ,hằng ngày chị chăn nuôi lợn, và đi chợ hoa quả mức thu nhập mỗi ngày được 150.000 VND / ngày. chu kỳ trước chị hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 1.534000 VND để bổ sung vốn đi chợ hoa quả. Nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Tường MS 11040020 vay mức 2.006000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ánh MS 11040029 vay mức 3.186000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Phúc MS 11040009 vay mức 2.912000 VND để mua cám nuôi cá
  • chị Nguyễn thị Liên MS 11040030 vay mức 2.006000 VND để mua thóc bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chúc MS 11040031 vay mức 3.186000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn, làm nghề mộc

loans.use: Vay vốn để đi chợ và chăn nuôi

loans.name: Saada's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Saada is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 13 and 7. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since 2003. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Saada now requests a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Suzana and Salama, who have businesses selling used clothes, snacks, and juice.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Se inicia en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, a razón de su hijo, por darle todo lo necesario. Luz es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, gracias a su buena atención y sobre todo administración, está saliendo adelante, junto a su esposo Jorge, quien es mecánico, tienen la ilusión de crecer y progresar juntos, es por eso que Luz decidió implementar y ampliar su negocio, sin embargo, necesita de un capital para lograr su objetivo. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Luz started her business selling groceries and basic goods in order to help her son and provide for his necessities. Luz is a very hard-working woman; thanks to her care and management of her business, she is progressing together with her husband Jorge, a mechanic. They have the dream of growing and succeeding together which is why Luz decided to expand her business. However, she needs greater capital in order to achieve her goal. With your help, this mother will be able to reach her goals in the short-term.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of grocery store

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu F., 49, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the retail business. She opens her shop to the village people and public 7 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Leutu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Leutu mentioned that she will only use her loans from SPBD on her business but not anything else. With the loan from SPBD, she will buy goods for the shop like canned food, snack food, and a new refrigerator to replace the old one which is getting rusty. Her oldest daughter is helping her in running the shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop like canned foods, snack foods and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank.  He is 40 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Julian is an artist; he makes beautiful altarpieces and wooden boxes with scenes of local customs (like Carnaval, Holy Week, and “herranza,” a traditional Peruvian animal-marking ceremony). Julian and his brothers make their crafts at home, then sell their wares in the cities of Lima and Cuzco.  Julian needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy plaster, flour, and paint.  Julian dreams of having his own handicraft company, of exporting his work, and of working in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
 
Julián es socio del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. 
Julián es soltero y tiene 40 años, vive con su padres, Julián es artesano, realiza bellos retablos, Cajones D. madera en donD. plasma las costumbres D. L. región, como herranza, carnavales, L. semana santa, actividad que realiza en su casa con L. ayuda D. sus hermanos, sus ventas lo realiza en L. ciudad D. Lima y Cuzco. Julian necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. yeso, harina y pinturas. 
Julian sueña con tener una empresa D. artesanía, productos D. exportación y dedicarse también a L. agricultura.

loans.use: Buy plaster, flour and paint for his handicraft business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a hair dryer and other materials for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Ekhsan

texts.en:
Ekhsan M. is 31 years of age and lives with his wife and two sons. He is a livestock breeder who has calves that he cares for and grazes every morning. He has been doing this for the past ten years and considers it very profitable. He takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for nourishment. After caring for them for several months, he then takes them to be sold. This phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must adjust to the schedules and prices that are offered to him.

Ekhsan’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Today, he wishes to invest in expanding his herd of cattle, so as to be more profitable in the markets. As this is the only financial source in his family, Ekhsan counts on your help!

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
K. Thérèse a 55 ans et elle s’est mariée avec ASSIGNANME Archile. Ils ont trois enfants qui s’appellent Aurelien, Jeanne, et Léa. Ca fait 30 ans qu’elle a commencé de vendre les pagnes, une vêtement traditionnelle béninoise, et les bijoux. Actuellement, Thérèse vend aussi les cartes de recharges et les chaussures. Le revenu de crédit lui a permis d’acheter une moto. Elle a loué la moto quotidiennement à un chauffeur qui travaille comme un taxi moto et qui lui rembourse. Dans le futur, elle voudrait commencer par vendre les pagnes et les bijoux en gros.
texts.en:
Thérèse K. is 55 years old and married to Archile ASSIGNANME. They have three children named Aurelien, Jeanne, and Léa. It’s been thirty years since she started selling pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing) and jewelry. Currently she also sells mobile phone cards and shoes. Loan income has enabled her to buy a motorbike, which she rented out each day to a taxi-moto driver, who then reimburses her. In the future, she would like to start selling pagnes and jewelry wholesale.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya tiene 20 años, vive junto a su pareja, no tienen hijos, la casa donde viven es de su madre. Se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos de todas las marcas y modelos, así como también lo complementa ofreciendo zapatos y otras variedades de accesorios del vestir, productos que deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace un año atrás y lo que le gusta es estar en contacto directo con las personas, además que le es rentable porque lleva a vender de casa en casa, y le va muy bien. Posteriormente quiere construir un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa para poner su tienda de ropa, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona, debido a al transito de gran cantidad de personas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará ropa y zapatos para colegiales, ya que estamos en la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 20 years old and lives with her husband. They do not have children yet and they live in her mother's house. She sells clothing of all brands for adults and children. She also sells shoes and other accesories, products that are sold to her customers either by credit or cash installments. She started this job a year ago and she likes being in direct contact with people. Also, it has been profitable because she sells the clothing by going door to door. In the future, she would like to build her own shop outside of her home to display her products. She would like it to be in a good location so that a large quantity of people would go past it. This loan is her first with MFP and she will use the money to purchase children's clothing and shoes because they are in the school season.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reason that it requires exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Nabi U.  has dedicated himself for 20 years to cattle raising which supports his humble family who rely on him. Currently Nabi has turned to IMON International for a loan of $1350 USD to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun N., 55, and his wife, Mrs. Sava Pun, 52, were married in 1976 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other four children are in school. The family lives along national road about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Saroeun and his wife have been farming for twenty-seven years. They grow rice and cauliflower. The couple don't have enough capital to use for their farm and that is  why Saroeun is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to use for growing rice and cauliflower.

loans.use: To use for growing rice and cauliflower.

loans.name: Yataka Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sakina has sold snacks in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works at her business for eight hours every day and currently earns an average monthly profit of $80.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar to add to her current stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase profits and grow her business so that she can save money for future use.

Sakina is 30 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 2 and 6. She will share this loan with her fellow group members (also pictured): Hasina, Khadija, Rehema and Mayasa. Each of these women has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and cooking oil to add her current stock.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Luyện Lê Thị, 45 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult-aged children. Luyện owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising ducks for sale. Luyện is new to this business and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2006, Luyện joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Luyện has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Luyện is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Luyện plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Jairo Hilario

texts.es: Jairo Hilario C. M. tiene 45 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene 5 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este negocio por su familia, desde muy pequeño por que le  gustaba este tipo de negocio y además relacionarse con sus vecinos, ya que es un hombre muy amistoso y alegre. Todos los financiamientos que ha solicitado son destinados para capital para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan. Jairo tiene los sueños de seguir trabajando ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo Hilario C. M. is 45 years old. He is a single man, and he has five children who go to school. He has had a mini market for over eight years. He started the business for his family. Since he was very little he has liked this type of business. He also likes socializing with his neighbors; he is a friendly and happy man. All of the loans that he has asked for are for working capital to buy sweets, soft drinks, natural soft drinks, and bread. Jairo’s dream is to keep working since he is the only source of income that the family has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oyewole

texts.en: H. is 35 years old, married and has three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for five years. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a dedicated LAPO client and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
la señora Cornelia R. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la colonia Fraternidad, tiene 8 años de vivir en ese lugar, es madre soltera, no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos estan casados y viven en diferentes lugares de San Lorenzo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas. 
De esta manera a podido salir adelante, pudo construir su casa y a podido hacer muchas mejoras a su hogar, es una mujer muy emprendedora y honesta.

ella esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar maiz, leña, cal, y ademas desea mejorar las condiciones de la cocina donde elabora las tortillas, su negocio es muy rentable debido a que en la zona no hay otro negocio de tortilla cerca tiene muchos clientes.
 
su sueño es poner una pequeña fabrica de tortillas en la zona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cornelia R. is 56 years old and lives in the district of Fraternidad, where she has lived for 8 years. She is a single mother, but she doesn’t have any dependents because all of her children are married and live in different places in San Lorenzo. She makes and sells tortillas. In this way, she can go forward, build her house, and make many improvements on her home. She is an enterprising and honest woman. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime. She also wants to improve the conditions of the kitchen where she makes the tortillas. Her business is very profitable because in her area no other tortilla businesses nearby have many clients. Her dream is to have a small tortilla factory in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, water, and lime

loans.name: Allah Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Allah M. is the leader of the Allah M. loan group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants a loan to expand their business and make it larger, so they are requesting a group loan of 30000 Afghani.

Allah M. wants a loan for his burger and ice cream shop. Hanesa wants a loan for her tailoring business. Torpayki wants a loan for her husband who has an ice cream shop. They are happy that this loan process can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Clober

texts.es:
Clober B. G. es un señor de 41 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Desde muy joven don Clober se ha dedicado a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado piña anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Clober es un micro crédito de ¢585,000 (quinientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Clober es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Clober B. G. is 41 and lives with his wife and three daughters in a community called Saíno de Pital, which is located in the provice of Alajuela. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, most notably the production of pineapple. The pineapple is mainly sold to international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has grown in recent years, generating a larger demand for products and services, which help to mitigate the effect of immigration. Since he was very young, Clover has been dedicated to growing pineapple, so he has quite a bit of experience in caring for and maintaining this type of crop. He has a small amount of land where he has grown pineapple before, and it has given him good results when it comes time to sell it, which is why he wants to expand his crop. Thanks to this business, the quality of life of his family has improved considerably. Clober is requesting a loan of 585,000 colones to purchase pineapple startes and various supplies to give the best maintenance and help possible to his harvest, so in the end he can be rewarded and have a good production. Clober is a member of the communal bank "Luz del Futuro Saino," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to grow more on a personal and economic level. He also stresses that he is thankful to these types of organizations and easier ways to access credit so he can dedicate more time to production activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his pineapple crop

loans.name: Group Of Love

texts.en:
Group of Love consists of five borrowers led by Yarkpawolo Z. who live in Borkeza Town, which is near Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Yarkpawolo is 27 years old and married with three kids, ages two to nine. He has recently returned to high school part time to complete his degree after dropping out during the war.

Yarkpawolo runs a rice production business, using a machine to ready the rice for storage and consumption. He has been running his business for five years. Yarkpawolo is an innovator, one of the few people in Lofa County with a machine like this, so he is much sought after during the dry season. 

Yarkpawolo will use his loan to purchase fuel and make improvements to his machine to keep it running longer and be more profitable. He then plans to invest in a bigger machine to meet demand and make sure his three kids can complete school.

loans.use: For expenditure on a used and new rice machine

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim I. is a villager I. Koun Chrey village I. Kandal province. She is a rice middle-woman (wholesaler). Her husband, Mr. Nath Tha, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. I. this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil. I. order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Khim I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Khim I. is 48 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed I. a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right I. the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn B. is a villager in Deum Por village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem on this plantation because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She would also use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

Mrs. Yorn B. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en:
Jean d’Amour K. is 41 years old, married with 8 children aged between 6 and 21 years old. Jean lives at Rubavu district in the city of Gisenyi. He has been an entrepreneur selling clothes for the past 8 years. He employs one person in his business - a helper. His shop is open from 9AM to 6PM every day.

Jean is now requesting his second loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing a greater variety of clothing for sale. By receiving and using this loan prudently, with the (hoped for) profit from his business expansion, he will be able to pay school fees and provide more food for his children

loans.use: a variety of clothes

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es:
APROXIMADAMENTE A 12KM DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA MORELOS SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EL POBLADO DE SAN MIGUEL ANENECUILCO PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE AYALA MORELOS.

EN ESTE POBLADO SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE LA CAPILLA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES 7 MUJERES Y 2 HOMBRES LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO, LA SRA. RAQUEL C. R., ROBERTA T. P. Y JOSE LUIS P. C. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA, LA SRA. PORFIRIA R. G. Y ANGELA P. F. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS,PERFUMES POR CATALOGO, LA SRA. ARACELI P. C. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO, JARED URIEL C. G. SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE PLATA PERO EN LOS PUEBLITOS ALEDAÑOS A SU COMUNIDAD, REYNA C. V. SE DEDICA A LA INDUSTRIA YA QUE FABRICA TRAJES, BLUSAS, PANTALONES Y HACE HECHURAS Y DOÑA ANTONIA G. M. QUE SE DEDICA  ALA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES Y DE LA CUAL LES HABLARE UN POCO.

LA SRA. ANTONIA G. M. ES CASADA CUENTA CON 59 AÑOS DE EDAD SUESPOSO TRABAJA DE TAXISTA VIVEN EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENEN 7 HIJOS PERO YA NINGUNO ESTA CON ELLOS YA QUE TODOS ESTAN CASADOS AHORITA SOLO TIENE A SU CARGO UN NIETO DE 16 AÑOS EL CUAL LE DEJO SU HIJA CUANDO EL TENIA 1 AÑO Y DOÑA ANTONIA  LO HA CRIADO DESDE ENTONCES ELLA FORMA PARTE DE LA UDE LA CAPILLA DESDE QUE SE INICIO EL GRUPO YA LLEVAN 6 CICLOS TRABAJANDO CON NOSOTROS NOS COMENTA QUE EL GRUPO SE INICIO POR UNA PROMOTORA QUE ESTABA EN FUNDACION REALIDAD YA QUE A ELLA LE PASARON UNOS CONTACTOS DE ANENECUILCO Y FUE A VISITARLOS EN ESTE CASO VISITO A LA SRA. RAQUEL ALA CUAL LE INTERESO EL PROYECTO Y DECIDIO BUSCAR SU GENTE Y COMO DOÑA ANTONIA ES SU COMADRE LA INVITO JUNTO CON OTRAS PERSONAS Y ASI FUE COMO COMENZARON. EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE PIDIO DOÑA ANTONIA FUE DE $4000 Y LO INVIRTIO EN LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES YA QUE DESDE ANTES YA VENDIA PERO DEJO DE VENDER Y COMENZO A VENDER PICADAS Y DOBLADAS PERO COMO NO LE FUE MUY BIEN DECIDIO REGRESAR A LA VENTA DE LAS FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, SU CREDITO DE AHORITA ES DE $3000 YA QUE CON ESTA CRISIS QUE ESTAMOS PASANDO NO SE QUISO ANIMAR CON MAS HASTA QUE LA SITUACION MEJORE SU CREDITO LO VA A UTILIZAR EN COMPRAR JITOMATE,TOMATE,CEBOLLA,CHILE,AGUACATE,EJOTE,MANZANA,PLATANO,NARANJA,, CHAYOTE PARA SURTIR SU PEQUEÑO GRAN NEGOCIO YA QUE EN SU CASA TIENE UN LOCAL PEQUEÑO EL CUAL NO TIENE NINGUN NOMBRE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN CALLE 3 DE MAYO No 45 DE LA COL. LA CAPILLA EN ANENECUILCO MOR. Y AHI TIENE SU VERDURA PERO TAMBIEN SALE A RANCHEAR A TODAS LAS COLONIAS DE ANENECUILCO PARA PODER ACABAR SU MERCANCIA.

NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA A PASADO POR MUCHOS PROBLEMAS YA QUE COMO SE SALE A VENDER SE HAN METIDO A ROBAR A SU CASA EN DOS OCACIONES LLEVANDOSE DINERO,APARATOS ETC.Y QUE AUNQUE LOS MISMOS VECINOS VEN NO LE DICEN NADA SE QUEDAN CALLADOS YA QUE COMO ES UN PUEBLITO EN UN CERRO COMO QUE LES DA MIEDO QUE VALLAN A HACERLES ALGO DESPUES A ELLOS Y EN OCACIONES SU ESPOSO TAMPOCO A TENIDO TRABAJO Y TIENEN QUE VER LA FORMA PERO ELLOS TIENEN QUE SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE DICE AHORITA SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES QUE SU NIETO TERMINE SUS ESTUDIOS PARA QUE LE DEMUESTRE A SU MAMÀ QUE VALIO LA PENA QUE LO DEJARA CON SU ABUELA.Y DICE DOÑA ANTONIA QUE SI LOBA A LOGRAR POR MEDIO DE LOS PRESTAMOS Y DEL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO VA A CONTINUAR HASTA LOGRAR TODO LO QUE ELLA QUIERE.

ELLA ESPERA EN UN FUTURO PODER AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y VENDER TAMBIEN UN POCO DE ABARROTES YA QUE EN SU COMUNIDAD CASI NO HAY NEGOCIOS.


POR ULTIMO AGADECE A LA EMPRESA POR OTORGAR PRESTAMOS A PERSONAS QUE EN VERDAD LO NESECITAN Y MAAS QUE NADA POR BRINDARLES LA CONFIANZA DE SABER QUE SI LES VAN A PAGAR Y A KIVA POR ASOCIARSE CON FUNDACION REALIDAD YA QUE ES UNA EMPRESA MUY SERIA Y SOBRE TODO HONRADA.
texts.en:
The village of San Miguel Anenecuilco belongs to the Ayala Morelos municipality, which is located approximately 12 kilometers from the city of Cautla Morelos. You will find the Capilla Development Cooperative in this village. It is comprised of nine members, seven women and two men who work in commerce. Raquel C. R., Roberta T. P., and Jose Luis P. C. sell clothes. Porfirio R. G. and Angel P. F. sell cosmetics and perfumes by catalog. Araceli P. C. sells shoes by catalog. Pared Uriel C. G. sells silver in towns bordering his community. Reyna C. V. makes outfits, blouses, pants, and handicrafts. Antonia G. M. sells fruit and vegetables, and she will tell us a little about it. Antonia G. M. is 59 and married. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They have a common law marriage. They have seven children, but none of them live with them. Their children are all married, and now they are raising their 16 year old grandson. Their daughter left him when he was one. Antonia has raised him since then. She has been part of the Capilla Development Cooperative since it started. The group has worked with us for six cycles. She tells us that the group was started by a loan representative who was with Fundación Realidad. She had some contacts from Anenecuilco, and she went to visit them. One of the people she visited was Raquel, who was interested in the project. She decided to look for other people like Antonia, the Godmother to one of her children. She invited her and other people, and that is how they started. The first loan that Antonia asked for was for $4,000, which she invested in her fruit and vegetable sales. Then she stopped selling fruits and vegetables and started selling snacks and “dobladas” (folded over tortilla). That did not go very well for her, and she decided to return to selling fruits and vegetables. Her current loan is for $3,000. She did not want more until the crisis we are in improves. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, chilies, avocadoes, green beans, apples, bananas, oranges, and vegetable pears to stock her small, great business. She has a small stand in her house, which is located on the 3 de Mayo street, number 45 in the Capilla Colony in Anenecuilco Morales. That is where she has her vegetable sales, but she also goes to all of the colonies in Anenecuilco to be able to finish selling her merchandise. She tells us that she has experienced many problems like her house being robbed twice while she was out selling. They took money and appliances, etc. Even though the neighbors see, they do not say anything. They keep quiet because, being a town on a hill, they are afraid that the robbers will do something to them afterwards. At times her husband has not had work either. They have to find a way to get ahead. She says that her biggest wish now is that her grandson finish his studies to show his mother that leaving him with his grandmother was worth it. Antonia says she can do it with the loans, and with her husband’s support. She will continue until she achieves everything she wants to achieve. In the future she hopes to be able to enlarge her business and also sell a few groceries. They are hardly any of these businesses in her community. Lastly, she thanks the company for giving loans to people who truly need them. More than anything, they offer the confidence of knowing that they will be paid. She is grateful to Kiva for associating with the Fundación Realidad. It is a very serious, and above all, honorable company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar tomates, chiles, cebollas y aguacates,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 44 years old and is the father of two children. He has sixteen years experience in carpentry and established this shop six years ago. He works by customer request and works as a contractor.

The purpose behind this loan is to purchase tools and wood to raise his income as well as to expand his shop.

loans.use: To purchasing wood and a machine to cut wood

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib Q. is a married man with three children. For several years has dedicated himself to cattle breeding. He has attended to this work with great effort in order to maintain his home. He has the duty of supporting his family and for this reason, he decided to come to AqroInvest Credit Union for help in buying young cattle. It is his dream to develop his business with more loans and in this way continue to maintain his humble home. Sahib promises to repay this loan in a timely manner and thanks all KIVA lenders for trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
Vyacheslav is married and has two sons. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk. He owns two open fast food kiosks selling meat pastry, instant coffee, hot tea and baked goods. He has two vending locations at different markets in his hometown. Vyacheslav has a hired vendor who works at one of his fast food kiosks. Vyaheslav has been in this business for 11 years. His monthly net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.  

Vyacheslav is seeking a loan of 16,900 Grivnyas to re-build his kiosks, installing roller shutters to keep him, and his hired employee, warm during the cold winter season. Food items are always in high demand, despite dead season tendencies. This is why Vyacheslav believes this type of business will keep bringing him profit. One of his long-term plans is to open more vending locations and to continue expanding his business in the future.   

Note: in the photo, Vyacheslav is with his hired employee.

loans.use: To re-construct his vending stands equipping them with plastic roller shutters.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a divorced woman with two young children. She has been working as a private teacher since 2005 to earn income for her family. Today, Sanaa is asking to borrow $1,200 to prepare an adequate study room for her students, including buying chairs and tables for this purpose.

loans.use: To prepare an adequate study room, including buying chairs and tables, for her students

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea B. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are adults, while the other two are currently students. To earn a living, Andrea owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. Primarily, her income is derived from sales of snacks and other food products to her local community members. Andrea has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2006, Andrea joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Andrea recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Andrea is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325), which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snacks and other delicacies for sale. This loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Andrea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business and to pay for her kids' education.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene el negocio de venta de línea de ropa la cual las ofrece en Masaya, Malaca toya y Diriomo sus productos los vende al crédito y cada semana se encarga de recuperar lo que coloco, tiene dos personas que le trabajan los que son su hijo y esposo es un negocio de familia, la señora quiere el crédito para invertirlo en el mismo y así tener una mayor demanda y tener un mejor ingreso para su familia ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL, el negocio lo empezó con un crédito pequeño y poco a poco lo ha ido incrementando, es madre de tres hijos de los cuales solamente tiene uno a su cargo al que le da los estudios y es por el se la señora trabaja duro para que niño pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen has a business selling a clothing line and offers her products in the towns of Masay, Malacatoya and Diriomo. She sells her products on credit and every week she goes back to collect. She has two people who work for her, her son and his wife, so it's a family business. Maria is requesting the loan so she can invest in her business and thus increase her demand and her family's income. She has had three loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL and started the business with a small loan and grew it little by little. Maria has three children, only one of whom is still in school and under her care, and it's for this reason she works so hard, so that her son can keep studying.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing such as pants, blouses, socks, shirts, shoes, among other items

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en:
Sumini is 46 years of age and married with eight children between the ages of 10 and 30. Four of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a three-roomed house, where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for the children, medication and feeding the family.

Sumini  owns  a mini bakery in Kitawuluzi, selling all types of fried items like chapati, samosas and donuts. She sells to all categories of people. On average, she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 12 years. She incurs transport costs to and from the place where she buys cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. 

Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, because she works from a muddy and open place. She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for over 10 years, servicing her 20th loan and working all this time with the same group mates. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour and cooking oil. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.
.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour and jerycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a hardworking lady who runs a salon business.  She describes her business environment as busy. She previously supplied rice.  She has requested for Kes.60,000 loan to buy more salon equipment after successfully repaying a loan of Kes. 80,000.  She hopes to open up a cosmetic shop in the future.  Anne is a single mother of two.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment

loans.name: Masolidi Tenywa Olivia Group

texts.en:
T. Olivia is a hardworking businesswoman, thirty-five years old. She is married with five children schooling and has three dependents of whom one is schooling.

Olivia makes bricks and she has been making bricks for over eight years so far. She is using the loan to make more bricks for sale.

Olivia is a strong businesswoman whose future hopes are to obtain land, build a house, and improve upon the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To make more bricks for sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy responsable y amorosa, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Nilton de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. La actividad a la que Elena se dedica es el cultivo de papa y arveja, desde entonces y casi todos los días por las mañanas, junto a su esposo, trabajan en las chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosos sean con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrán en el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, es por eso que lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para extender sus cultivos y aumentar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En tanto que en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, así como también comprará insecticidas.
texts.en:
Elena, 30, is a loving and responsible mother; she lives in a leased house with her husband, Nilton, 30, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. Elena is a potato and pea farmer. She and her husband tend to their farmlands every day in the morning. They know that the more they care for their crops the better the sale price will be when they take their harvest to market. What she most enjoys about her work is planting, which she does very patiently; she’s been in this line of work for 14 years. She considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to the city’s wholesale markets. In time, she hopes to buy more land in order to expand her crops and increase production. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she knows she must be punctual with repayments if she wants to have access to future loans. Her fellow group members respect greatly because she’s a very responsible member. She will use the requested 3000 soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops as well as to buy insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia B. is from the village of Membule, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Anastacia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Anastacia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anastacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Anastacia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Angelina's Group

texts.en:
Angelina P., aged 50, is from the village of Sta. Isabel Sur. She is the group leader of a 23-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Angelina P. Group.

Angelina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  As with her previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 15000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan Angelina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita S. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita G., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Romeo G., a carpenter, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rug-and-curtain making business for quite some time now.

Agapita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her rug and curtain business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy raw materials needed to continue production of her rugs and curtains. She will be buying fabric, thread, newspapers for patterns and filler fabrics.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She wants them to have a bright future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: buying raw materials needed to continue production of her rugs and curtains. She will be buying fabric, thread, newspapers for patterns and filler fabrics

loans.name: Ephigénie

texts.fr: Ephigénie S. est une femme de 36 ans,e elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du  Banc Villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda depuis son inauguration le 27 juin 2008. Elle a en 2 ans reçu 04 prêts qu'elle a à chaque fois remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle fait vendre divers produits tels du riz, de l'huile végétale, des boîtes de conserve, du sucre etc. Elle bénéficie des services d'une personne qu'elle rémunère mensuellement. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa boutique en achetant plus de marchandises. Elle contribue financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et soutien son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ephigénie S. is a married, 36 year-old woman with four children at home. She has been a member of the Tambacounda Catholic Women Banc Villageois since it opened on June 27, 2008. In two years, she has gotten four loans and each was repaid. She has a shop where she sells products such as rice, vegetable oil, canned goods, sugar, etc. She has an employee who is paid monthly. With her new loan, she wants to buy more goods to improve her store. She contributes financially to improving her family's living conditions and helps her husband with the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products in her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married woman from Lebanon and a mother of 3 school-age children. She has operated an established  tailoring business from her home for the last 15 years. She makes all kind of clothes, pants, shirts, robes etc. and offers clothes repair services to her customers. Over the years, she was able to help her husband with the household expenses and to pay for her children schooling. Today, she is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more textiles needed to meet the needs of her clients. She specifically notes that she will be able to deliver more designs and a greater variety of textile brand to her customers. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of textiles

loans.name: Mohamed Alieu

texts.en:
Mohamed is 24 years old and is married with twelve dependents. He started business selling foodstuffs, when he lost his job. He later changed to selling pharmaceutical drugs, which he has done for the past five years. His pharmacy is located in the main lorry (truck) park in Makeni city.

Mohamed has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to pay the rent for his pharmacy and to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell. He intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate his family members and buy a house.

loans.use: To pay rent for his pharmacy and to buy more essential drugs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie J. is from Banaderos Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, married, and has 4 adult-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a transportation services business which provides motor transport to clients. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years. In 2006, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina I. is 43 and married with 5 children. She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sina has one year of experience in this business. She needs a loan of 1700 talas to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $235 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sina joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maisa

texts.en:
Maisa M. is a 24 years old woman from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip, Maisa is a wife and mother of one daughter and one son. Maisa and her husband Hussam A Dein work in the farm together taking care of hens and raising them.

Maisa and Hussam have started their project three months ago, and they still need a lot of work to have it as they want. Maisa came to FATEN and took a $1,500 loan to purchase more hens and feeds. Maisa and Hussam raise laying hens, they started also distributing to few shops and would like to expand their network.

Hussam A Dein pictures here in the farm as Maisa didn't want to show in the picture for sociA. reasons.

loans.use: buy hens feed

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 30-year-old married man with one child.  He has been operating a cafeteria for six years.  In his cafeteria, he mainly sells chicken.  He is also a farmer who grows maize to earn a living.  He hopes to become a self-reliant businessman in the future.  He wants to expand his business and start rearing his own chickens for sale.  He has been able to improve his business with the support of Faulu Kenya.  

Isaac has requested 80,000 Kes to buy chickens, sodas, and a freezer.  He says that he is a hardworking man who is aiming to get to higher levels in his business.

loans.use: To buy chickens, sodas, and a freezer

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gasoline in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara M. is 41 years old and married to Nolari M..   He supports five people in his family.

M. is a farmer and does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for last seven years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy young sheep for fattening to sell later at a profit and also to prepare his land for wheat farming.
	
With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large scale farmer in cattle rearing and wheat farming.

loans.use: To buy sheep stock and prepare land for wheat farming.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Рачабов Дилшод житель города Куляб. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, пожарник. По профессии не работает. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже три с половиной года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Dilshod R. is a resident of Kulob.  He is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a vocational education as a fireman. He does not work in his trade.  He works in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home.  He basically raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this kind of work for three and a half years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Sanilyn

texts.en:
Sanilyn E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 37 years old, married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 5. To make a living, Sanilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sanilyn works hard to sustain the education of five of her children. She hopes to have them finish college and have bright futures.
Sanilyn joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sanilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny C. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 38 years old. Manny is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Manny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Manny has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manny is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Manny from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria S. B. es una señora de 29 años de edad, esta casada con Jesus quien es un poco mayor que ella, pues tiene 40 años y se dedica al oficio de chofer de taxi, Luz tiene un hijo de nombre Jose Antonio de 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, que hace mas de 3 años que inicio con esta actividad comercial.
Luz Maria solicito un credito para la compra de mas productos dentro del cual figuran diferentes tipos de pescados, como es muy en comun la mojarra tilapia y blanca, el pargo, el huachinango, el robalo, el cuatete, el sacamiche, lisa, jurel, también el camaron y los mejillones conocidos como "tichindas"estos pescados son de mayor consumo y los comercializa frescos, salados y asados, cabe mencioner que esta activiodad es un poco difícil ya que cuando escazea el producto los que dependen de esto se ven afectados ellos y sus familias.
Luz comercializa sus productos fuera de su comunidad, recorriendo otras poblaciones. Para hecer posible sus ventas, no tiene problemas para colocar su mercancia ya que en la zona donde ella vive y vende, no es muy usual encontrar pescados y es por eso que es una ventaja que ella tiene.
Los sueños mas deseados de Luz es tener un establecimiento fijo de comercio, por el cual ya no tenga que ambular de un lugar a otro, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda y que su niño estudie para que mañana no carezca de preparacion.
Luz Maria les manda un saludo a los que apoya a kiva,a fundacion relaidad y todo el equipo de trabajo, les desa una feliz navidad y que DIOS los guarde.
texts.en:
Luz Maria S. B. is 29 years old, and is married to Jesus, who is a bit older than she is; Jesus is 40 years old, and makes a living as a taxi driver.  Luz has a son named Jose Antonio, who is 3 years old.  Luz makes a living selling fish, which she has done since she started in this commercial activity more than 3 years ago.  Luz is asking for a loan so that she can purchase more products, which include different types of fish such as mojarra (including tilapia and white mojarra), sea bream, red snapper, sea bass, cuatete, sacamiche, mullet, and scad in addition to shrimp and mussels that are known as “tichindas”.  These fish sell well and Luz sells them fresh, salted, and roasted.  It is worth mentioning that this activity is a bit difficult, since whenever there is a fish shortage it affects those who depend on the products as well as their families.   

Luz sells her products outside of her community by travelling to other towns.  It is unusual to find fish in the area where Luz lives and sells her products, and that is to Luz’s advantage, and a reason why she has no problem selling her merchandise.  

What Luz wishes for the most is to have her own regular place of business, since then she would not have to walk from one place to another.  She also wants to improve her home, and wants her son to study so that he will be prepared for the future.  Luz sends her greetings to those at the Kiva Foundation who have helped her, and is grateful to everyone on the work team.  She wishes them a Merry Christmas and hopes that God will look after them.

loans.use: Purchasing seafood products such as mojarra, red snapper, sea bream, scad, mullet, cuatete, sacamiche, shrimp, and mussels.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin S. is a farming laborer and a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family living while her husband, Mr. Vet Ut, is a construction worker who is able to earn some money to support his family, too. In the present, she has a problem because her husband’s work place is far away from her home. So Mrs. Kin S. is requesting for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband transports to do work. She and her family are living in Samraong village in Takeo province. They have four children whom all are studying in local public school. Her husband is taken the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El senor Javier A., tiene 40 anos de edad, habita en la comarca Palo Verde, del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo en Jinotega, situado al norte de Esteli, soltero y con 2 hijos.
Don Javier tiene mas de 20 anos de experiencia en las actividades agricolas, pero tambien en la compra/venta de granos basicos.
Actualmente es independiene en sus negocios, sus ingresos se centran en estas 2 actividades principalmente; el recuerda que el inicio por cuenta propia, pero recibio Asistencia Tecnica de una Casa Comercial llamada PROAGRO y esto le ayudo mucho a tecnificar y ampliar sus conocimientos.
Realizo este credito para el financiamiento de Siembra de Tomate, cree que es muy importante este tipo de credito, porque son la base o parte fundamental de las personas q se dedican a este negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier A. is 40 years old and lives in Palo Verde county in the town of Pueblo Nuevo in Jinotega which is north of Esteli.  He is single with two children.

Javier has more than 20 years' experience in crop farming and in buying and selling staple grains.  He has his own business and his income is based on two main activities.  He established his own business with technical assistance from a company called PROAGRO.  This allowed him to broaden his skills and knowledge.

He is using this loan to finance his tomato crop.  He believes this type of credit is very important since it is the basis for people like himself who do this type of work.

loans.use: For tomato crop

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.es:
Anilesis pertenece al grupo Ruth y Esther 2, un grupo formado por 5 mujeres, dedicada a la venta de diferentes productos como: Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  Cada una de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Samana, es unas de las comunidad, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o de manera ambulante. 

Anilesis posee una familia conformada por su su hija y su pareja. En una vivienda  alquilada, la cual pagan gracias al esfuerzo que ambos (padre y madre) ya que ambos llevan ingresos a su vivienda.
